title: Machine Learning & Computer Vision Engineer
company_name: TeiaCare & Ancelia, AI for Care Homes
description:
Company Description

TeiaCare is an Italian start-up founded in 2018 by Guido Magrin and Luca Iozzia with the aim of seeking solutions to optimize assistance of residents in care homes. On this quest we have raised over ‚Ç¨2M in public and private funding.

Ancelia, our solution, is the first AI-powered operating system designed to bring more transparency to care homes (RSA & RSD, in Italy) on three levels: among carers, between carers and management, and between management and families.

We are looking for an exceptional Machine Learning and Computer Vision Engineer to join our young and dynamic team with Full-Time permanent contract. Our ideal candidate is reliable, flexible and an effective worker in a small team environment, must be a critical thinker, dedicated, self-motivated and can demonstrate‚ÄØintegrity in every aspect of the job.

Job Description

In this role you will join our R&D Team bringing your creative problem-solving skills in a rapidly evolving and cross-functional team.

You will be involved in the implementation of novel algorithms based on the state-of-the-art scientific research, latest trends and news.

We rely on your soft skills to coordinate with other team members to make sure that your job is aligned with team‚Äôs decisions.

We expect you to have deep‚ÄØtechnical skills‚ÄØthat allow you to take the ownership of our Machine Learning and AI infrastructure. You can work proficiently with the team as well as solo developer.

Qualifications

4+ years‚ÄØof relevant experience in a similar role;
You are comfortable working with Python and relevant Data Science packages (such as numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas...);
We expect you to be proficient in Computer Vision using OpenCV;
Our Machine Learning and Deep Learning stack are based on PyTorch and Tensorflow2. We thrive on using the latest technologies;
You will be working on novel Pattern Recognition, Object and Action Detection, Segmentation algorithms;
Git‚ÄØand‚ÄØAgile‚ÄØsoftware development methodology are our core;
Fluent in written and spoken‚ÄØItalian‚ÄØand‚ÄØEnglish;
High fit with our company values:‚ÄØ transparency,‚ÄØempathy and‚ÄØambition;

What Constitutes a Big Plus

Modern C++, Bash
Reinforcement Learning, Unsupervised Learning
Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
Docker, Kubernetes
Windows and Linux operating systems
Experience with Testing
Design and implement algorithms that best leverage modern hardware and distributed computing systems (i.e.: CPUs, GPUs, TPUs, Cloud, FPGAs. etc.)

Additional Information

Benefits

Getting in on the ground floor of an innovative mission-first, people-first company where you will have the support to pursue your passions;
Flexible work hours & smart working;
Competitive salary;
Lunch tickets;
Team building activities;
Stock options.

If you think you have what it takes, do not hesitate to apply!

title: Computer Vision/ Artificial Intelligence Specialist
description:
Direct message the job poster from Linkverse

Pamela Tura
HR Generalist

Do you want to join a team of world class scientists bringing Artificial Intelligence to real world Healthcare?¬†

We are an established enterprise, subsidiary of Cosmo Group (www.cosmopharma.com).¬†

We are looking for¬†Developers,¬†Scientists and Engineers to help push the boundaries of AI and Computer Vision in medical devices.¬†¬†




One of the jewels in our portfolio is GI Genius‚Ñ¢, a new AI-enhanced endoscopy aid device for the detection of colorectal lesions during¬†colonoscopy:¬†

https://www.cosmopharma.com/products/gi-genius¬†

https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6544635391792734208

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qZgsa-vZ2V0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AblniEzEgtY




We‚Äôre recruiting for multiple positions within the AI team, so we invite applicants of all seniority and experience levels.¬†




Responsibilities¬†

The AI team provides the know-how to accurately identify the unmet clinical needs¬†in collaboration with Key opinion leaders (KOLs), and to translate these unmet needs into ad-hoc solutions able to bridge performance with scalability.¬†As part of the AI team, you will:¬†master cutting-edge research in Computer Vision and Machine Learning; collaborate with¬†the Engineering team to identify technical limitations, then creating new models‚Äîor optimizing existing ones‚Äîcapable of overcoming them;¬†contribute to the development of¬†a strategy for medical data harvesting and annotation.¬†




What we offer¬†

Huge impact. You‚Äôll make a major contribution to real-world medical devices used by thousands all around the world. The quality of your work will make a decisive difference both to¬†cancer patients¬†and to¬†our¬†company.¬†
Fast personal growth. You will work with some of the brightest and most skilled people you‚Äôll ever meet. However, we look for talent and leave divas at the door:¬†you'll find a group of colleagues who are eager to learn and teach their secrets, our keywords are reciprocal support and respect.¬†
Cutting edge tools¬†and data. You get the best hardware on the market and the¬†largest collection of¬†high-quality¬†medical data¬†you could need¬†to compete on the medical device world stage.¬†
Optional remote working.¬†The AI team¬†is located in¬†Lainate, Milano, Italy, and we offer full and partial remote options¬†based on experience levels.¬†We care about your productivity¬†and it‚Äôs¬†up to you to always be responsible with your work, no matter where you are or what schedule you‚Äôre keeping.¬†
Market salary. Our compensation package is highly competitive and can grow rapidly, depending on your performance and seniority.¬†




What we look for¬†

Relevant background or expertise. You hold an MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Vision, AI, Mathematics, Physics,¬†Statistics,¬†or a related technical field.¬†
Relevant knowledge.¬†Programming experience in any relevant language ‚Äì Python, C++, etc.¬†You‚Äôre familiar with Deep Learning and convolutional neural networks (ideally, in their application to image and video processing, e.g. object classification/detection/tracking).¬†You have strong skills in software development¬†and knowledge of machine learning and computer vision¬†techniques.¬†A personal¬†github¬†page is appreciated.¬†¬†
Reasoning and depth of learning. You‚Äôre structured and creative enough to solve most challenging problems independently, given the necessary knowledge. You learn new concepts and skills rapidly, and love to nerd out and go in-depth.¬†
Passion for the topic. You have a long-standing, proven passion for AI in general and Computer Vision specifically.¬†You are committed to make a difference for patients.¬†
Good communication skills. You can pose questions with clarity and explain your reasoning concisely.¬†
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.¬†




Location¬†

Lainate, Milan, Italy or fully remote if you can‚Äôt (or don‚Äôt want to) relocate. If you choose the on-site option, keep in mind that it‚Äôs still fine to sometimes work remotely, and that we offer support for relocation.¬†




Commitment & contract¬†

Full-time, permanent.¬†

¬†¬†

¬†We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate¬†on the basis of¬†race, religion,¬†colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.¬†¬†

description:

Vera Zapelli
Recruiting & People Engagement presso Agos

Junior Data Scientist

Per potenziare i nostri team di Data Science e Modelli siamo alla ricerca di due candidati che saranno inseriti all‚Äôinterno delle Direzione Trasformazione e Supporto che ci aiutino a scoprire le informazioni nascoste in grandi quantit√†, i candidati seguiranno un percorso di¬†inserimento¬†per occuparsi di:

¬†

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Definire ed elaborare i modelli analitici e predittivi attraverso tecniche di Machine Learning (Logistic Regression, Neural Network, GBM, Random Forest, XGBoost, ‚Ä¶), avendo cura di rimanere costantemente aggiornato rispetto all‚Äôevoluzione della tecnologia

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision
description:
Direct message the job poster from Plexagon

Luca Giacomel
Co-Founder at Plexagon | We are hiring!

Machine Learning Engineer,¬†¬†Computer Vision¬†

Plexagon is looking for a world-class ML Engineer to join our international team.

Fully Remote (worldwide) or from our Milan office




Job Description

Plexagon is an app publisher focused on mobile photo and video üì∏ editing. Our apps use Computer Vision and Machine Learning tools ü§ñ to support the new generation of content creators üöÄ




We are building the PLX-Editor, an exciting photo/video editor SDK that supports content-aware filters and effects based on state-of-the-art computer vision research. The PLX-Editor is the core of all our apps and, as a Machine Learning Engineer focusing on computer vision, we want you to help us grow it!




Required Qualifications¬†

Experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Java, Matlab, R, C, or C++.
Experience designing complex convolutional networks with either TensorFlow or PyTorch and using the¬†main state-of-the-art architectures.
Advanced knowledge of Frequentist/Bayesian statistics. For example, you know how to fit a Poisson distribution over a dataset and how to compute its expected value.
STEM degree or equivalent work experience.
Startup attitude‚Äîyou run or participated in entrepreneurial projects and understand how to balance theoretical research with creating value for customers.
Motivational Letter (which you can write in the "About You" section of our online application). This is your opportunity to show us that you read this job posting and care about the position. Bonus points if your letter includes one of the points in the next section.




One of these would make you a perfect fit

You have a Ph.D. or research experience focused on Deep Learning, Computer Vision, or Statistics.
You have experience building shaders with¬†Apple's Metal API, or the OpenGL API, or the Vulkan API.
You worked on Neural Networks that run in consumer-facing software with thousands of active users.




What you get working with us

Competitive pay and equity.
The latest apple hardware (Mac, iPhone, Headphones, and anything else you might need).
1-month vacation per year + untracked time off if you need more.
Freedom to work from wherever you want.
A diverse and international work environment that operates in English‚Äîwe come from countries like Italy, Lebanon, Sweden, Brazil, Japan, Argentina, and we want to keep growing!
Feel the excitement of working on products downloaded by millions of users.

title: R&I Data Scientist
description:
Job Overview And Responsibilities

Solvay is taking a leap for digital transformation to accelerate Solvay G.R.O.W. strategy, and our sustainability roadmap, Solvay One Planet. Digital will allow Solvay to move differently from the past, transforming all aspects of the business, from channels and processes, to data and operating models, and ultimately the entire Group culture. To make this Digital Transformation happen, Solvay has created in 2021 a dedicated Digital entity headed by a Chief Digital Officer and is reinforcing Data Science by recruiting Data Scientists across the globe to develop, maintain and improve advanced analytics models with data science techniques. As a Data Scientist you will join a multidisciplinary team, you will drive the creation of actionable insight from our data lakes, develop new approaches/algorithms, to accelerate research & development (discover new formulations and materials), produce more efficiently (improve processes, planning and scheduling) and finally, accelerate sustainability. You will be instrumental in delivering our digital and technology transformation. Large scale investment in Digital & Information Technology is expected over the next five years to accelerate our transformation and reduce complexity as well as running costs in line with our Purpose and G.R.O.W. strategy. Join the journey !

The Research & Innovation (R&I) Data Scientist will support our initiative in Prescriptive Data Science or Data-Driven Optimization.

He/she Will Solve Optimal Decision Problems Like

Given customer needs and set of constraints, which product to use and at what quantities?
Can we learn an algorithm or model for this based on historical data?
Given some data, what experiment to do next so as to design a product with certain target properties?


The R&I Data Scientist will start by working on the Digital Mining initiative, which aims to radically shorten the bridge between R&I and the customer. This is a global project spread over stakeholders in 4 continents in deep collaboration with Global Business Units and customers. In the initiative, based on live customer data, we will provide optimal dynamic chemistry that maximizes KPIs set by the customer. Technical challenges include inference and optimization based on observational data, varying inputs, correlated variables, limited Signal To Noise ratio and dealing with live dynamic systems.

He/she will work closely with Solvay domain experts.

Responsibilities Include

Deeply understand customer needs and domain logic
Implement technically competent and practical solutions that solve customer problems
Curate data from multiple sources with careful data cleaning
Communicate results and support stakeholders in deployment and use of the solutions


Education and Experience

PhD (preferred) or MS in Computer Science, Control Theory, Process Control, Optimization, Mathematics, Physics, Artificial Intelligence, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Reinforcement Learning or equivalent
Practical experience in working with Optimization problems, especially data-driven optimization
Very good communication skills in English


Skills

Technical skills:

Excellent problem solving skills
Ability to formulate and deliver practical data driven solutions
Deep conceptual and practical knowledge of common statistical models, machine learning, key aspects of data pipeline such as data cleaning
Strong practical understanding of Optimization, especially Data-Driven Optimization
Awareness of limitations of observational data and notions of causal inference (e.g., confounding, collider, etc)
Good programming skills in R, Python, or other statistical scripting
(Prefered) Control Theory and Optimization, Process Control, Real-Time Optimization
(Prefered) Design of Experiments, Response Surface Methods, Surrogate Modelling, A/B Testing and Multi-Armed Bandits, Reinforcement Learning
(Desired) Training and experience with Agile practices


Soft Skills

Highly collaborative mindset
Ability to build strong relationships with peers and colleagues across the Group R&I organization
Self-motivated and independent: The candidate will need to be able to manage a full analytics process from business interview to modelling to results & explanation
Communication skills to present updates, risks and issues in a clear & timely manner
Show more

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our purpose at Vodafone is to connect for a better future. As a Global Communications Technology company, we put the customer at the heart of everything we do. We are forever challenging, pushing boundaries and discovering innovative ways to connect our customers with their digital societies.

We connect people, businesses, and communities across the globe to create the future. We earn customer loyalty, experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.

Join our journey as we connect for a better future. Ready?

We are looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive ‚ÄúSenior Data Scientist‚Äù to join our big data & AI team. As a senior data scientist, you will be responsible to provide actionable business insights that drive revenue, reduce cost, and improve customer experience.

You will be working with key stakeholders within Vodafone Italy to generate hypotheses and supports the analytics modelling managers to create models that answer impactful business questions.

As Senior Data Scientist Your Main Responsibilities Will Involve

Delving into data from different systems, structured and unstructured, both batch and real time, to discover hidden relationships and useful information
Translating complex datasets into key strategy insight and powerful capabilities to the business
Using machine learning /AI algorithms to perform modeling on network investment, predictive maintenance
Using machine learning /AI algorithms to perform modeling for marketing and sales ‚Äì churn models, next best action modelling, customer segmentation, store locations etc...
Developing insightful dashboard to enable faster decision making
Identifying new data sources and evaluate emerging technologies for data discovery usage
Mentoring young data scientists in the team
Presenting the results to technical and non- technical audiences
Identifying new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across Vodafone‚Äôs global team
Participating in a community of Vodafone data scientists working in numerous countries

Your Skills And Qualifications Must Include

Master‚Äôs Degree in quantitative fields like Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, and Engineering
4+ years experience in developing, implementing and maintaining Machine Learning /AI models and Optimization Algorithms
Hands-on experience with the Big Data Analytics landscape and related tools, especially Hadoop, Hive/Impala, Spark (pyspark). Previous experience in performing analytics on cloud platforms is a plus
Fluency in coding using Python and experience in Python data analysis libraries such as pandas, numpy and scikit-learn
Expert level experience with the mathematical foundations of modern machine learning/AI algorithms and statistics
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical results to non-technical audiences
Ability to guide junior data scientists in their skill sets, motivate them, and build the company‚Äôs foundation for future growth
Curiosity, creativity, and an empirical mindset
Being detail-oriented

Location

Milan

title: Data Scientist
description:
Direct message the job poster from Generali Italia

Cecilia Tasinato, Assoc CIPD
HR Specialist - Employer Branding & Digital Recruiting at Generali

Generali Italia, primo Gruppo assicurativo italiano, posizionato tra i principali player mondiali di riferimento con un approccio innovativo e tecnologicamente all‚Äôavanguardia, opera su tutto il territorio nazionale fornendo un servizio ad oltre 6 milioni di clienti.¬†¬†




All'interno del team di Advanced Analytics per la struttura Data Science stiamo cercando un Data Scientist che sar√† responsabile dell'analisi dei dati e dell'implementazione di modelli matematici e di machine learning all'interno delle principali aree di business, con l'uso delle pi√π recenti metodologie attualmente impiegate da altre industrie nello spazio Big Data.




Per affrontare tali attivit√† sono necessarie forti capacit√† analitiche, buona conoscenza delle statistiche e della programmazione oltre ad uno approccio innovativo e creativo volto ad identificare un valore aggiunto per le societ√† del Gruppo.




Il Data Scientist lavorer√† in forte allineamento con gli Analisti aziendali, le diverse funzioni del Gruppo e le Business Unit al fine di risolvere compiti specifici.¬†¬†

Cosa farai




La velocit√† e dinamicit√† del settore in cui operiamo ci impone di prendere continue decisioni in tempo reale, come ad esempio la definizione del prezzo di una specifica copertura assicurativa o la necessit√† di un controllo antifrode per un sinistro denunciato. description:
We are looking for¬†a Machine Learning Stageur for a 6 months internship experience joining the Engineering department.

¬†

This Job-Ad is also open to persons belonging to protected categories ‚Äì pursuant to Law 68/1999.

Company Profile

We at Eidosmedia are world leader in content management and digital publishing solutions. Our software covers the entire lifecycle of content, from authoring, management, workflow, design, to sharing, publishing and delivery, with open technologies and modern frameworks.

We are innovators and disruptors, and we help our customers maximize the productivity and flexibility of their operations through the application of modern, digital technologies.

What you will do

Learn how international newspapers are being produced

title: Motor Quantitative Expert
description:
About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.

At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 13,000 employees across the world.

We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?

About The Role

Technological developments like autonomous cars and telematics solutions are having a big impact on Motor insurance. To play a substantial role in this and other innovative areas, a Product and Technology Hub has been set up within Swiss Re, building telematics products and developing new technologies, to shape future frontiers of mobility.

Do you have a real passion for innovation and new products definitions? Do you want to help us set as leader in the telematics market?

We are looking for highly motivated people who will take on the role of Motor Quantitative Expert, joining a rapidly growing team of scientists and insurance professionals, responsible for developing product concepts and scoring capability for telematics-based policies and the automotive sector. You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues from various countries, background and experience who join efforts to develop innovative telematics solutions, in tight collaboration with internal professionals and clients.

Are you ready to take the challenge?

You Will

Apply advanced statistical techniques (supervised and unsupervised) to build, maintain, and improve predictive models to steer decision processes;
Support data engineers and IT in developing the in-house big data telematics platform;
Perform cluster analysis, parameter testing and selection in risk premium scoring;
Test and validate hypotheses using what-if scenario approach;
Collaborate with stakeholders/clients in identifying the business requirements and deliver new and tailored insurance solutions

We are excited to get to know you if you:

Are focused on delivery time and quality
Are agile in adapting analysis techniques to manage different scenarios
Are keen on task prioritization and organization
Are able to work independently, under pressure and on multiple and conflicting priorities

About You

Master's or Ph.D. in quantitative discipline, e.g., mathematics, actuarial science, physics, statistics, computer science, engineering
5 or more years of relevant quantitative and qualitative analysis experience (Ph.D. assumed as acquired experience)
Advanced use of statistical software (e.g. Matlab / R / SAS) and strong programming skills (e.g. SQL / Python / C++/ C#)
Solid knowledge in machine learning and cloud base computing (Hadoop / Spark)
Strong skills in statistical analysis, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate modelling with both large and limited databases

Constitute a Plus

Experience with big data extraction, processing and analysis
Experience in financial market (primary motor insurance, bank, consultancy)
Knowledge in the fields of telematics and automotive
High degree of flexibility and can-do working style
Practical and solution oriented approach
Great teammate with communication and interpersonal skills

Fluency in English is mandatory. Other languages are a plus (e.g. Italian, German)

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

title: GUCCI Data Scientist
description:
Summary

Summary

For the Gucci Global Data Science team based in Milan, we are currently seeking English speaking Experienced Data Scientists.

In this role, you will support the business in central decision making processes, have the opportunity to collaborate with teams across different regions and areas of the business leveraging Gucci‚Äôs rich data sources, infrastructure and the power of machine learning and advanced analytics.

About us

Influential, innovative and progressive, Gucci is reinventing a wholly modern approach to fashion. Under the new vision of creative director Alessandro Michele, the House has redefined luxury for the 21st century, further reinforcing its position as one of the world‚Äôs most desirable fashion houses. The Gucci Data Science team is the new kid on the block, bringing fresh perspectives and a new way of working that will help the company in continuing its innovation path leveraging the power of data and ML.

Job Description

How you will contribute


You will develop data science projects by collaborating with different areas of the business and deploy them in a production environment using machine learning stacks.
You will also be involved in knowledge sharing with other data scientists in the team to create robust and innovative solutions and a strong sense of community.
You will identify, manipulate, aggregate and explore relevant data sources to perform statistical analyses and "deep dives" to understand business problems at stake.
You will design, implement, measure and take ownership of solutions, that you will ¬†present and discuss with business stakeholders.¬†
You will follow research literature and test new approaches to tackle complex business problems and you will share and discuss the findings with the entire team.
You will be learning new skills in statistics, machine learning, programming and data visualization and adapt them to the specificity of the luxury industry.


About you

We are looking for candidates with 2-3 years of experience as Data scientist with the following skills:


Solving problems with machine learning algorithms (Random Forests, boosting algorithms, clustering, time series forecasting models...)
Data exploration, data quality assessment and cleansing
Developing clean, well documented and tested code
Collaborate well in a team environment
Sensitive to users‚Äô needs to understand the problems at stake
Proficient written and verbal communication skills
English spoken and written mandatory
Experience with Deep Learning frameworks is a plus


Our team is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe people in all their diversity ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, neurodiversity, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì are the key to solve the complex data science projects we are working on.

title: Fellow, Data Science - QuantumBlack
description:
Qualifications

Bachelor or MSc or PhD level degree in a discipline such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or engineering.
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Methodical yet creative problem solver
Experience in applying data science and machine learning methods to real world problems


What You'll Do

You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally.

You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role Responsibilities

Work on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world‚Äôs largest organisations to solve real world problems
Develop data science products and solutions for clients as well as for our data science team
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in machine learning, engineering and design
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write ‚Äòblack‚Äô papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
Attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as one global team as well as Data Science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers.
Work within one of the largest and most advanced data science teams in London, support the Lead Data Scientists to develop data science products


Who You'll Work With

You will be based in Milan and will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using maths, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our purpose at Vodafone is to connect for a better future. As a Global Communications Technology company, we put the customer at the heart of everything we do. We are forever challenging, pushing boundaries and discovering innovative ways to connect our customers with their digital societies.
We connect people, businesses, and communities across the globe to create the future. We earn customer loyalty, experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.
Join our journey as we connect for a better future. Ready?

We are looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive ‚ÄúSenior Data Scientist‚Äù to join our big data & AI team. As a senior data scientist, you will be responsible to provide actionable business insights that drive revenue, reduce cost, and improve customer experience.
You will be working with key stakeholders within Vodafone Italy to generate hypotheses and supports the analytics modelling managers to create models that answer impactful business questions.

As Senior Data Scientist Your Main Responsibilities Will Involve

Delving into data from different systems, structured and unstructured, both batch and real time, to discover hidden relationships and useful information
Translating complex datasets into key strategy insight and powerful capabilities to the business
Using machine learning /AI algorithms to perform modeling on network investment, predictive maintenance
Using machine learning /AI algorithms to perform modeling for marketing and sales ‚Äì churn models, next best action modelling, customer segmentation, store locations etc...
Developing insightful dashboard to enable faster decision making
Identifying new data sources and evaluate emerging technologies for data discovery usage
Mentoring young data scientists in the team
Presenting the results to technical and non- technical audiences
Identifying new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across Vodafone‚Äôs global team
Participating in a community of Vodafone data scientists working in numerous countries

Your Skills And Qualifications Must Include

Master‚Äôs Degree in quantitative fields like Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, and Engineering
4+ years experience in developing, implementing and maintaining Machine Learning /AI models and Optimization Algorithms
Hands-on experience with the Big Data Analytics landscape and related tools, especially Hadoop, Hive/Impala, Spark (pyspark). Previous experience in performing analytics on cloud platforms is a plus
Fluency in coding using Python and experience in Python data analysis libraries such as pandas, numpy and scikit-learn
Expert level experience with the mathematical foundations of modern machine learning/AI algorithms and statistics
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical results to non-technical audiences
Ability to guide junior data scientists in their skill sets, motivate them, and build the company‚Äôs foundation for future growth
Curiosity, creativity, and an empirical mindset
Being detail-oriented

Location: Milan

title: Data scientist
description:
Publish Date May 31, 2021

Location

Milano, Lombardia, Italy



Company Atos

Atos √® leader mondiale nella Digital Transformation, con un fatturato annuo di 13 miliardi di euro, circa 120.000 dipendenti in 73 paesi e oltre 1.300 persone in Italia, con un forte e continuo programma di crescita. Servendo una clientela globale, il Gruppo offre servizi di consulenza e di Systems Integration, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, e soluzioni Big Data & Cyber-security. Con la sua profonda esperienza tecnologica e conoscenza del settore, il Gruppo lavora con clienti in diversi settori di attivit√† Difesa, Servizi finanziari, Salute, Produzione, Media, Servizi pubblici, Vendita al dettaglio, Telecomunicazioni e Trasporti. Il Gruppo √® partner mondiale nel campo delle tecnologie informatiche per i giochi olimpici e paraolimpici ed √® quotato sul mercato Euronext di Parigi.

Atos Italia opera in 4 sedi (Milano, Napoli, Roma e Brescia) e rispecchia i trend positivi del Gruppo, con una crescita significativa non solo in termini di fatturato ma anche di marginalit√†. Atos Italia √® uno dei pochi fornitori di servizi IT in grado di fornire supporto completo e integrato di Servizi, Consulenza, System Integration e Outsourcing per clienti in ogni segmento di mercato operando con i maggiori gruppi industriali e di servizi, con le principali societ√† di Energia e

nelle primarie societ√† del settore pubblico.

All'interno del team di Advanced Analytics per la struttura Data Science stiamo cercando un Data Scientist che sar√† responsabile dell'analisi dei dati e dell'implementazione di modelli matematici e di machine learning all'interno delle principali aree di business, con l'uso delle pi√π recenti metodologie attualmente impiegate da altre industrie nello spazio Big Data.

Per affrontare tali attivit√† sono necessarie forti capacit√† analitiche, buona conoscenza delle statistiche e della programmazione oltre ad uno approccio innovativo e creativo volto ad identificare un valore aggiunto per il cliente.

Il Data Scientist lavorer√† in forte allineamento con gli Analisti aziendali, le diverse funzioni del Cliente e le Business Unit al fine di risolvere compiti specifici.

Il/la candidato/a selezionato/a si occuper√† di

Lavorare a stretto contatto con le parti interessate per identificare e risolvere i problemi aziendali rilevati
Individuare i database per estrarre informazioni rilevanti allo sviluppo dei modelli di machine learning
Creare algoritmi e modelli di simulazione utilizzando linguaggi di programmazione
Elaborare i risultati dell'analisi al fine di fornire raccomandazioni attuabili nelle altre unit√† aziendali
Mantenere i contatti con gli analisti aziendali e con le Business Unit per misurare i benefici delle loro attivit√†
Sviluppare le best practice per l'analisi dei dati
Guidare la raccolta di nuovi dati e il raffinamento delle fonti di dati esistenti

ll/la candidato/a ideale sar√† in possesso dei seguenti requisiti

Esperienza nel campo della Data Science (minimo 2 anni)
Master in discipline scientifiche (Statistica, Econometria, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria)
Conoscenza professionale dei linguaggi di programmazione (ad es Python, SQL, Java, Scala)
Esperienza approfondita nella risoluzione di problemi analitici mediante algoritmi come GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, Neural Network, etc.
Comprensione approfondita delle tecniche di Machine Learning e Deep Learning, inclusa una conoscenza approfondita delle statistiche applicate in generale
Conoscenza di strumenti di data visualization e BI come Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Conoscenza delle librerie di sviluppo modelli come SciKit Learn, TensorFLow; Keras, etc.
Forte interesse per tecniche avanzate di Data Science come Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision
Livello di inglese fluente
Buone capacit√† di comunicazione orale e scritta
Capacit√† di lavorare come parte di un team
Creativit√† e pensiero innovativo
Capacit√† di lavorare sotto pressione, gestire il carico di lavoro e rispettare le scadenze

Nice to have

Competenze sul mercato delle Utilities
Familiarit√† con le architetture dei Big Data (ad esempio Hadoop, Hive) e Cloud
Conoscenza di ulteriori linguaggi di programmazione
Laurea specialistica (dottorato di ricerca) in discipline scientifiche

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong.

Valentina Battello

GERI HDP, Gruppo leader nel settore dei servizi alle imprese, presente sul mercato italiano ed europeo da pi√π di 25 anni e specializzato nella Gestione e nel Recupero del Credito e nel BPO, per il potenziamento della propria struttura, ricerca un/una:

YOUR IMPACT

Manipulates data to deliver smarter business outcomes. Consults internally and externally on leveraged data solutions empowering. Is the expert in application of data for the business.

title: Data Scientist - Core
description:
Job Description

For our Milan or Verona office or fully-remote(Shengen Area), we are looking for a Data Scientist - Core with strong technical skills and good business acumen.

Who We Are

Everli is Europe‚Äôs leading marketplace for online grocery shopping and one of its fastest growing scale-ups. Our mission is to help people achieve peace of mind by simplifying the grocery shopping experience;
We are supported by world-class investors, raising $100 million in Series C in 2021 led by Verlinvest, with participation from Luxor, DN Capital, C4 Ventures, Convivavilit√© Ventures, FITEC, 360 Capital Partners, Innogest and DIP;
New customers quadrupled last year as we expanded into new international markets and covered 70 cities. We achieve our growth through a culture that is collaborative, transparent, data-driven and focused on our mission;
Our rapidly growing and diverse international team (20 nationalities and counting) has offices located in Italy (with headquarters in Milan & Verona), Czech Republic, France and Poland, as well as remote opportunities in many other countries.


What You Will Do

Use machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to design, develop scalable solutions for business problems like logistic optimization, forecasting, recommendation engines.
Analyze and extract relevant information from business data to help automate and optimize the product and key processes.
Impact teams, processes and the day-to-day functioning of our products.

Why you should join us now

You have the chance to change the life of millions of people;
You can rely on talented and collaborative colleagues who will both push and support you;
You can use a welfare bonus for a wide selection of services (education, public transport, vacations and entertainment, wellness, culture etc);
You receive a budget to create your own home workstation;
You have flexible working conditions and smart working;
You have a 15% discount on your grocery with Everli.com;
You can have a casual dress code :)


Requirements

At least 2 years of experience in Data science
Excellent business judgment
Quantitative University Degree (Engineering, Information Technology, Statistics, Mathematics)
Excellent knowledge and experience in creating sophisticated statistical modelling techniques, machine learning models
Strong problem solving ability
Strong communication skills
Proficient in using SQL,
Proficient in using Python, R
Experience in using machine learning libraries

title: Analytics Expert
description:
Qualifications

MBA or MS in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Applied Math, Quantitative social sciences or related field
8+ years of technical experience in predictive analytics, machine learning, optimization
2+ years of experiences from client facing position is a plus
Strong understanding and background applying complex algorithms and logic to process data
Proven experience extracting, importing, profiling, cleaning, standardization, transforming, converting, warehousing, archiving, and validating large complex sets of data
Ability to apply and advise on state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions
Fluent in a number of the following technologies R, Python, Julia, SQL, Spark, Hadoop, Tensorflow, Amazon AWS
Strong communication skills, especially around breaking down complex structures into digestible and relevant points for a diverse set of clients and colleagues, at all levels
Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
Ability to influence and work in teams
Strong desire to learn and develop, within a dynamic, self-led organization
Willingness to travel and work also on international projects
Fluency in English and Italian


What You'll Do

You will work through our clients‚Äô entire data ecosystem to understand what‚Äôs available, what‚Äôs missing - and where to find and collect that information.

This includes applying data science methods to improve and optimize our clients‚Äô performance needs, capture meaningful insights from data and turn them into competitive advantages.

In addition, you will drive the creation of statistical models to solve specific operational problems, which may include predicting equipment failure to do proactive maintenance for wind turbines, determining how to use machine learning to predict consumer behaviour, etc. In solving these problems, you will have access to proprietary feature engineering AI and teams of world-leading experts in your domain.

You will be in the room, often with the senior management, working side by side with talented data scientists from leading client organizations both on technical issues and on making the change happen. Lastly, you will mentor and guide your team colleagues and you will provide information and knowledge with them.

Who You'll Work With

You will be based in Milan and will be part of McKinsey Analytics, serving clients from the region but also globally.

Given the unprecedented proliferation of data in the world today and our clients‚Äô growing need to understand and capture value from it, McKinsey Analytics is rapidly expanding. Ongoing investments in our people and technology platform, combined with acquisitions of leading-edge firms like QuantumBlack and Risk Dynamics, have made us one of the largest and most esteemed advanced analytics consultancies today.

Combining state-of-the-art tools and techniques with McKinsey‚Äôs 85-plus years of experience, we enable our clients to improve their performance through data and become analytics-driven organizations.

title: Data Scientist
description:

Insieme ad un team di progetto, lavorerai nei principali mercati Enterprise per le industries Automotive, Insurance and Banking, Energy and Resources su attivit√† progettuali in ambito Cloud Transformation ed eventuali evolutive.

In questo ruolo sarai il punto di riferimento per il cliente e lo accompagnerai nell‚Äôevoluzione tecnologica dei suoi sistemi grazie alle competenze di business, tecnologiche e matematiche necessarie per questo processo. Come Data Scientist ti focalizzerai sulla gestione del dato e sul suo arricchimento, utilizzando modelli predittivi avanzati, che permetteranno ai nostri clienti di seguire un approccio data driven in linea con i modelli e le soluzioni proposte.

Cosa ti offriamo

In Avanade troverai un'azienda meritocratica che investe sulla crescita delle persone attraverso percorsi di studio mirati e che prevedono una continua formazione - grazie alle partnership privilegiate con Microsoft e con alcuni dei pi√π importanti player del settore -e il conseguimento di numerose certificazioni.

description:
Snam √® una delle principali societ√† di infrastrutture energetiche al mondo e una delle maggiori aziende quotate italiane per capitalizzazione.

Grazie a una rete sostenibile e tecnologicamente avanzata, garantisce la sicurezza degli approvvigionamenti e abilita la transizione energetica. Oltre che in Italia opera, attraverso consociate, in Albania (AGSCo), Austria (TAG, GCA), Emirati Arabi Uniti (ADNOC Gas Pipelines), Francia (Ter√©ga), Grecia (DESFA) e Regno Unito (Interconnector UK) e ha recentemente avviato l‚Äôattivit√† anche in Cina e India. √à, inoltre, uno dei principali azionisti di TAP (Trans Adriatic Pipeline).

Prima in Europa per estensione della rete di trasporto (oltre 41.000 km, comprese le attivit√† internazionali) e capacit√† di stoccaggio di gas naturale (circa 20 miliardi di metri cubi, comprese le attivit√† internazionali), Snam √® anche tra i principali operatori continentali nella rigassificazione, attraverso il terminale di Panigaglia (GNL Italia) e le quote negli impianti di Livorno (OLT) e Rovigo (Adriatic LNG) in Italia e di Revithoussa (DESFA) in Grecia.

Snam opera inoltre nella forestazione (Arbolia) e si √® posta l‚Äôobiettivo di raggiungere la neutralit√† carbonica (Scope 1 e Scope 2) entro il 2040.

Il modello di business dell‚Äôazienda si basa sulla crescita sostenibile, la trasparenza, la valorizzazione dei talenti e delle diversit√†, la tutela e lo sviluppo sociale dei territori anche attraverso le iniziative di Fondazione Snam.

Data Scientist

Nell‚Äôambito Della Direzione Digital Transformation & Technology Che Si Occupa Di Raccolta e Gestione Della Domanda In Ambito Data Science & Machine Learning; Definizione, Ideazione, Preparazione Dati Ed Implementazione Di Progetti e Algoritmi; Stiamo Cercando Una Brillante Risorsa Che, a Supporto Del Team ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence, Machine Learning & Automation‚Äù Si Occuper√† Principalmente Di

title: AI / ML Solution Architect
description:
In this role, you will use creativity to connect technology to tangible solutions to complex, real world problems for our customers across various industries (Automotive, Energy, Finance, Telecommunications & Media, Life Sciences). Our projects are exciting, varied and rewarding and provide plenty of opportunities to learn and develop.

¬†

Responsibilities

This is a senior technical position within our team in Italy and you will provide technical leadership to a group of talented data science consultants. Your responsibilities will include:

Identify and design cloud-native or on-premises architecture for data analytics, IOT data management, AI / ML solutions.
Conduct technical presales and in-depth discussions on technical architecture with customer contacts and technical leaders to take data platform and advanced analytics solutions to production.
Work on a wide spectrum of applications and design architectures for a variety of use cases.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders (Data Scientist, ML Engineer, Data Visualization Experts, Business Experts, Partners, Vendors).
Take a leading role in defining and sharing best practices, technical content, and new reference architectures for the entire international team.

¬†

We are extremely proud of our culture. The wellbeing and engagement of all staff is our priority and we have created a collaborative and cooperative environment with a good work-life balance. Supporting colleagues, commitment to continuous learning and a positive attitude are all valued.

¬†

Requirements

To succeed in this role, you should have:

Degree in science, engineering, technology, mathematics, etc.
Experience in the application of data science, analytics, machine learning and calculation techniques to business problems.
8+ years professional experience in a similar role. Less experienced applicants will be considered if they can demonstrate superior leadership, project management and communication skills.
Experience in architecting/deploying/operating solutions built on multi-cloud environments and hybrid infrastructures.
Proficiency in Italian and English.
Experience of putting together complex technical proposals.

¬†

Technical Requirements

Experience in the following technologies will be needed in this role:

At least one IOT platform (Osisoft, PTC Thingworx, Hitachi Vantara, MS Azure IOT Platform, etc.).
Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, Kafka, etc.
DevOps, Scrum, Agile.
One or more of the following technologies: Hadoop¬†(Cloudera),¬†AWS,¬†Azure, Google Cloud,¬†Spark,¬†Java,¬†Python, pySpark, microservices architectures¬†(containers, Docker, Kubernetes).
Certification in Cloudera,¬†AWS/Azure/Google¬†could be an advantage.
Knowledge of methodological aspects on Data Governance, Data Management and Data Quality would be useful.

¬†

Tessella is dedicated to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, national origin, religion, or physical ability.

description:
Role purpose

In the Big Data Chapter / Big Data and Artificial Intelligence team we are looking for a Data Scientist Chapter Lead who will be responsible for providing strategic business information that generates revenue, reduces costs and improves the customer experience

Delve into the data of different systems, structured and unstructured, both in batch and in real time, to discover hidden relationships and useful information

Use of machine learning / AI algorithms to run models on network investments, predictive maintenance

title: Python Developer
description:
Python Developer




Siamo alla ricerca di talenti da inserire nel team Analytics con il ruolo di¬†Python Developer, che abbiano il desiderio di contribuire da protagonisti alla crescita di Prima, con una forte passione per lo sviluppo software e il problem solving.




Cosa farai




La velocit√† e dinamicit√† del settore in cui operiamo ci impone di prendere continue decisioni in tempo reale, come ad esempio la definizione del prezzo di una specifica copertura assicurativa o la necessit√† di un controllo antifrode per un sinistro denunciato. La quasi totalit√† di queste decisioni vengono prese in automatico da sistemi dinamici e motori di intelligenza artificiale che stimano la probabilit√† di eventi futuri e definiscono l'azione migliore possibile per Prima e i suoi clienti.




All'interno del team Analytics collaborerai con il Quant Analyst, specializzato nell'analisi dati, e il MLOps Engineer, professionista nella scalabilit√† e messa in produzione dei modelli. Il tuo compito sar√† quello di ottimizzare, tramite lo sviluppo e la scelta delle tecnologie pi√π adatte, tutto il processo che porta dal dato grezzo alla generazione di modelli predittivi competitivi fondati sul Machine Learning.




Nello specifico sarai responsabile di:




Vagliare le richieste e definire le specifiche di sviluppo di nuovi strumenti e metodologie del team, con piena libert√† nella scelta implementativa e delle tecnologie utilizzate
Disegnare e sviluppare le soluzioni software, solitamente pacchetti o microservizi, a supporto di tutti i processi del team, specialmente negli ambiti di analisi del dato (trasformazione, visualizzazione, versionamento, documentazione) e Machine Learning
Crescere, informarti e sperimentare per rimanere sempre al passo con le tecnologie emergenti e scegliere il "right tool for the job"







Chi cerchiamo




Sei il candidato o la candidata ideale se possiedi i seguenti requisiti:




Eccellenza tecnica




La tua passione ti porta sempre alla ricerca di nuove tecnologie per risolvere i problemi che ti si parano davanti. In Prima sarai incoraggiato a perseguire gli obiettivi comuni in maniera originale e innovativa, portando avanti le tue idee e generando valore in modo proattivo. Hai gi√† sviluppato, meglio se per almeno 3 anni, e tra le tue competenze principali annoveri:




- Python

- Librerie di analisi dati (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy...)

- Paradigmi di programmazione OOP e FP

- Architettura Software, Design Patterns e Microservizi

- Database Relazionali (ad esempio RedShift, MySql e PostgreSQL) e ORM (ad esempio SqlAlchemy)




Approccio strutturato e meticoloso




Ti concentri sull'obiettivo e hai un forte orientamento al risultato, curando nei dettagli ogni aspetto del tuo lavoro. Sei in grado di affrontare problemi analiticamente molto complessi strutturando il tuo lavoro e approfondendo ogni caso limite. Ti assicuri che quanto da te prodotto sia privo di errori.




Coraggio




Sei in grado di prenderti i giusti rischi e assumerti grandi responsabilit√†. In Prima il progresso e lo sviluppo tecnologico passano soprattutto dall‚Äôintraprendenza e dalla voglia continua di sperimentare e mettersi in gioco, aprendosi al confronto con gli altri, talvolta fallendo, ma sostenendo sempre le proprie idee.




Nice to have




Oltre ai requisiti di base, valuteremo con particolare attenzione queste caratteristiche:




Hai una laurea in Matematica, Fisica, Informatica o facolt√† affini con il massimo dei voti
Hai delle basi di machine learning
Hai dimestichezza con:




- Git

- Agile Development

- Distribuzione pacchetti

- Jupyter Notebook, JupyterLab e JupyterHub

- Librerie di plot (ad esempio MatplotLib, Seaborn e Plotly)

- Piattaforme Cloud, preferibilmente Amazon Web Services

- Containerizzazione (ad esempio Docker)

- CI (ad esempio Drone e Jenkins)

- Database non relazionali (MongoDB, DynamoDB...)

- Altri linguaggi di programmazione (ad esempio Elixir, Rust, Go e Bash)







Tipologia contrattuale




Buoni pasto, momenti di formazione, eventi dedicati al team building, hardware e device di ultima generazione: in Prima troverai tutto quello di cui hai bisogno per svolgere al meglio il tuo lavoro in un ambiente giovane e informale. I nostri contratti sono regolati dal CCNL del Commercio e la retribuzione e la durata verranno valutati in sede di colloquio, perch√© vogliamo offrire un corrispettivo adeguato alla reale esperienza e competenza di ogni singola persona.




L'orario di lavoro √® Full Time. La nostra sede √® a Milano, in Via Santa Maria Segreta 2-10 (vicino a Piazza Cordusio).




Prima offre pari opportunit√† di impiego ed √® orientata alla diversit√† e all'inclusione sul posto di lavoro. L'azienda proibisce discriminazioni di qualunque tipo basate su razza, colore della pelle, genere, religione, orientamento sessuale, nazionalit√†, disabilit√†, informazioni genetiche, gravidanza o altre caratteristiche personali protette, cos√¨ come definito dalle leggi nazionali.

title: Business Intelligence & Data Scientist (1 year contract)
description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & DATA SCIENTIST




Contract: Full time. 1 year temporary contract




Note: Accepting only English CVs!

¬†

For our client, an international financial services company, we have an exiting opportunity for a Business Intelligence (BI) Data Scientist that will help the company to use collected data in order to understand trends, solve business problems, and monitor metrics. You will assist with determining the data the company needs, structuring it in an appropriate format, analysing the data using queries. With high level of autonomy you will be responsible for development of a new Business Intelligence reporting solutions by transforming and modelling of large volume real-time data and visualisation¬†for decision-makers.

Working closely with Product and Engineering team, you¬†will be in charge of:

developing advanced analytical and machine learning solutions,
implementing advanced analytics and statistical / complex modelling to maximize proprietary outlook capability,
integrating relevant data and insights into dashboards to be directly and independently consumed by decision-makers,

Implement and run business relevant prototypes of advanced data management processes (including Machine learning and image recognition) applied to performance management and end-customer analytics

¬†YOUR QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCE

Background

Experience in advanced analytics including machine learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI) processes, data forecasting or large volume data analysis is a plus.

description:
In ISCS la tecnologia √® al servizio della risoluzione dei problemi. Ci distinguiamo per essere una societ√† altamente specializzata che fornisce soluzioni tecnologiche ed innovative nel mondo ICT. L‚Äôattenzione che rivolgiamo alla selezione del nostro team di specialisti, ci permette di rispondere alle esigenze di contesti complessi nel campo della progettazione, della consulenza e dei servizi informatici.

Di cosa ti occuperai?

In ISCS facciamo affidamento su dati altamente penetranti per proiettare nel futuro i nostri sistemi e le nostre soluzioni. Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Scientist in grado di lavorare su un progetto per un nostro importante cliente, culla dell‚Äôanalisi del dato nel contesto milanese. Avr√† le competenze matematiche e statistiche che ci si aspetta dal ruolo, ma anche una naturale curiosit√† e una mente creativa (non cos√¨ facile da trovare). Man mano che estraiamo, interpretiamo e puliamo i dati, faremo affidamento su di lui/lei per porre domande, collegare i punti e scoprire opportunit√† nascoste all'interno, il tutto con l'obiettivo finale di realizzare il pieno potenziale dei dati.
Ti unirai a un team di specialisti dei dati, preparato ed inclusivo, con il quale potrai collaborare sinergicamente dando il tuo contributo.

Obiettivi

Ricerca e ideazione di modelli statistici innovativi per l'analisi dei dati.
Collaborare alla progettazione, sviluppo e manutenzione di componenti software.
Tradurre esigenze operative e requisiti funzionali in soluzioni software in grado di creare un impatto positivo nella vita delle persone.
Progettare e sviluppare nuove ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù in base alle esigenze di utenti e clienti istituzionali.

Responsabilit√†

Lavorare come lead strategist dei dati, identificando e integrando nuovi set di dati che possono essere sfruttati.
Eseguire metodicamente esperimenti analitici per aiutare a risolvere vari problemi e avere un vero impatto in vari settori.
Identificare le origini dati e i set pertinenti da estrarre per le esigenze aziendali dei clienti e raccogliere grandi set di dati e variabili, strutturati e non strutturati.
Elaborare e utilizzare algoritmi e modelli per estrarre archivi di big data, eseguire analisi di dati per migliorare i modelli e pulire e convalidare i dati per uniformit√† e accuratezza.
Analizzare i dati per tendenze e modelli e interpretarli con un obiettivo chiaro in mente.
Implementare modelli analitici in produzione collaborando con sviluppatori di software e ingegneri del machine learning.
Comunicare soluzioni analitiche alle parti interessate e implementare i miglioramenti necessari ai sistemi operativi.

Requisiti e Competenze

Esperienza di almeno 3 anni
Ottima conoscenza di Python
Buona conoscenza di SQL e Bash
Buona confidenza con Git, PyCharm e Linux
Implementare algoritmi di Machine Learning
Sviluppare soluzioni Software as a Service e Cloud

Nice to have: conoscenza di API REST, Kafka, Docker & Swarm e Google Cloud Platform

Offriamo

Inserimento con contratto a Tempo Indeterminato con inquadramento in base all‚Äôesperienza maturata o collaborazione con Partita Iva.
Assistenza sanitaria integrativa
Ticket restaurant
Sistema di Welfare in continua crescita.

Luogo di lavoro: MILANO

Siamo un team affiatato e professionale che crede nell‚Äôinnovazione e che fa dell‚Äôentusiasmo un punto di forza, come ingrediente essenziale dei propri successi.
ISCS crede molto nei suoi valori ed √® per questo che ogni giorno ci impegniamo nel raggiungimento di risultati sempre pi√π ambiziosi, dimostrando spirito di iniziativa, determinazione, capacit√† di comunicazione e agilit√† mentale per affrontare, gestire e risolvere i problemi in team.

Se sei interessato alla posizione e possiedi i requisiti necessari, invia il tuo cv.
Non vediamo l‚Äôora di averti nel nostro team!

Inviare CV dettagliato indicando l‚Äôautorizzazione alla gestione dei dati ai sensi del D. Lgs. 196/03 e del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679). Le ricerche sono rivolte a candidati di ambo i sessi (L.903/77).
In ISCS la diversit√† culturale, di genere, anagrafica o di ruolo costituisce un valore. Abbiamo una cultura aziendale basata sull‚Äôapertura mentale, l‚Äôaccoglienza e la promozione della diversit√† e offriamo un ambiente di lavoro accessibile ed inclusivo, valutando con attenzione i candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette, ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

title: Python Developer
description:
Direct message the job poster from Quaestio Capital SGR S.p.A.

Simone Serrajotto
Head of Operations at Quaestio Capital Management SGR

Quaestio Capital Management √®¬†una societ√† di gestione del risparmio indipendente italiana, con una prospettiva globale, che ha l'obiettivo di investire i capitali raccolti presso i propri clienti coniugando la ricerca e l'esperienza diretta sui mercati.

Tra le caratteristiche principali della Societ√†, la continua innovazione e l'utilizzo di automazione in tutte le aree societarie.




La Societ√† sta cercando un Developer da inserire nel team di Data Intelligence (parte del team Operations) con contratto da definirsi a seconda dell'esperienza del candidato.




La risorsa avr√† la possibilit√† di interagire con tutte le aree aziendali. Le attivit√† da svolgere riguarderanno l'analisi, gestione e elaborazione di dati finanziari e di portafoglio per lo sviluppo di reportistica di monitoraggio degli investimenti, e lo sviluppo di procedure automatiche per aumentare l'efficienza di attivit√† aziendali. La conscenza di linguaggi di programmazione (specialmente Python) √® essenziale, cos√¨ come l'interesse nella Finanza.




La conoscenza di strumenti di web development (Flask, Django) √® molto apprezzata. Si sottolinea che il ruolo, per come √® definito al momento, NON comporter√† attivit√† legate ad Intelligenza Artificiale, Machine Learning e simili.




In particolare, il Candidato:

Apprender√† le conoscenze di base per sviluppare procedure automatiche a supporto di tutte le aree societarie, e le utilizzer√† a tale fine.
Analizzer√† i processi automatizzati utilizzati giornalmente dall‚Äôazienda per la raccolta e arricchimento dei dati finanziari e di portafoglio, con particolare focus sulle procedure di produzione della reportistica automatizzata.
Contribuir√† alla produzione e manutenzione di documentazione tecnica.
Contribuir√† attivamente al continuo miglioramento di tali processi e procedure.
Interagir√† quotidianamente con diverse aree aziendali su tematiche di sviluppo IT/gestione e utilizzo di dati.
Sar√† direttamente coinvolto nell‚Äôanalisi e sviluppo di modelli quantitativi per il monitoraggio di metriche finanziarie, simulazioni di portafoglio e produzione di reportistica.
Contribuir√† alla manutenzione della base dati aziendale e dei processi automatici che la utilizzano.




Si richiede al candidato:

Conoscenza o interesse di database, linguaggi di programmazione e sistemi operativi, in particolare: Python, Mysql, Linux e Flask, Django (o altri strumenti di web development)
interesse nello sviluppo e manutenzione di procedure automatiche tramite l'utilizzo di linguaggi di programmazione
interesse nella gestione e utilizzo di dati
intraprendenza, attenzione ai dettagli e spiccata capacit√† di lavorare in team
ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata







ENGLISH Version

Quaestio Capital Management is an Italian independent asset management company, with a global perspective, which aims to invest the capital raised from its customers by combining research and direct experience in the markets.

Among the main features of the Company, continuous innovation and the use of automation in all corporate areas.




The Company is looking for a Python Developer to be included in the Data Intelligence team (part of the Operations team) with a contract depending on the experience of the candidate.

The candidate will have the opportunity to interact with all the business areas. The activities to be carried out will concern the analysis of financial and portfolio data and their processing for the development of investment monitoring reports, and the development of automatic procedures to increase the efficiency of business activities. Knowledge of programming languages (mainly Python) is essential, and so in a keen interest in Finance.




The knowledge of web development tools (such as Flask and Django) is very appreciated. For the time being, this role will NOT focus on Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence activities.




In particular, the Candidate will:¬†

Learn how to develop automatic procedures to support all corporate areas, and quickly put that knowledge to practical use on specific projects.
Analyze the automated processes used daily by the Company for the collection and enrichment of financial and portfolio data, with a particular focus on the automated reporting processes.
Contribute to the production and mainteinance of technical documentation.¬†
Actively contribute to the ongoing improvement of these processes and procedures.
Interact daily with other business areas on IT development / management and data issues.¬†
Be directly involved in the analysis and development of quantitative models for monitoring financial metrics, portfolio simulations and production of reports.¬†
Contribute to the maintenance of the corporate financial database and the automatic processes that depend on it.




The candidate should:

know or be interested in database, programming languages and operating systems, in particular: Python, Mysql, Linux, Flask, Django (or other web development tools)
be interested in the development and maintenance of automatic procedures through the use of programming languages
be interested in the management and use of data¬†
be enterprising, have strong attention to details and teamwork skills
excellent knowledge of English, both written and spoken

title: Data Science Consultant - Milan
description:
The Data Science Consultant provides services that maximize the value of the customer‚Äôs business through data-driven insights and enhanced decision support. This role will be responsible for advising the customer and recommending software configuration alternatives, and implementing the software that is configured to optimize the solution so that the customer may realize the maximum value from the software.

Your day to day work will entail


Provide analytical services as part of a team conducting proofs-of-concept and identifying opportunities to create customer value
Perform data analysis to discover patterns, trends and anomalies in customer data, translate the results into actionable insights, and present results and recommendations to support customers in improving their data quality

Extract and present data stories from customer data sets to demonstrate value of solution and guide the customer in their priorities

Build, configure and train models to support overall project objectives, and run simulations and what-if analyses to evaluate alternative scenarios

Support the successful delivery of the solution to the customer by making recommendations and providing quantitative evidence of the project‚Äôs results

Work as part of a highly motivated, interdisciplinary and agile team



You are / should have


Graduate degree in Operations Research, Statistics, or a related quantitative field, is required, and advanced knowledge of machine learning is preferred.
Ability to elicit customers‚Äô knowledge, both explicit and tacit, about business objectives, strategic concerns, and policies related to the scope and success of the project.

Able to translate complex data into business insights and opportunities to create value.

Demonstrated experience of script programming languages in Python, for data analytics and machine learning applications.


Every day, our teams work enthusiastically with our customers on innovative AI-based solutions and sophisticated optimization for the retail industry. Working with us means you can look forward to co-workers who use creativity to collectively develop ideas and appreciate each other's expertise. Mutual respect, friendly relationships and results-oriented work are an important part of our environment. We strive to be a family-friendly business and are open to modern working structures.

We believe that the individuality and diversity of our employees make a decisive contribution to our success. Our hiring process is based on qualifications and career profile. We welcome applications from all motivated candidates, regardless of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, origin or religion.

Who We Are

:

title: Data Science Manager
description:
Empatica

We are a digital healthcare company specialized in building AI systems to monitor people‚Äôs health. We have been making beautifully designed wearables, software platforms and tools, and advanced algorithms, unlocking better health outcomes for thousands of people.

Our customers range from some of the world‚Äôs largest institutions to individual users who message us every day and tell us how our products changed their lives. Our newest wearable, EmbracePlus, is sponsored by NASA and will be used to monitor the health of the astronauts onboard the first-ever manned mission to Mars. Pharmaceutical companies are using our research platform to fast-track the development of new treatments, while hundreds of academic researchers publish new discoveries on human behavior weekly, all made possible by our E4 smartband and software tools.

We just partnered with the US Department of Health and Human Services to accelerate the release of our wearable COVID-19 early detection system.

If you are looking to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can really make a change in people‚Äôs lives, keep reading.

The role

If you know the difference between sensitivity and specificity and you think that agile is not a bad word, continue reading.

As a manager, you will be working with our data scientists and engineers on a multitude of topics you will be immersed in the electronic and physiological details when helping the development of our custom-made sensors; you will be thinking about timelines, risk minimization, and regulatory strategies when managing the R&D process for new biomarkers; you will be defining roadmaps with cloud and mobile engineers, release plans and testing strategy with QA engineers when the team is moving from R&D to production.

If technical challenges weren‚Äôt enough, you will be tightly working with our business teams and our enterprise customers. You will be responsible for delivering the best possible outcomes of special initiatives and managing the internal and external stakeholders‚Äô expectations.

Eventually, together with the rest of the product management team in Empatica, you will help steer the company towards the vision of unlocking better health outcomes for thousands of people. You will build amazing products and processes that will deliver outsized value to our customers and society.

You will be involved in

Setting the product strategy and roadmap by prioritizing features, building consensus, and coordinating deliverables with scientists, engineers, and management.
Managing agile processes and rituals. You will oversee day-to-day technical development and discuss technical implementation details with engineers and data scientists to make trade-offs. Your job will be to balance between meeting customer needs, deadlines, and scientific rigor.
Interacting with the regulatory team to validate new algorithms, biomarkers, and making sure our development process is agile but regulatory friendly. You will drive and uphold rigorous scientific standards, bringing consistency to the analyses you encounter and ensuring our discoveries are adequately reviewed.



Requirements

What we are looking for

The ideal candidate for this role

Has 3+ years of experience managing senior data scientists in the biomedical engineering or life science areas.
Has successfully managed complex data science or research projects (namely managed more than 6 scientists/engineers for long-term and high-budget initiatives).
Has successfully launched products/algorithms/features into the wild to real users (not only academic projects) and iterated to incorporate customers‚Äô feedback.
Is an exceptional communicator who can lead cross-functional collaborations from end to end to build consensus and manage expectations.


Bonus

Has 3+ years of experience in technical product management with agile product development.
Has 3+ years of experience with healthcare, health tech, and public health.
Has an advanced degree in life sciences or biomedical-engineering-related disciplines.
Has worked with modern machine learning frameworks and has managed cloud-based projects.
Has been a people manager and cares about the growth of the team.
Has worked tightly with regulatory affairs and knows what does it mean a high-paced but regulated environment.



You and Empatica would be a perfect match if you are

A very quick learner
Fun and easy to work with
A hard-worker and collaborative
A doer, with an excellent execution mindset
Proficient in English
An outstanding planner, with excellent time management and multitasking skills
Focused on quality and excellence
Flexible in terms of working time and ability to travel
A problem-solving hustler who can take on any big or small project
Passionate about our products and our mission



Benefits

Life at Empatica

You will join a fast-growing, diverse team of 70+ brilliantly talented humans, who care passionately about what we do and the difference we are making in the world. You‚Äôll get the opportunity to work directly with engineers, data scientists, and designers, across all levels of the organization.

If you jump on board, we can guarantee it won't be an easy ride, but it will be one of the most rewarding experiences in your career, one that will allow you to learn a lot and test your whole skill-set on multiple projects, which are already helping thousands of people worldwide.

Benefits

Highly competitive salary
We have offices in Milan City Center and Downtown Boston. And every summer, we hold an amazing beach retreat in Sardinia, Italy.
Free lunch - yes, being in Italy, it's something you should care about!
Organic fresh fruit
Your personal MacBook
Flexible working hours
Free, superior Italian coffee - of course
Free cookies, if you deserve them
Much more...



At Empatica, we support the personal and professional growth of our employees. Beyond the above, you‚Äôll have the possibility to attend conferences, receive dedicated training, and participate in activities relevant to where you want your career to go.
