title: Machine Learning Specialist - NLP Focus, Analytics Center of Excellence (ACOE) (w/m/d) - Milan
description:
IQVIA‚Ñ¢ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

The Analytics Center of Excellence (ACOE) team harnesses our global healthcare insights, working closely with our clinical and therapeutic experts to power evidence-driven design, speed site activation and recruit the right patients, faster. This is a new unit within our business, integrated within Clinical Operations. We‚Äôre using big data, advanced analytics and novel technology to transform clinical development and bring new medicines to patients faster through successful trial delivery. This multi-function team is an innovation for our business, requiring entrepreneurial and independent thinking to build our capability. Unique and with a global view, this is a chance to revolutionize the clinical research industry.

As an NLP specialist in the ACOE, you will leverage your creativity and machine learning expertise to help identify areas to apply advanced NLP solutions in different parts of the organization. Working closely with business stakeholders and internal product offerings staff, you will be involved in defining the scope of data science products and the internal analytics roadmap. You will also develop clear, concise communication strategies for explaining relevant machine learning and data science concepts to business stakeholders.

Working with a diverse global team of data scientists and software developers using modern data science languages and tools, you will build prototypes and production quality software components that drive business value. For your project‚Äôs specific business problem, you will leverage your deep expertise in machine learning to devise and implement suitable methodologies. You will demonstrate commitment to strong engineering by writing high-quality code and participating in the peer review process. You will be accountable for all aspects of your work, from data analysis and research, to KPI definition, testing and deployment.

Continued involvement in the machine learning community is highly encouraged. You will have opportunities to stay up to date with and participate in the development of the state-of-the-art methods in NLP by attending conferences and publishing papers. You will also serve as a mentor and guide junior team members involved in advanced analytics activities and tasks.

PhD or Masters degree in STEM related field (PhD preferred but not required)
Demonstrated expertise in NLP domain
Strong theoretical and hands-on experience with statistics and machine learning related techniques, tools, and methods
Extensive experience in programming languages (Python preferred)
The ability to read, understand, and explain to others, scientific papers on state-of-the-art machine learning and computer science, as well as the ability to prototype, evaluate and improve the ideas described
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate effectively to both technical and nontechnical audiences.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with minimum supervision
Fluent in English, plus local language
Familiar with client-server architecture and microservice architecture
Experience productionizing and maintaining ML-based automated solutions.
Good knowledge of design patterns and software engineering best practices
Healthcare domain experience
Experience with big data tools such as Spark, HDFS, Hive.

Please note, this role can be based in any of the ACOE EU hubs; Warsaw, Madrid, Milan, Frankfurt or London.

IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

title: Computer Vision Engineer Specialist
description:
Do you have curiosity, a desire to get involved, to gain experience in a growing company and have the chance to innovate with your work and skills? Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 900 professionals working for more than 400 clients in 20 countries around the world.




One of the European leaders in solutions for Enterprise Risk Management and Wealth & Asset Management, Prometeia is looking for a resource for the Milan office to join a team that supports the digital transformation of banks and insurance companies through the most advanced data science methodologies.




Prometeia Data Science team supports the digital transformation of banks and insurance companies through the most advanced data science methodologies.




Our computer vision team develops and delivers new cutting-edge products that serve as the foundation of the current and future of insurance companies and banks. From object detection, instance and semantic segmentation, to generative adversarial networks, our core team is focused on taking new technologies from early concept and transforming them into products while iterating, prototyping, and realizing value added services and products.




MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

¬†

Design and develop novel algorithms for real time object detection (both 2D and 3D), instance/semantic segmentation, depth estimation, scene reconstruction and understanding
Be able to read, understand and transform to code the most recent published literature
Analyze model results and highlight the next actions to be taken to improve the results
Excellent analytical, collaboration and communication skills
Continue to grow the research and engineering culture, along with the team without losing attention to deliver results




MINIMUM QUALIFICATION:

¬†

MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or related technical field.
2+ years of experience developing and designing Computer Vision technologies and systems.
Strong proficiency in programming languages, in particular Python and C++ and hands on experience with libraries such as OpenCV, PyTorch and Pytorch-Lightning;
Good knowledge of English language.
Experience on Deep Learning models training and ML dataset management
Experience with git, dvc and azure ml




PREFERRED QUALIFICATION:

Ôªø

PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Robotics or related technical field.
Background in machine learning with experience in large scale training and evaluation of deep convolutional.
Experience in semi-supervised, self-supervised and weak-supervised learning
Publication track record at conferences related to computer vision and/or machine learning




WHAT WE OFFER:

Continuous updating structured in four pillars to support your professional growth

Participation in the Prometeia corporate welfare plan, meal vouchers, iPhone and PC




LOCATION:

Milan




Our company fosters and respects equal opportunities (L 903/77), promotes all differences and considers them a value.




Our Group has been awarded the Top Job 2019/20 prize, assigned by the German Institute of Quality and Finance to the 200 best companies in which to work in Italy (2000 companies considered by the analysis). In the category "Consulting, accounting and auditing" Prometeia ranked second.¬†

title: Data Science Manager
description:
Description

Empatica

We are a digital healthcare company specialized in building AI systems to monitor people‚Äôs health. We have been making beautifully designed wearables, software platforms and tools, and advanced algorithms, unlocking better health outcomes for thousands of people.

Our customers range from some of the world‚Äôs largest institutions to individual users who message us every day and tell us how our products changed their lives. Our newest wearable, EmbracePlus, is sponsored by NASA and will be used to monitor the health of the astronauts onboard the first-ever manned mission to Mars. Pharmaceutical companies are using our research platform to fast-track the development of new treatments, while hundreds of academic researchers publish new discoveries on human behavior weekly, all made possible by our E4 smartband and software tools.

We just partnered with the US Department of Health and Human Services to accelerate the release of our wearable COVID-19 early detection system .

If you are looking to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can really make a change in people‚Äôs lives, keep reading.

The role

If you know the difference between sensitivity and specificity and you think that agile is not a bad word, continue reading.

As a manager, you will be working with our data scientists and engineers on a multitude of topics: you will be immersed in the electronic and physiological details when helping the development of our custom-made sensors; you will be thinking about timelines, risk minimization, and regulatory strategies when managing the R&D process for new biomarkers; you will be defining roadmaps with cloud and mobile engineers, release plans and testing strategy with QA engineers when the team is moving from R&D to production.

If technical challenges weren‚Äôt enough, you will be tightly working with our business teams and our enterprise customers. You will be responsible for delivering the best possible outcomes of special initiatives and managing the internal and external stakeholders‚Äô expectations.

Eventually, together with the rest of the product management team in Empatica, you will help steer the company towards the vision of unlocking better health outcomes for thousands of people. You will build amazing products and processes that will deliver outsized value to our customers and society.

You Will Be Involved In

Setting the product strategy and roadmap by prioritizing features, building consensus, and coordinating deliverables with scientists, engineers, and management.
Managing agile processes and rituals. You will oversee day-to-day technical development and discuss technical implementation details with engineers and data scientists to make trade-offs. Your job will be to balance between meeting customer needs, deadlines, and scientific rigor.
Interacting with the regulatory team to validate new algorithms, biomarkers, and making sure our development process is agile but regulatory friendly. You will drive and uphold rigorous scientific standards, bringing consistency to the analyses you encounter and ensuring our discoveries are adequately reviewed.


Requirements

What we are looking for

The Ideal Candidate For This Role

Has 3+ years of experience managing senior data scientists in the biomedical engineering or life science areas.
Has successfully managed complex data science or research projects (namely managed more than 6 scientists/engineers for long-term and high-budget initiatives).
Has successfully launched products/algorithms/features into the wild to real users (not only academic projects) and iterated to incorporate customers‚Äô feedback.
Is an exceptional communicator who can lead cross-functional collaborations from end to end to build consensus and manage expectations.


Bonus

Has 3+ years of experience in technical product management with agile product development.
Has 3+ years of experience with healthcare, health tech, and public health.
Has an advanced degree in life sciences or biomedical-engineering-related disciplines.
Has worked with modern machine learning frameworks and has managed cloud-based projects.
Has been a people manager and cares about the growth of the team.
Has worked tightly with regulatory affairs and knows what does it mean a high-paced but regulated environment.

You and Empatica would be a perfect match if you are:

A very quick learner
Fun and easy to work with
A hard-worker and collaborative
A doer, with an excellent execution mindset
Proficient in English
An outstanding planner, with excellent time management and multitasking skills
Focused on quality and excellence
Flexible in terms of working time and ability to travel
A problem-solving hustler who can take on any big or small project
Passionate about our products and our mission


Benefits

Life at Empatica

You will join a fast-growing, diverse team of 70+ brilliantly talented humans, who care passionately about what we do and the difference we are making in the world. You‚Äôll get the opportunity to work directly with engineers, data scientists, and designers, across all levels of the organization.

If you jump on board, we can guarantee it won't be an easy ride, but it will be one of the most rewarding experiences in your career, one that will allow you to learn a lot and test your whole skill-set on multiple projects, which are already helping thousands of people worldwide.

Benefits

Highly competitive salary
We have offices in Milan City Center and Downtown Boston. And every summer, we hold an amazing beach retreat in Sardinia, Italy.
Free lunch - yes, being in Italy, it's something you should care about!
Organic fresh fruit
Your personal MacBook
Flexible working hours
Free, superior Italian coffee - of course
Free cookies, if you deserve them
Much more...

At Empatica, we support the personal and professional growth of our employees. Beyond the above, you‚Äôll have the possibility to attend conferences, receive dedicated training, and participate in activities relevant to where you want your career to go.

Job Summary

title: Senior Data Scientist - Milan
Data Engineer
description:
Empatica

We are a digital healthcare company specialized in building AI systems to monitor people‚Äôs health. We have been making beautifully designed wearables, software platforms and tools, and advanced algorithms, unlocking better health outcomes for thousands of people.

Our customers range from some of the world‚Äôs largest institutions to individual users who message us every day and tell us how our products changed their lives. Our newest wearable, EmbracePlus, is sponsored by NASA and will be used to monitor the health of the astronauts onboard the first-ever manned mission to Mars. Pharmaceutical companies are using our research platform to fast-track the development of new treatments, while hundreds of academic researchers publish new discoveries on human behavior weekly, all made possible by our E4 smartband and software tools.

We just partnered with the US Department of Health and Human Services to accelerate the release of our wearable COVID-19 early detection system.

If you are looking to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can really make a change in people‚Äôs lives, keep reading.

The role

Within the Data team, we need to handle high volumes of data (Terabytes per day) that is collected by our wearables, and is then processed and served to our clients in order to help them out for research, analysis, and more. This could be data collected during a clinical trial, that needs to be constantly accessible by researchers via our Research Portal to understand the effectiveness of their treatment, or the vital signs of hundreds of patients who are being monitored by their doctor using Empatica Care.

As a Data Engineer you will be responsible for improving our data infrastructure within the cloud, by designing, building and maintaining a scalable, reliable, and secure architecture, used by Empatica Data Scientists, as well as clients. This is an exciting time to join the team, as you‚Äôll get to work on some of our newest products, such as EmbracePlus and Empatica Care.

You‚Äôll be working closely with a team of Data Scientists, alongside Cloud Engineers and Product Managers our stack features some of the most exciting technologies out there (Kubernetes, EKS and Terraform, languages like Golang and Python, and a wild number of AWS services).

This is more than just a coding role. You'll have the chance to use your expertise and knowledge to craft the architecture of the platform we're building, and its evolution.

In addition, working together with other engineers you will

Design, build, and maintain scalable data infrastructure
Work on ETL pipelines
Simplify development and deployment procedures for Data Scientists
Define mid and long term plans for scaling the technological stack
Educate software and data engineers respectively on data and software practices



Requirements

You are the ideal person for this job if

You have prior experience as a Cloud/DevOps/Infrastructure engineer, preferably in AWS and/or GCP/Azure (2+ years)
You have worked with large scale environments, datasets, and Big Data
You are familiar with logging and monitoring technologies
You have experience in automating machine-learning workflows
You have worked on complex data pipelines
You possess strong programming skills (like Go, C, Python, Java, JavaScript, Bash)
You have worked with large scale environments
You are experienced with Hadoop ecosystem tools (like Spark/Kafka/HDFS/YARN)



You and Empatica would be a perfect match if you are

A very quick learner
Fun and easy to work with
A hard-worker and collaborative
A doer, with an excellent execution mindset
Proficient in English (mother tongue is highly appreciated)
An outstanding planner, with excellent time management and multitasking skills
Focused on quality and excellence
Flexible in terms of working time
A problem-solving hustler who can take on any big or small project
Passionate about our products and our mission



Benefits

Highly competitive salary
We have offices in Milan City Center and Downtown Boston. And every summer, we hold an amazing beach retreat in Sardinia, Italy.
Free lunch - yes, being in Italy, it's something you should care about!
Organic fresh fruit
Your personal MacBook

Free cookies, if you deserve them
Much more...

title: Jr Data Engineer
description:
Do you want to design, develop and operate extremely complex software whilst interacting with the global tech giants?
Do you want to work in (real) Big Data?
Do you want to steer away from consulting and instead work in a Product company?
Do you want to join a company of experienced professionals which is just starting its graduate program? Working among peers is great, but adding mentors gives you a real chance at learning!


Cuebiq is Italy's only true Big Data product company: we gather, analyse and engineer 5 billion GPS positions per day.

In a year or so we'll coach you and train you to become a real Big Data professional, delivering sophisticated software using a state-of-the-art technological stack comprising Spark, Kafka, and NoSQL databases. Along with these big data technologies, we also have a production-grade microservice architecture deployed on Kubernetes! Work within a pod and with agile methodology will become second nature to you.

Responsibilities:

You will get to be a part of our fantastic Core Data Assets team, in order to learn how to:


Have an impact on our data pipelines and architectures for stream and batch processes
Successfully push fixes and new features to improve and evolve the system
Learn from others and consistently take action when it is required
Analyze large datasets and processes to allow for data driven design
Collaborate with data scientists and product experts to build systems that are correct, reliable and scalable


Required skills:


A hunger for coding
Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematical Engineering, Electronic Engineering
Good English (we work a lot with our New York headquarter)
Good understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems
Programming skills: We mainly use Kotlin, but we value the experience in programming and not the specific language: show us you know REALLY how to use it, then we'll know you can learn any of our stack!
A positive and collaborative approach to teamwork


Bonus points for:


Experience with version control systems such as Git, SVN, Mercurial (we use Git)
Being at ease with industry standard software development tools (IDEs, etc.)
Machine learning, and statistical methods
Experience working in a distributed organization
The ability to say no ‚Äî and to explain why
Results driven mentality, delivery-oriented approach
Design Patterns knowledge



The perks we offer:


Pre-Covid days we traveled a lot, enjoyed our amazing offices with ping pong table, fully stocked kitchen, games, lounge area. We had a learning time every Friday in the office just before the aperitivo!
Now, since we are all remote-working since the Covid outbreak, still enjoy Zoom aperitivo and having a laugh together
The future? For sure we'll continue to value most life-work balance as we always have. We will define perks and operating mode in the times to come


About Cuebiq:

Cuebiq is a leading location data and insights company, providing marketers and data professionals in a range of industries, a trusted, high quality, and transparent currency for offline mobility data to map and measure the consumer journey. Cuebiq has the largest database of anonymous, accurate, and privacy-enhanced location data in the United States, and is at the forefront of industry privacy standards, follows a privacy-compliant framework in its data collection, and is one of the very first location providers certified by leading privacy association, NAI.

Cuebiq's AI-driven platform offers analytics, audiences, and cross-channel attribution capabilities, which empower brands and marketers to make better, more-informed business decisions and marketing strategies. Our first-party data and flexible toolset can be leveraged to expedite the development of custom location data-based solutions in a privacy-focused way.

Prioritizing the use of data to make the world a better place, Cuebiq's Data for Good program empowers top universities and nonprofit organizations across the globe with Cuebiq's location insights to drive innovation in community causes such as epidemiology and COVID-19 response, disaster relief, and urban development.

title: Big Data / Analytics / Business Intelligence / DWH Professionals (Experienced or Graduate)
description:

We are¬†looking for brilliant Project Managers, Business Analysts, Technical Architects, Back-end / Front End Experts and Developers, Data Scientists, Big Data Experts, Master Data Management Specialists, Corporate Performance Management Professionals with consolidated and proven experience on DWH / BI / Analytics / IoT who will be involved in important projects. ¬†

We are also looking for talented young people who have achieved the title of degree no more than 12 months ago or who will graduate within the academic year. ¬†




Role and Responsibilities:

Design and Develop Business Intelligence / DWH Projects or Big Data Analytical Platforms (based on Hadoop, Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services and related components and technologies) in important projects delivered for Italian Customers.
Design and Develop prototypes & proof-of-concepts in support of presales activities as well as support the development of standardized analytic offerings across multiple industries.

Qualifications:

For neograduates: Master‚Äôs Degree in one of the following areas: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics and Economics.

For experienced professionals: 2-10 years proven experience in Consulting Firms or System Integrators on projects of significant size and complexity. Appreciated experience also on technical presales / solutioning / business development.

In-depth knowledge of Business Intelligence / DWH, Analytics and Big Data platforms.
Deep knowledge on recent versions of main BI tools such as:




DBMS:¬†Oracle, Oracle Big Data Appliance, Google Big Query, Amazon Redshift, MS SQL Server, SAS, Teradata, IBM Netezza, My SQL, Oracle Exadata, SAP HANA, PostgreSQL, Vertica.

Corporate Performance Management:¬†Oracle Hyperion, SAP Business Planning Consolidation




Appreciated experience in software development projects with programming languages like Java, Python, Spark and Docker containerization; knowledge of Linux and Shell programming / scripting




Business Knowledge developed on Telco and Media, Banking and Insurance, Energy and Utilities, Government, Manufacturing and Retail Industries




We also require:

Important relational and analytical skills.
Proactivity and ability to work in teams.
Focus on the goals
Attention to details and constant attention to quality.
Italian mother tongue.
Proficient English (both oral and written).
Willing to travel frequently to client locations within Italy or Europe.




We offer:

International environment.

Professional growth opportunities.

If you find yourself suitable for the role, please, send your CV in English.

title: Lead Data Scientist (MI)
description:
Vuoi essere parte della rivoluzione tecnologica?




Entra a far parte di¬†BIP ‚Äì xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenza e servizi innovativi in ambito Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

Stiamo ricercando per la nostra sede di Milano:




Lead Data Scientist




BIP ha creato all‚Äôinterno del proprio¬†Competence Centre ‚ÄúxTech‚Äù¬†il pi√π nutrito gruppo di Data Scientist in Italia (fonte: statistiche LinkedIn), e dall‚ÄôItalia coordina anche i propri gruppi di Data Scientist locali presso le sedi estere.

Nell'ambito¬†della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca di¬†¬†professionisti con 4-7 anni di esperienza¬†maturata in ambito¬†Data Science.

¬†

Il Lead Data Scientist in BIP gestisce¬†team di Data Scientist¬†occupandosi del¬†Business Development, della gestione delle risorse del proprio Team e delle progettualit√† seguite dal Team, favorendo un clima collaborativo orientato a risultati tangibili e ben comunicati ai propri clienti.

I nostri¬†Lead Data Scientist¬†verranno introdotti in un contesto organizzativo in cui dovranno gestire un portafoglio di clienti/iniziative, collaborando con gli altri dipartimenti di BIP nel processo di vendita, e proponendo un portafoglio di soluzioni innovative che contribuiranno ad evolvere nel tempo.




Parte fondamentale delle capacit√† del¬†Lead Data Scientist¬†√® la comprensione delle esigenze del Cliente, la capacit√† di tradurle in una proposta progettuale, commerciale e tecnica, di allocare il giusto team mix di Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Data analyst e BI Expert per l‚Äôerogazione delle attivit√†, il Project Management delle progettualit√† pi√π complesse e il Quality Advisory su tutte le progettualit√†.




Inoltre il¬†Lead Data Scientist¬†dovr√† gestire gli aspetti amministrativi della gestione ordinaria, e contribuire alle attivit√† di Community volte a evolvere l‚Äôoffering e a potenziare le capacit√† del team.

¬†

Le attivit√† di presale e progettuali spaziano da tematiche di Advisory, a modelli di Machine Learning, a creazione di Data Platform o attivit√† di Data Engineering a progetti di BI, di Data Governance o a situazioni composite in cui pi√π di queste componenti sono incluse in un programma articolato.




Il nostro Lead Data Scientist √® un professionista motivato a evolvere sia il proprio lato tecnologico (competenze AI / ML e data engineering), sia il proprio lato consulenziale/manageriale, evolvendo sempre pi√π verso un profilo di vendita e coordinamento risorse e progetti.







Competenze ricercate

¬†

Requisiti Indispensabili:

Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM);¬†Saranno valutati anche profili di background Economia/Finanza/Gestionale purch√® sia presente un‚Äôattitudine dimostrata agli aspetti tecnologici della Data Science
Forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche;
Competenze statistiche, di Data Mining, Machine Learning;
Esperienza nella gestione di team in ambito data projects
Capacit√† di composizione di offerte tecnico/economiche e esperienze in ambito vendita/prevendita di progetti legati ai dati
Solida conoscenza e comprovata esperienza in programmazione e scripting con uno o pi√π dei seguenti linguaggi: Python, R, Bash
¬†Esperienza con strumenti di version control (es. Git);
Comprensione di tecnologie legate ai Big Data come Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark
Conoscenza di tematiche di Deep Learning, NLP e analisi dati non strutturati
Conoscenza dei linguaggi PySpark o Scala
Conoscenza approfondita di database relazionali e di costrutti SQL e SQL Programming;
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali




¬†

Plus:

Conoscenza di database non relazionali
Conoscenza e l‚Äôutilizzo di API Cloud di Intelligenza Artificiale dei principali cloud provider (Google, Microsoft, AWS, IBM) e di altri strumenti di Advanced Analytics di Vendor specializzati
Certificazioni di Project/Program Management

¬†




Soft Skills:

Standing consulenziale
Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Buona attitudine a coordinare team e a lavorare in team
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† per trasferte in Italia e all‚Äôestero




Verr√† data priorit√† ai candidati che dimostreranno in sede di intervista di avere un‚Äôattitudine a sviluppare e ricercare soluzioni innovative o a evolvere l‚Äôofferta tecnico/commerciale.

¬†




Inserimento




L'inquadramento e la retribuzione saranno commisurati in base all'effettiva competenza maturata nel settore. Offriamo un percorso di crescita stimolante e meritocratico all'interno di un‚Äôazienda giovane e in costante crescita.




Nel caso in cui il tuo curriculum sia valutato in linea rispetto alla posizione, organizzeremo un primo incontro per approfondire la reciproca conoscenza. Diversamente conserveremo il tuo curriculum all‚Äôinterno del nostro database e sar√† nostra premura ricontattarti in futuro, qualora si aprissero opportunit√† coerenti con il tuo percorso e le tue competenze.

title: Data Engineer
description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.




We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.




We're looking for Data Engineer.




The ideal candidate will support Data & Insight team. The goal is to work mostly on the backend of the BI infrastructure, building Dimensional / Analytical models starting from heterogeneous data (relational databases, JSON objects, flattened tables, API and Services).







Responsibilities:

Be the main reference for the BI modeling of data
Collect requirements from functional leaders
Conceptualize a short and long term strategy, supporting the Head of Data
Develop the end-to-end solutions and maintain them: from data discovery to modeling
Manage and maintain systems and processes, including strong documentation (Data Dictionary)




Requirements:

3 to 5 years of experience in building DWH/BI schemas (Dimensional Modeling, Data Assurance, Data Quality), maintaining and documenting them.
Strong knowledge of SQL, ETL tools and methodologies
Knowledge of Google BigQuery (preferable), Amazon Redshift or similar DWH engines
Knowledge of Master Data Management fundamentals
Ability to summarize and visualize data in an effective and nice way
Capable of dealing with high volume and variety of data in a optimize-while-you-build mindset
Ability to manipulate data with confidence and precision
Knowledge of web marketing and its data sources (Facebook, Adwords etc.) is a plus
Knowledge of Microsoft PowerBI and DAX is a plus
Data Science skills (mathematics and statistics, machine learning) are a plus
Strict adherence to deadlines
Fluent English is mandatory




Personal Skills:

Analytics and problem solving skills
Strong communication skills
Agile mindset
Results driven
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Smart, intelligent, organised and adaptable with the ability to speak to people on all levels in order to deliver vital insight




Benefits:

Career Path
Training
Flexible hiurs
International team

title: Global Sales - Data Scientist
description:
Who we are

Amplifon is an Italian multinational company and the global leader in hearing care solutions and services for retail expertise, customization and consumer care. More than 17,500 professionals every day in a network of 4,500 points of sale, 3,800 service centers and 1,900 affiliates, give back the joy of hearing, feeling and living to thousands of people across the world.

In Amplifon we believe people are the most important component of our success. Thanks to our best-in-class Hearing Care Professionals and front and back office Teams, we are able to put the everyday taps, pops and splashes back into the lives of our customers. We believe that it‚Äôs only through strong investment in talent engagement, continuous professional development, support and recognition that our people can exceed every limit and build a fulfilling career.




What we are looking for

As Data Scientist for the Global Retail Excellence function, your area of responsibility will encompass the following activities. In particular:¬†

Uses advanced analytics methods to extract insights from business data
Performs analysis and builds data-driven models to answer business questions and needs
Creates hypotheses and experiments to identify hidden relationships to direct new Sales strategies
Visualizes information and develops reports on results of data analysis to monitor and support the Sales actions
Develop machine learning models with the aim to facilitate Sales processes
Preparation of presentation with data-based recommendations
Share the data-analysis best practices

¬†




What you'll need

Degree in quantitative fields like Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Computing and Engineering
Expertise in management of complex structures of data¬†
Have a strong inclination to data analysis combined with same attention to business impacts
Possess strong analytical skills, mathematic abilities and business acumen
Possess critical thinking, a clear and open communication, relational and team building skills
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to share information.
Excellent knowledge of Office package, with advanced expertise in Excel (pivot, macro, statistics formulas)
Excellent knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of R or Python
Nice to have: knowledge of PowerBI, SSRS, Dataiku
Fluent in English

title: Senior Analytics & Optimization Manager
description:
The Senior Analytics & Optimization Manager will play a key role in maintaining a portfolio of Analytics & Optimization clients' projects, either directly, or through advising others.







You will be responsible for leading the client data measurement, optimization and personalization strategy as well as the day to day management of assigned client accounts and planned campaigns, focusing on successful measurement insights discovery, measurement tracking implementation and optimisation of their marketing channels, journeys and web properties.






You will provide frequent input into Product design, Product evolution & evangelization, as well as liaise very closely with Directors and VPs on internal initiatives aiming to improve efficiency and quality of the work.






Last but not least, you will also be coaching and mentoring team members from both a strategic and technical point of view for Analytics and Optimization.














Responsibilities



Be a passionate subject matter expert on digital marketing, digital measurement, web analysis (inc. web analytics, app tracking, audience strategy, incremental revenue), Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), Personalization and Usability and possess a strong understanding of the media ecosystem, particularly GMP and mainstream optimization and personalization platforms
Drive performance of analytics and optimization capabilities to impact overall business results
Provide support and mentorship for other members of the team, ensuring they are progressively able to take on more complex tasks and upskill others
Find opportunities for the business to cross-sell other services, including data analysis, attribution, ad-tech, CRM integration, marketing automation, UX, Visual Design, Development, QA, etc
Work closely with the Development, QA, UX, Design, Content and Project Management teams to strategize, ideate, define and run the planned projects and campaigns and to communicate strategy, progress and results
Work closely with Directors and VPs to establish specialisms goals and strategies, defining processes and frameworks









Requirements:



What you'll need





Demonstrable experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, both web and apps, is required
Demonstrable experience with Google Optimize and/or other mainstream web & app Optimization and Personalization platforms (eg. Adobe Target, Evergage, Dynamic Yield, Monetate, Leanplum, Tune, Optimizely, Qubit, etc.)
Must have a fluent understanding of Google Marketing Platform, the key benefits and how to leverage the Google stack to the greatest advantage of clients
Deep, hands-on experience working with analytics and experience optimization solutions, ranging from auditing, campaign ideation, definition, setup, launch and reporting, measurement implementations, data analysis & insights, in-housing, presenting to large audiences and training
Strong experience in unearthing insights and forming optimization recommendations using heat-mapping, form analytics and live user testing
Experience with persona based marketing, UX methodologies and a good visual eye to detect what works well (and what doesn't) in a brand's journey
Strong analytical and visual thinking skills, with the ability to identify business questions, pain points and opportunities, analyse quantitative and qualitative data, prioritize findings using different models , and develop actionable recommendations and experimentation/personalisation roadmaps
Ability to clearly communicate processes, strategies and general requirements to both internal and external stakeholders
Able to manage projects and delegate seamlessly across multiple teams and regions, to ensure that all deliverables are as per Jellyfish standards and deadlines are met
Able to stay positive under pressure, teamwork with a diverse set of stakeholders and live Jellyfish's values: be positive, be the solution, be passionate, be accountable, be you



Advantageous:





Proficiency with Python/R or other scripting languages is highly desirable
Experience with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery, ability to query large databases and write SQL queries
Experience with (and positive results from) running campaigns on other web and app experience optimization / personalization platforms besides Google Optimize 360 would be highly desirable
Knowledge and experience with recent Google technologies and tools such as Google Analytics for Firebase, App+Web properties and Google Ads Data Hub is a very big plus
Knowledge and experience with Machine Learning principles and Marketing theory is a big plus
Knowledge and experience with advanced segmentation analysis, session playback, lo-fi wireframing, treejacking, designing polls and surveys will be a big plus
Nice to have experience with the following: Adobe Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Segment, Tableau and Looker

title: Data Scientist Chapter Lead
description:
Data Scientist Chapter Lead

Posting Country: Italy

Date Posted: 09-Jun-2021

Full Time / Part Time: Full Time

Contract Type: Permanent

At Vodafone, we're working hard to build a better future. A more connected, inclusive and sustainable world. As a dynamic global community, it's our human spirit, together with technology, that empowers us to achieve this.
We challenge and innovate in order to connect people, businesses, and communities across the world. Delighting our customers and earning their loyalty drive us, and we experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.
With us, you can be truly be yourself and belong, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive, and make a real difference.

Role purpose
In the Big Data Chapter / Big Data and Artificial Intelligence team we are looking for a Data Scientist Chapter Lead who will be responsible for providing strategic business information that generates revenue, reduces costs and improves the customer experience

Job Responsibilities

Delve into the data of different systems, structured and unstructured, both in batch and in real time, to discover hidden relationships and useful information
Translate complex datasets into key insights and powerful business capabilities
Use of machine learning / AI algorithms to run models on network investments, predictive maintenance
Use of machine learning / AI algorithms to perform modeling for marketing and sales: abandonment models, modeling of next best actions, customer segmentation, store locations etc ...
Develop in-depth dashboards to enable faster decision making
Identification of new data sources and evaluation of emerging technologies for the use of data discovery
Managing a team of data scientists with different levels of seniority
Mentoring of the young data scientists in the team
Presentation of the results to a technical and non-technical audience
Identification of new trends and analytical opportunities to drive the innovation agenda in Vodafone's global team
Join a community of Vodafone Data Scientists working in many countries

Your Skills And Qualifications Must Include

Master's degree in quantitative fields such as mathematics, statistics, computer science and engineering
4+ years of experience in the development, implementation and maintenance of Machine Learning / AI models and optimization algorithms
Practical experience with the Big Data Analytics landscape and related tools, in particular Hadoop, Hive / Impala, Spark (pyspark). Previous experience running analytics on cloud platforms is an advantage
Excellent knowledge of code using Python and experience in Python data analysis libraries such as panda, numpy and scikit-learn
Expert level experience with the mathematical foundations of modern machine learning / AI algorithms and statistics
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical results to a non-technical audience
Ability to guide junior data scientists in their skills, motivate them and build the company foundation for future growth
Curiosity, creativity and empirical mentality
Being detail-oriented

Basic knowledge of italian language is required.

Vodafone is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the very best people by offering a motivating and inclusive workplace in which talent is truly recognised and rewarded. We are committed to promoting Inclusion for All with the belief that diversity plays an important role in the success of our business. We actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of our journey.

Luca Giacomel
Co-Founder at Plexagon | We are hiring!

Python Software Engineer‚ÄîMarketing

Plexagon is looking for a world-class Python Software Engineer to join our international team.

Full-time ¬∑ Fully Remote (worldwide) or from our Milan office

We are building internal tools to help us serve our hundreds of thousands of monthly active users and scale the size of the company. We would like you to help us define and build our Marketing automation (ideally on Google Cloud) and expand the reach of our Marketing campaigns.

title: Growth Hacking Quant Analyst
description:
Growth Hacking Quant Analyst




Siamo alla ricerca di talenti da inserire all'interno del team Growth Hacking con il ruolo di¬†Growth Hacking Quant Analyst, che vogliano contribuire, tramite un solido toolset analitico ed un approccio data-driven, alla costante innovazione dei nostri canali di comunicazione e alla ricerca continua di nuove opportunit√† di crescita e acquisizione clienti.




Cosa Farai




La tua sfida pi√π grande sar√† quella di fronteggiare un mondo per sua natura mutevole e soggettivo, come quello del marketing e della comunicazione, con un approccio solido e oggettivo. Basandoti sulle tue capacit√† analitiche e sulle tue intuizioni, dovrai riuscire ad estrarre quanto pi√π valore possibile dal nostro patrimonio di dati, avendo come mission fondamentale la messa a terra di nuove idee per espandere i canali di acquisizione e di branding di Prima ed incrementarne le polizze vendute attraverso essi.




Sarai responsabile end-to-end dell‚Äôottimizzazione della comunicazione di Prima, con particolare focus su lead-generation, un lavoro che si articola su tre livelli principali:




Sviluppo di opportune analisi e what-if scenario, fondamentali per stimare la magnitudine dell‚Äôimpatto sul business delle tue idee
Identificazione di leve e idee innovative¬†per espandere strumenti ed efficacia dei canali di acquisizione
Validazione e messa in produzione, grazie anche alla collaborazione con gli altri team aziendali, nonch√©¬†monitoraggio di KPI e risultati, per migliorare continuamente l'efficacia delle varie iniziative lanciate




Chi Cerchiamo




Sei il nostro candidato ideale se possiedi i seguenti requisiti:




Eccellenti risultati accademici:




Hai una laurea in Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria Fisica o Ingegneria Aerospaziale con il massimo dei voti. Non sono necessarie esperienze lavorative pregresse, investiamo noi nella tua formazione.




Capacit√† logiche e analitiche




Padroneggi velocemente argomenti molto complessi, qualunque sia l'ambito. Riesci a intuire e modellizzare le dinamiche matematiche che guidano i fenomeni attorno a te e a cogliere i rapporti di causa ed effetto tra le forze in gioco.




Curiosit√† e passione




Osservi con sguardo critico il mondo che ti circonda e ti chiedi sempre "perch√©?". Pensi a come migliorare le cose e combatti per realizzare le tue idee. In Prima sarai incoraggiato a perseguire gli obiettivi comuni in maniera originale e innovativa, portando avanti le tue idee e generando valore in modo proattivo.




Coraggio




Sei in grado di prenderti i giusti rischi e assumerti grandi responsabilit√†. In Prima il progresso e lo sviluppo tecnologico passano soprattutto dall'intraprendenza e dalla voglia continua di sperimentare e mettersi in gioco, aprendosi al confronto con gli altri, talvolta fallendo, ma sostenendo sempre le proprie idee.







Nice to Have




Oltre ai requisiti di base, valuteremo con particolare attenzione queste caratteristiche:




Hai un'esperienza internazionale (come Erasmus o stage) e parli un inglese perfetto
Sei elastico e ben predisposto al lavoro in team e con persone dal diverso background e forma mentis
Reagisci positivamente ai cambiamenti e riesci ad adattarti rapidamente a nuovi task e deadline
Hai solide basi di statistica inferenziale, probabilit√† e machine learning
Hai solide basi di programmazione e realizzazione di algoritmi
Sai programmare in Python e conosci le principali librerie di analisi di dati e machine learning (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, XGBoost, Keras o TensorFlow)
Sai creare dataset utilizzando linguaggi per estrazione dati (come MySQL o Redshift)
Sai fare analisi e creare modelli in Excel







Tipoliga Contrattuale




Buoni pasto, momenti di formazione, eventi dedicati al team building, hardware e device di ultima generazione: in Prima troverai tutto quello di cui hai bisogno per svolgere al meglio il tuo lavoro in un ambiente giovane e informale. I nostri contratti sono regolati dal CCNL del Commercio e la retribuzione e la durata verranno valutati in sede di colloquio, perch√© vogliamo offrire un corrispettivo adeguato alla reale esperienza e competenza di ogni singola persona.




L'orario di lavoro √® Full Time. La nostra sede √® a Milano, in piazza Cordusio, ma valutiamo anche assunzioni in full remote.

Nell‚Äôambito della continua crescita ed evoluzione di questo effervescente gruppo, che opera sui nostri clienti in tutti i settori, e ci ha consentito di introdurre l‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale presso le realt√† enterprise pi√π importanti d‚ÄôItalia, siamo alla ricerca di neolaureati e professionisti con 1-3 anni di esperienza maturata in ambito Data Science.

¬†

Il Data Scientist in Bip evolve non solo le proprie competenze di AI e Machine Learning, ma anche la comprensione dei fenomeni legati al Business dei nostri Clienti e le proprie capacit√† di tradurli in algoritmi, comunicando e utilizzando i risultati degli stessi per migliorare ed efficientare i processi.

I nostri Data Scientist verranno introdotti in contesti progettuali dove comprenderanno le esigenze del Cliente, daranno indicazione ai Data Engineer sulla preparazione dei dati desiderata, sceglieranno o costruiranno i migliori mix di modelli pi√π adatti al caso specifico, discuteranno gli output con il cliente e consegneranno il modello per l‚Äôottimizzazione e passaggio in produzione finale ai Data Engineer.

In contesti pi√π semplificati in cui la componente di Data Engineering √® meno elaborata, i nostri Data Scientist procederanno in autonomia anche nella data preparation e nel porting in produzione dei modelli ingegnerizzati.

Oltre alle progettualit√†, ai Data Scientist sar√† richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development.

Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† per trasferte in Italia e all‚Äôestero




Verr√† data priorit√† ai candidati che dimostreranno in sede di intervista di avere un‚Äôattitudine a sviluppare e ricercare soluzioni innovative.

Inserimento

title: Manager, Operations Research
description:
What You‚Äôll Do

This is an opportunity to be a key member of Bain‚Äôs expanding advanced analytics capability area. This position will be part of the Advanced Analytics Group (Bain‚Äôs team of Operations Research, Data Science, Engineering, Marketing Science and Primary research experts).

The role will focus on hands-on applications in demand forecasting and sales & operations planning analytics to address clients‚Äô business problems; providing expertise in forecasting techniques and solutions, coaching other data scientists on implementation, interpretation, and communication of forecasting solutions.

This person can be located in any of the Bain EMEA offices

Forecast improvements : Audit, identify, value, and scope opportunities to improve client forecasts and forecast models through better data, assumptions, algorithms, forecast methods, planning processes, and technology.
Forecast insights : Generate qualitative and quantitative insights on demand drivers, sources of forecast error, and opportunities to improve forecast and planning systems. Embed metrics, insights and recommendations within the context of clients‚Äô needs, results and ability to adopt recommendations. Evaluate current and future forecast-ability at different hierarchies. De-layer forecast accuracy and value added to understand how different levers influence results. Analyze sales, demand, and planning history for insights to improve future forecasts and planning outcomes. Connect forecast and planning outcomes to other business decisions, e.g. ordering, production planning, inventory and service level policies, and financial budgeting.
Forecast technology : Advice Bain and client teams on forecast and planning processes, platforms, software and systems. Assist in discussions and decisions on advanced planning solutions, analytics and technical infrastructure. Assess clients‚Äô opportunities to improve results by bringing systems up to par or investing in newer technologies and innovations.
Forecast delivery : Execute, manage and train/coach colleagues on forecasting delivery, tools and best practices.Execute data queries and preparation to support forecast diagnostics and results. Evaluate, prioritize, merge, aggregate and feature engineer internal and external, quantitative and qualitative data in preparation for forecast modelling and planning decisions, including internal and external sales, promotion, marketing, economic, weather and other data.Build forecast models using a variety of methods, including statistical, consensus, collaborative and machine learning approaches and guide embedding these models into Bain tools or inside client forecast systems.Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations. Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate client understanding
Broader Operations Analytics Support : Collaborate with other Operations Research and Data Science colleagues to deliver analytics insights and solutions, e.g. inventory, sourcing, logistics, scheduling, production planning, pricing, promotion, retail portfolio, etc.
Analytics Leadership : Assist client-facing leadership with client development, proposals, and client communications. Lead analytics delivery and coordinate efforts with general business consultants to drive results for the client. Communicate effectively with analytics/data experts, Bain consulting teams, client business leaders and executives of all levels to assess opportunities and develop analytics solutions for Bain clients. Translate business objectives into data and analytics solutions and workplans. Manage and adapt workplans in response to client situations, priorities, and data realities.Manage project risks and opportunities to maintain productivity, profitability, and build client loyalty.Work with Bain‚Äôs practice leaders to productize solutions for repeat sales and innovate for new revenue. Stay abreast of development in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients.

About You

At least 6 years‚Äô experience in analytics related roles.
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a related discipline such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, quantitative Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
Experience with building operational forecasts for a wide range of business contexts, e.g. production planning, inventory, field scheduling, staffing, procurement, etc.
Expertise in developing forecast results using a wide range of methods:
Statistical forecasting methodologies: ARIMA and related time series, causal/structural, consensus, traditional and ensemble techniques
Applications of machine learning techniques to forecasting, e.g. Gradient Boosting Machines, Neural Nets, Bayesian methods, etc.
Incorporation of expert judgements and risk scenarios into the forecast results
Experience with enterprise forecasting, advanced planning, and integrated business planning systems (e.g. SAP, Oracle, Logility, SAS, JDA, etc). Experience with and ability to discuss and help clients select IT architectures that will support their advanced planning and forecasting goals.
Candidate will be able to advice clients on where they can automate forecasting and planning and how to best enable human-in-the-loop processes.
Experience working with internal sources and suppliers (backward, upstream) and customers (forward, downstream) to improve forecasts
Strong data engineering and data science skills. Familiarity with a variety of statistical and modelling tools and programming languages, especially R and/or Python.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong skills in scoping, problem definition and problem solving under time constraints
Strong English skills required
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to work independently
50% travel is likely ‚Äì post pandemic


Nice to have

Experience building forecasts in a variety of industries, e.g. retail, consumer products, advanced manufacturing, utilities
Knowledge and experience applying demand forecasting in services contexts (e.g., airline yield management, field scheduling & routing)
Experience building forecasts for a variety of non-operational business applications including forecasts to support strategic initiatives, marketing (e.g. pricing, promotion, and demand shaping), investment planning
Experience with a broader range of operations research applications (e.g. optimization, simulation, supply chain analytics, marketing optimization, maintenance scheduling, supply demand matching)

About Us

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world‚Äôs most ambitious change makers define the future.

Across 59 offices in 37 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest over $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise and insight to organizations tackling today‚Äôs urgent challenges in education, racial equity and social justice, economic development and the environment. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

title: Manager, Operations Research
description:
CVs must be submitted in English to be considered for this role

What Makes Us a Great Place To Work

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor‚Äôs Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents .

Who You‚Äôll Work With

Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group is a team of high-impact quantitative technology specialists who solve statistical, machine learning, and data engineering challenges that we encounter in our client engagements. AAG team members hold advanced degrees in subjects ranging across statistics, mathematics, computer sciences and other quantitative disciplines, and have backgrounds in a variety of fields including data science, marketing analytics and academia.

What You‚Äôll Do

This is an opportunity to be a key member of Bain‚Äôs expanding advanced analytics capability area. This position will be part of the Advanced Analytics Group (Bain‚Äôs team of Operations Research, Data Science, Engineering, Marketing Science and Primary research experts).

The role will focus on hands-on applications in demand forecasting and sales & operations planning analytics to address clients‚Äô business problems; providing expertise in forecasting techniques and solutions, coaching other data scientists on implementation, interpretation, and communication of forecasting solutions.

This person can be located in any of the Bain EMEA offices

Forecast improvements: Audit, identify, value, and scope opportunities to improve client forecasts and forecast models through better data, assumptions, algorithms, forecast methods, planning processes, and technology.
Forecast insights: Generate qualitative and quantitative insights on demand drivers, sources of forecast error, and opportunities to improve forecast and planning systems. Embed metrics, insights and recommendations within the context of clients‚Äô needs, results and ability to adopt recommendations.

Evaluate current and future forecast-ability at different hierarchies.
De-layer forecast accuracy and value added to understand how different levers influence results. Analyze sales, demand, and planning history for insights to improve future forecasts and planning outcomes.
Connect forecast and planning outcomes to other business decisions, e.g. ordering, production planning, inventory and service level policies, and financial budgeting.
Forecast technology: Advice Bain and client teams on forecast and planning processes, platforms, software and systems. Assist in discussions and decisions on advanced planning solutions, analytics and technical infrastructure. Assess clients‚Äô opportunities to improve results by bringing systems up to par or investing in newer technologies and innovations.
Forecast delivery:

Execute, manage and train/coach colleagues on forecasting delivery, tools and best practices.
Execute data queries and preparation to support forecast diagnostics and results. Evaluate, prioritize, merge, aggregate and feature engineer internal and external, quantitative and qualitative data in preparation for forecast modelling and planning decisions, including internal and external sales, promotion, marketing, economic, weather and other data.
Build forecast models using a variety of methods, including statistical, consensus, collaborative and machine learning approaches and guide embedding these models into Bain tools or inside client forecast systems.
Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations.
Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate client understanding
Broader Operations Analytics Support: Collaborate with other Operations Research and Data Science colleagues to deliver analytics insights and solutions, e.g. inventory, sourcing, logistics, scheduling, production planning, pricing, promotion, retail portfolio, etc.
Analytics Leadership: Assist client-facing leadership with client development, proposals, and client communications. Lead analytics delivery and coordinate efforts with general business consultants to drive results for the client.

Communicate effectively with analytics/data experts, Bain consulting teams, client business leaders and executives of all levels to assess opportunities and develop analytics solutions for Bain clients.
Translate business objectives into data and analytics solutions and workplans. Manage and adapt workplans in response to client situations, priorities, and data realities.
Manage project risks and opportunities to maintain productivity, profitability, and build client loyalty.
Work with Bain‚Äôs practice leaders to productize solutions for repeat sales and innovate for new revenue.
Stay abreast of development in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients.


About You

At least 6 years‚Äô experience in analytics related roles.
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a related discipline such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, quantitative Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
Experience with building operational forecasts for a wide range of business contexts, e.g. production planning, inventory, field scheduling, staffing, procurement, etc.
Expertise in developing forecast results using a wide range of methods:
Statistical forecasting methodologies: ARIMA and related time series, causal/structural, consensus, traditional and ensemble techniques
Applications of machine learning techniques to forecasting, e.g. Gradient Boosting Machines, Neural Nets, Bayesian methods, etc.
Incorporation of expert judgements and risk scenarios into the forecast results
Experience with enterprise forecasting, advanced planning, and integrated business planning systems (e.g. SAP, Oracle, Logility, SAS, JDA, etc). Experience with and ability to discuss and help clients select IT architectures that will support their advanced planning and forecasting goals.
Candidate will be able to advice clients on where they can automate forecasting and planning and how to best enable human-in-the-loop processes.
Experience working with internal sources and suppliers (backward, upstream) and customers (forward, downstream) to improve forecasts
Strong data engineering and data science skills. Familiarity with a variety of statistical and modelling tools and programming languages, especially R and/or Python.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong skills in scoping, problem definition and problem solving under time constraints
Strong English skills required
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to work independently
50% travel is likely ‚Äì post pandemic

Nice to have

Experience building forecasts in a variety of industries, e.g. retail, consumer products, advanced manufacturing, utilities
Knowledge and experience applying demand forecasting in services contexts (e.g., airline yield management, field scheduling & routing)
Experience building forecasts for a variety of non-operational business applications including forecasts to support strategic initiatives, marketing (e.g. pricing, promotion, and demand shaping), investment planning
Experience with a broader range of operations research applications (e.g. optimization, simulation, supply chain analytics, marketing optimization, maintenance scheduling, supply demand matching)


About Us

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world‚Äôs most ambitious change makers define the future.

Across 59 offices in 37 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest over $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise and insight to organizations tackling today‚Äôs urgent challenges in education, racial equity and social justice, economic development and the environment. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

title: Google Cloud Platform Data Scientist [Online / Phone Recruitment]
description:
Our strength is our people! You will lead technology innovation for our clients through robust delivery of world-class solutions. With Accenture‚Äôs Google Cloud Business Group, you will work with best-in-class technologies, to rapidly address the disruption our clients are going through by bringing together our global Accenture capabilities and Google‚Äôs disruptive technologies.

What would you do?



Work within a multicultural, international and inclusive team


Collaborate with Clients to formulate business problems as data problems, and to choose the most fitting technical solutions while ensuring key business drivers are captured


Lay out complex cloud data pipelines, drawing from different sources both in batches and as streams, to feed our many data models


Explore massive raw datasets searching for outliers, anomalies impurities, or potentially important insights uncovering underlying structure of the data


Design machine learning and deep learning model architectures in the best frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow and PyTorch


Train and deploy models inside Google Cloud, leveraging best Cloud GPUs and TPUs, and building automated predictive pipelines to minimize effort in development and production


Inspect trained algorithms, testing their robustness, generalization and explainability, in order to select the best ones and produce meaningful business-oriented reports and visualizations


Leverage many different resources, both internal and from our partner Google, to keep up to date with the most relevant advancements in the ML landscape



You will have the opportunity to learn and work with Accenture‚Äôs certified Google Fellows and certified Google Cloud practitioners.

We are looking for people strongly driven by curiosity and with a scientific background, solid logical-analytical reasoning and a creative approach to mathematical modelling and problem-solving.



STEM degree


Preferred 1-year experience with Python, numpy and either TensorFlow or PyTorch


Familiarity with Big Data open-source tools such Spark, Hive, Apache Beam and Apache Kafka or their correspondents hosted on GCP


Familiarity with a SQL dialect and with relational and NoSQL databases.


Positively valued active certifications as Google Cloud Data Engineer, Google Cloud ML Engineer and/or Tensorflow Developer



Are you determined to face and beat off the challenges this role brings even if you don't have all the required qualifications? Apply and tell us how you can make a difference.

Unleash your talent and build your career with us. Visit our website and discover the FAQ section to better plan your application: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/

For further information, visit our website: professioni.accenture.it

title: Senior Digital analytics manager
description:
Senior Manager - Digital analytics and campaign optimization




About us




Jellyfish is your digital partner. We support and drive digital transformation by providing the right technology, strategy and training.




We are one of the world‚Äôs fastest-growing agencies in the world, and are hiring a number of talented people across our expanding global network.




We are Google‚Äôs leading global partner. And our close relationship is growing where we are, what we do and how we deliver it. And to do this, we want to grow our skillset. We‚Äôd like you to join our journey as ONE Jellyfish.




The Senior digital analytics manager will help us achieve our vision through defined initiatives is accountable for teams‚Äô performance and aids with key strategic accounts. Skills include, but not limited to: consulting, attribution, machine learning, audience creation, personalisation.




Description

The Senior Analytics & Optimization Manager will play a key role in maintaining a portfolio of Analytics & Optimization clients‚Äô projects, either directly, or through advising others.




You will be responsible for leading the client data measurement, optimization and personalization strategy as well as the day to day management of assigned client accounts and planned campaigns, focusing on successful measurement insights discovery, measurement tracking implementation and optimisation of their marketing channels, journeys and web properties.




You will provide frequent input into Product design, Product evolution & evangelization, as well as liaise very closely with Directors and VPs on internal initiatives aiming to improve efficiency and quality of the work.




Responsibilities

Be a passionate subject matter expert on digital marketing, digital measurement, web analysis (inc. web analytics, app tracking, audience strategy, incremental revenue), Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), Personalization and Usability and possess a strong understanding of the media ecosystem, particularly GMP and mainstream optimization and personalization platforms
Drive performance of analytics and optimization capabilities to impact overall business results
Provide support and mentorship for other members of the team, ensuring they are progressively able to take on more complex tasks and upskill others




What you‚Äôll need

Demonstrable experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, both web and apps, is required
Demonstrable experience with Google Optimize and/or other mainstream web & app Optimization and Personalization platforms (eg. Adobe Target, Evergage, Dynamic Yield, Monetate, Leanplum, Tune, Optimizely, Qubit, etc.)
Must have a good understanding of Google Marketing Platform, the key benefits and how to leverage the Google stack to the greatest advantage of clients
Deep, hands-on experience working with analytics and experience optimization solutions, ranging from auditing, campaign ideation, definition, setup, launch and reporting, measurement implementations, data analysis & insights, in-housing, presenting to large audiences and training
Strong experience in unearthing insights and forming optimization recommendations using heat-mapping, form analytics and live user testing




This is a great opportunity to take your career to the next level.

description:

Elena Doardo
Senior HR Generalist at Jobrapido | HRBP | Talent Management | HR Manager

Jobrapido is the world‚Äôs leading job search engine. As industry frontrunners Jobrapido is shaping a new standard in online job searching; to revolutionize the way people get jobs. Jobrapido analyses and aggregates job listings from all over the web, so that candidates can find all relevant jobs in one place. Using pioneering technology and innovative products, Jobrapido connects the dots between great employers and stellar candidates. Established in 2006, Jobrapido lists over 20 million jobs every month, records 60 million visits per month and has almost 100 million registered users. From its headquarters in Milan, Jobrapido conducts business in 58 countries, and helps job seekers to apply for a role in line with their expectations, and those who offer jobs find the right candidate for the role. From April 2014, Jobrapido is part of the Symphony Technology Group (STG).

Our HQ offices are located in Milan in the beautiful Cadorna Square at a walk distance from the Train and Metro station.




About the role




We are growing and we are looking for a Big Data Software Engineer that will work on collecting, storing, processing and analysing huge sets of data. The fundamental values of Panerai are based on history and the sea world, authenticity, exclusivity and rarity, product identity, Italian design and Swiss technology.

Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline. Ideally Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Informatics, Data Science or, Engineering or Business Administration
Strong analysis, documentation, and communication skills
Highly analytical, able to draw conclusions from sales reports, web analytics, and other systems.

title: Analytics Business Lead
description:
Direct message the job poster from Generali Italia

Cecilia Tasinato, Assoc CIPD
HR Specialist - Employer Branding & Digital Recruiting at Generali

Generali Italia, primo Gruppo assicurativo italiano, posizionato tra i principali player mondiali di riferimento con un approccio innovativo e tecnologicamente all‚Äôavanguardia, opera su tutto il territorio nazionale fornendo un servizio ad oltre 6 milioni di clienti.




All'interno del team di Advanced Analytics stiamo cercando un Analytics Business Lead.




La nuova figura sar√† coinvolta principalmente nelle seguenti attivit√†:

Avr√† la responsabilit√† di gestione end-to-end di uno o pi√π progetti di Advanced Analytics, coordinando team di progetto composti da Data Scientists e Data Engineers.¬†
In particolare, la figura sar√† responsabile di stimolare e raccogliere i bisogni di business, di guidare il team di progetto nella raccolta e nella definizione del modello dati (interni, esterni alle realt√† aziendale), nello sviluppo della soluzione di Analytics e nella sua messa in produzione - in coerenza con il soddisfacimento dei requisiti della linea e dei processi aziendali. Sar√† inoltre responsabile di comunicare in forma opportuna le indicazioni emerse dalle analisi e dai modelli, di misurare e monitorare l‚Äôimpatto della soluzione adottata in termini di business
Lavorer√† in stretto allineamento con le diverse funzioni di linea (sia tecniche che commerciali)

¬†

In tal senso siamo alla ricerca di una persona con una forte attitudine al team-work nell‚Äôambito di iniziative cross-funzionali, senso di responsabilit√† e capacit√† di lavorare per obiettivi.







Il/la candidato/a ideale √® in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

Ottima conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di sviluppo (es: Python, R, Scala, etc) e delle principali librerie di Machine Learning (es: Scikit Learn, Numpy, Pandas, etc) e di linguagio SQL, gradita la conoscenza di nozioni base del calcolo parallelo (es: Spark)
Buona conoscenza delle tecniche e strumenti per la messa in produzione dei modelli Analytics (es: unit tests, CI/CD). E‚Äô gradita esperienza di sviluppo su piattaforme Cloud (es: Google, AWS, Azure)
Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e conoscenza di strumenti di Data Visualization (es: Tableau)
Esperienza pregressa nel coordinamento di team per la gestione di progetti in ambito Data Science, Big Data e Artificial Intelligence
Spinta alla creazione di business insights e conoscenza di dominio di business (preferibilmente assicurativo) attraverso la comprensione dei processi e dei principali KPI industriali e finanziari
