title: Backend Developer - Python
description:
We are looking for a Python Backend Developer to join our AI team. The Python Backend Developer will develop, implement, optimize, and maintain our cloud-based Artificial Intelligence services and solutions.

Working in Agile Scrum with our team of Python Developers, Data Scientists, and SysOps/MLOps engineers, you shall design, develop and maintain optimal solutions for our products, in accordance with company best practices and security policies, and you will have the opportunity to become an expert in cloud-based Machine Learning systems.

We are looking for a real team player with excellent fundamental Python programming and software engineering skills. Our team believes in a positive work-life balance and in doing challenging, yet impactful work. If this sounds like you, apply today!

Reports To: Functional Product Owner

Location: Biassono, Italy and remote in Italy

Responsibilities

Design and develop Software Projects (Python language mainly) for hosting and serving Machine Learning models in the Cloud, in order to empower the Docebo products with AI-powered advanced features
Interact with Data Scientists and SysOps/MLOps in the Docebo AI team, providing development and SW engineering capabilities, and making recommendations based on best practices and production needs
Design, develop, deploy and maintain internal libraries and tools
Maintain, improve and evolve existing systems already deployed in production
Interact with Docebo Architecture Team for delivering the AI solutions in production on the AWS Cloud
Be a good Agile teammate:

Address CI/CD methodologies and techniques
Implement Fast-Fail strategies
Have a good self-job organization
Have a great collaborative attitude within a cross-functional team
Meet challenging deadlines
Be open-minded, cooperative, and constructive on the job
Contribute actively to Agile ceremonies (refinement, planning, daily, review, and retrospective)


Requirements

Degree in computer science or a similar field
Very strong Python (3.x) programming skills and solid knowledge of the Python ecosystem as a whole
Good working knowledge of Docker
Knowledge of Linux/Unix and shell scripting (e.g. bash)
Familiarity with Cloud development and Cloud environments at large.
Confidence with CI/CD methodologies and tools. Experience with GitLab a plus
Ability to contribute to designing and implementing data pipelines in the Cloud, as necessary to accrue and maintain data sets for varied Data Science and Machine Learning applications.
Attitude to working in teams, coupled with strong communication skills. As we work in a multi-national and multi-cultural environment, you shall be confident expressing yourself in English, both in technical and non-technical contexts.
Experience with Agile work methodologies for software projects is a plus


Nice To Have

Familiarity with the data science software lifecycle.
Familiarity with programming techniques and tools to build Cloud-based data pipelines for the acquisition and integration of structured and unstructured information into well-organized and well-maintained data sets.
Knowledge of Snowflake, Spark and AWS.


About Docebo

Here at Docebo, we power learning experiences for over 2,000 customers around the world with our easy-to-use, AI-powered Suite designed to close the enterprise learning loop. We have successfully achieved 2 IPOs (TSX: DCBO & NASDAQ: DCBO), been recognized as a Top SaaS e-learning Solution, and are growing exponentially in the process.

Docebo is a global company with offices in North America, EMEA, LATAM and more. Our people believe in six core values, simply defined and manifested in everything we do - Innovation, Simplicity, Accountability, Togetherness, Curiosity, and Impact. If this sounds like you, now is your time to join one of the fastest-growing learning technology companies on the market. Apply today!

Docebo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our workforce. All qualified applicants and employees will receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, citizenship status, age, disability, genetic information, or any other category protected under applicable law.

Any individuals with a disability requiring a reasonable accommodation to assist with their job search or application for employment should send an e-mail to recruiting_accommodations (at) docebo.com. The e-mail should include a description of the requested accommodation and the position you‚Äôre applying for or interested in.

title: Senior Specialist, Operations Research
description:
CVs must be submitted in English to be considered for this role

What Makes Us a Great Place To Work

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor‚Äôs Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

Who You‚Äôll Work With

Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group is a team of high-impact quantitative technology specialists who solve statistical, machine learning, and data engineering challenges that we encounter in our client engagements. AAG team members hold advanced degrees in subjects ranging across statistics, mathematics, computer sciences and other quantitative disciplines, and have backgrounds in a variety of fields including data science, marketing analytics and academia.

The role will involve advising on the application of forecasting, planning, simulation, and optimization to solve clients‚Äô challenges; leading the implementation of Management Science / Operations Research techniques within the Advanced Analytics Group; and coaching client-facing consultants on implementation, interpretation, and communication of solutions.

Applications will be broad and global including supply chain and logistics, inventory and resource planning, manufacturing and retail, network and service operations, and marketing and sales.

What You‚Äôll Do

Apply best practice statistical, simulation, optimization, and prescriptive analytics to management and operations problems
Work with Bain consultants and Advanced Analytics experts to clarify and define business objectives and identify practical value-added analytics solutions
Translate business problems into practical solutions for statistical analysis, simulation and optimization. Develop data requirements and analytics plan to fit time, tool and budget considerations
Formulate statistical, mathematical and/or simulation models including: establish the appropriate framework, set constants and variables, evaluate and set assumptions, define stochastic processes, determine alternatives and decision factors, define objectives and constraints.
Implement, evaluate and validate algorithms, statistical processes, and optimization and simulation models
Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations
Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate use of algorithms by clients in day to day and strategic decisions after Bain projects end
Train and coach consultants on basic statistical, optimization, and simulation procedures. Assist in knowledge transfer and deployment with end-clients
Train and coach other AAG colleagues on skills, processes and tools required so support OR, Optimization, Simulation, and Forecasting related work
Stay abreast of developments in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients. Identify trends in Data Science and Digital that will impact Bain and AAG work and help bring those perspectives to the AAG team and Practice leaders
Communicate with and educate both senior and junior colleagues to further embed management science and operations analytics across the firm


About You

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Fluent in English. Other European languages are a plus
Strong skills in scoping, problem definition and problem solving under time constraints
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a related discipline such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, quantitative Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
Familiarity with a variety of operations analytics applications including supply chain and logistics, inventory and resource planning, manufacturing and retail, network and service operations, and marketing and sales
Expertise in Optimization techniques, languages, and experience in formulating and implementing optimization solvers, linear, integer, non-linear. Able to reformulate complex problems into more tractable solutions, including use of heuristic algorithms. Familiar with advanced optimization modelling languages, e.g. Gurobi, CPLEX
Strong skills in data engineering (e.g. SQL, R, Python)
Familiarity with dynamic, discrete event, and stochastic simulation methods and languages
Must thrive in a fast paced environment and be able to work independently
Up to 50% travel required post-pandemic


Ideal Candidates Will Also Have Experience In

Expertise in statistical modelling, data science and machine learning applications.
Experience in risk modelling and building decision support tools
Strong skills in multi-dimensional modelling and enterprise, ERP/MRP databases, e.g. Hyperion, Oracle, SAP, EPC, etc.
Experience with advanced simulation modelling and tools. May include Excel-based modelling applications and simulation/solver add-in solutions, e.g. Oracle Crystal Ball and Optquest, Lindo What‚Äôs Best, or Frontline Solvers (optional). May include simulation tools and languages eg. SAS/OR, Lindo, AIMMS, AnyLogic. Optional experience with application specific software e.g. Llamasoft (supply chain) or Terralign (Sales Territory)


About Us

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world‚Äôs most ambitious change makers define the future. Across 59 offices in 37 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest more than $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise and insight to organizations tackling today‚Äôs urgent challenges in education, racial equity, social justice, economic development and the environment. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

title: Vice President, Advanced Analytics & Prototyping, SpendingPulse
description:
Our Purpose We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team ‚Äì one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results. Job Title Vice President, Advanced Analytics & Prototyping, SpendingPulse All About Us:
Who is Mastercard - What role do we play in the modern world? Are we an enabler of purchases or a facilitator for transactions? We play a much larger role in the world by enabling those that have no access to financial systems ‚Äì every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We have the technology, people and Brand to serve modern society. Today, we are a global tech company that connects everyone to endless possibilities, priceless possibilities.
Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. Client verticals include Financial Institutions, Retail & Commerce and Digital Partners, Governments and many others.
SpendingPulse‚Ñ¢ leverages Mastercard data to deliver timely insights and forecasts on macroeconomic trends around sales performance across sectors, geographies, and channels. These insights are the only macroeconomic indicators of industry performance based on actual, near real-time spend data. SpendingPulse‚Ñ¢ is a global product providing sales and growth estimates across 25+ retail sectors and sub-sectors are key economies around the world. All about the role The Mastercard SpendingPulse product reports timely insights and forecasts to internal and external stakeholders. The analytics modelling and prototyping team oversees all new prototyping and development of new reports, vertical and geographies as well as all production efforts. The candidate is responsible for the development and improvement of the models across the entire pipeline ‚Äì from data ingestion to statistical modeling and communicating the results to key stakeholders. The group analyzes & synthesizes data sets both from within Mastercard and beyond to bring powerful insights to life Key responsibilities include:
lead the design & refinement key economic and financial market dashboards and models, while guiding the maintenance and updates to our global product suite
guide the development new insights and reports in new markets, in particular in Europe and AP
play a pivotal role in helping shape the data science discipline and philosophy for the group with other team members
oversee the improvement of our modelling approaches, variables selection as well as back testing strategies
play an integral part in defining and executing the teams data strategy
lead the development and deployment of machine learning (supervised and unsupervised), NLP, time series analysis, and text analysis on economic and financial data sets
develop different algorithms to answer specific business questions and address custom client needs
research and integrate econometric and statistical models as needed to create insights and compelling visualizations of data trends to develop interactive solutions and presentations for customers
be proficient in translating business vision and specifications into data specifications, clear data structure and eventually a usable data set/model/forecast to either explore and/or create visualizations that bring the insights to life
participate in every stage of a project - even for stages they are not directly responsible for - from briefing to ideation, to content development to draft/prototyping, testing, feedback collection and finalization All about you
You are uniquely capable of both articulating the economic trends that you observe as well as leveraging the right tools and solutions to bring these concepts to life.
Quantitative modeling experience 10-12 years, ideally in a tech, research or geo spatial or finance field
Creative & passionate about statistics/math, economics, data, technology and its applications
A solid foundation in different modeling approaches and demonstrated success in managing large models and datasets
High level of proficiency with excel, VBA a plus
Advanced coding abilities in R and a passion for programming, familiarity with other programming languages (python, pyspark or scala) and big data engineering, is a plus.
A demonstrated interest in machine learning methods and statistics with the ability to communicate models in a non-technical manner
Solid foundation in economics with an advanced degree in math/statistics/quantitative field
Strong collaborator and independent thinker and able to oversee and lead other modelers and multiple projects
Proven ability to take customer needs and translate into analytical requirements
Experience with incorporating new modeling & AI approaches
Proven record of creativity/innovation/unorthodox thinking in data science/coding/a related field
Comfortable working in a fast paced and fluid environment, staying calm under pressure Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We‚Äôve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we‚Äôre all in this together. Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

title: Business Intelligence - Internship
description:
Cerved √® la data driven company italiana.

Aiutiamo il sistema paese a proteggersi dal rischio e a crescere in maniera sostenibile. Lo facciamo mettendo dati, tecnologia e talento al servizio di persone, imprese, banche e istituzioni.

Forniamo servizi per analizzare il rischio di credito, soluzioni per il marketing e la gestione di crediti problematici, e abbiamo all‚Äôinterno del gruppo una delle pi√π importanti agenzie di rating in Europa.

Siamo pionieri del big data eco-system e ogni giorno ci impegniamo ad essere attori del cambiamento e a costruire una cultura di fiducia e di inclusione in cui le oltre 2600 persone che lavorano con noi in Italia, Grecia, Romania e Svizzera possano esprimere e sviluppare il proprio talento.

Attraverso Cerved Credit Management Group siamo il primo player indipendente italiano nella valutazione, gestione e recupero di crediti problematici e beni connessi e all‚Äôinterno della nostra area Business Technology sviluppiamo strumenti innovativi e ad alto livello di automazione a supporto dell‚Äôintero ciclo di vita del credito che ci consentano di soddisfare gli standard richiesti dai clienti. Gestiamo progetti di elevata complessit√† per lo sviluppo di nuovi processi o prodotti, attraverso l'attivit√† di pianificazione, monitoraggio e definizione delle specifiche tecnico-funzionali.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
H-FARM √® una piattaforma dove innovazione, imprenditoria e formazione convivono e si contaminano l'una con l'altra. Nata nel 2005, √® stata la prima azienda al mondo ad adottare un modello che unisce investimenti, consulenza per le imprese e programmi di formazione aumentati al digitale in un unico luogo.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Cuebiq is Italy's only true Big Data product company: we gather, analyze, engineer and visualize 5 billion GPS positions per day, with the mission of providing unique business insights and offline analytics to our clients through our SaaS and PaaS products. We are an √©lite team of young, passionate, talented and friendly data professionals.

As our Data Engineer you will design, implement and maintain processes and algorithms for ingesting, serving large volumes of geolocation data and extracting business value from these data.

Hence, you (our ideal candidate) are an Engineer seeking new challenges: nowhere else in Italy will you be given the opportunity to solve data challenges on such a large scale! On top of this, you must be delivery-oriented and with a strong technical background.

Responsibilities:


Build and maintain pipelines and architectures for stream and batch processes;
Collaborate with data architects and data scientists to design and build analytic systems that are correct, scalable, reliable, and accurate;
Analyze large datasets to allow for data driven design;
Understand product and target use cases;


Required skills:


2+ years of experience developing products in the data/analytics/graphing space
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, distributed systems, machine learning, and statistical methods
Expert-level knowledge of Java and the JVM platform: we use Kotlin (further languages running on JVM are welcome)
Knowledge of the Hadoop ecosystem, we mainly use Spark
Experience with version control systems such as Git, SVN, Mercurial. We use Git.
At ease with industry standard software development tools (IDEs, etc.)


We're also looking for:


Experience with workflow orchestrators (e.g., Apache Airflow)
A hunger for coding
The ability to say no ‚Äî and to explain why
Excellent English (we work a lot with the New York office)
Experience working in a distributed organization (again, New York!)
Excellent people skills, with a positive and collaborative approach
Results driven mentality


The perks we offer:


Pre-Covid days we traveled a lot, enjoyed our amazing offices with ping pong table, fully stocked kitchen, games, lounge area. We had a learning time every Friday in the office just before the aperitivo!
Now, since we are all remote-working since the Covid outbreak, still enjoy Zoom aperitivo and having a laugh together
The future? For sure we'll continue to value most life-work balance as we always have. We will define perks and operating mode in the times to come


About Cuebiq:

Cuebiq is a leading location data and insights company, providing marketers and data professionals in a range of industries, a trusted, high quality, and transparent currency for offline mobility data to map and measure the consumer journey. Cuebiq has the largest database of anonymous, accurate, and privacy-enhanced location data in the United States, and is at the forefront of industry privacy standards, follows a privacy-compliant framework in its data collection, and is one of the very first location providers certified by leading privacy association, NAI.

Cuebiq's AI-driven platform offers analytics, audiences, and cross-channel attribution capabilities, which empower brands and marketers to make better, more-informed business decisions and marketing strategies. Our first-party data and flexible toolset can be leveraged to expedite the development of custom location data-based solutions in a privacy-focused way.

Prioritizing the use of data to make the world a better place, Cuebiq's Data for Good program empowers top universities and nonprofit organizations across the globe with Cuebiq's location insights to drive innovation in community causes such as epidemiology and COVID-19 response, disaster relief, and urban development.

title: Motor Pricing Expert
description:
About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.

At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 13,000 employees across the world.

We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?

About The Role

Technological developments like autonomous cars and telematics solutions are having a big impact on Motor insurance. To play a substantial role in this and other innovative areas, a Product and Technology Hub has been set up within Swiss Re, building telematics products and developing new technologies, to shape future frontiers of mobility.

Do you have a real passion for innovation and new products definitions? Do you want to help us set as leader in the telematics market?

We are looking for highly motivated people who will take on the role of Motor Pricing Expert, joining a rapidly growing team of scientists and insurance professionals, responsible for developing product concepts and scoring capability for telematics-based policies and the automotive sector. You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues from various countries, background and experience who join efforts to develop innovative telematics solutions, in tight collaboration with internal professionals and clients.

Are you ready to take the challenge?

You Will

Analyze market information and develop premium comparison framework among different sources (internal/external);
Data cleansing and relational DB creation and validation;
Perform advanced cluster analysis, parameter testing and selection, risk premium modeling (with/without the support of multi factorial math/actuarial software);
Full management of a rating structure finalization (marginal/multi-way analysis, proposal definition and expected impact assessment in what-if scenarios);
Contribute in gamification scoring development;
Support novel products coverage analysis and acceptance criteria definition

We are excited to get to know you if you:

Are focused on delivery time and quality
Are agile in adapting analysis techniques to manage different scenarios
Are keen on task prioritization and organization
Are able to work independently, under pressure and on multiple and conflicting priorities

About You

Master's in quantitative discipline, e.g. mathematics, actuarial science, physics, statistics, or computer science
5 or more years of relevant quantitative and qualitative analysis experience (Ph.D. assumed as acquired experience)
Working experience in primary motor insurance market
Advanced use of statistical software (e.g. Matlab / R / SAS) and programming skills (e.g. SQL / VBA / Python)
Strong skills in statistics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate modelling (e.g. GLM, GAM) with large and limited databases

Constitute a Plus

Knowledge in the fields of telematics and automotive
Proficiency in actuarial-statistical software (e.g. EMB, Pretium)
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and Could base computing (Hadoop / Spark)
High degree of flexibility and can-do working style
Practical and solution oriented approach
Great teammate with communication and interpersonal skills
Fluency in English is mandatory. Other languages are a plus (e.g. Italian, German)

Please send you application and the CV in English language.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team. You need to be able to read ‚Äúraw‚Äù data and you will be able to transform it into useful data. For example, you‚Äôll create algorithms and conduct statistical analysis.‚ÄØ

To succeed in this position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources.

Responsibilities

Maintain and further develop company data bases and data warehouse
Implement and maintain data pipelines from raw to structured data
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements
Interact with internal/external data providers, design and assess integration solutions
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, improving infrastructure for scalability and performance
Architect and implement high performance batch and streaming data pipelines using AWS Services
Support data governance by helping to catalogue and describe metadata
Monitor the quality of the incoming data
Work closely with data scientists on individual projects, in order to build, operationalize and maintain the data processing pipeline and generate features for Machine Learning models
Work closely with business intelligence to help build and deliver unique insights into our data
Manage data visualisation tools


Requirements

BSc or MSc in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent. PhD would be a plus.
At least 3 years of working experience in a related field
Experience of data pipelining , and is a plus would be having experience on AWS technologies (CloudFormation, Glue, Lambdas, S3, DMS, Athena)
Experience with unstructured data and/or graph databases (S3, Document, Graph, Search‚Ä¶)
Good understanding of data platform architecture
Confirmed experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python
Experience with Apache Spark and PySpark is a plus
Experience preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow
Experience with Agile work environment
Experience with visualization and exploratory solutions (Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks)
Knowledge of Unix/Linux and shell scripting
Experience with Git and CI/CD tools
AWS Certification (Solution Architect, Big Data) would be a plus


About Us

brumbrum is an Automotive B2C company that brings two value propositions to its clients: (i) used cars buying and (ii) carsubscription (Car as a Service). We aim to change completely the way in which people buy cars, destroying the offline barrier that exists in the dealership & physical visit through a fully-fledged platform to navigate and explore the used & car-subscription cars.

Our mission is simple: we want brumbrum to be the place where our customers can find, discover and get their next car. Online.

brumbrum is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

title: Back-End Engineer
description:
Direct message the job poster from Cloud Academy, Inc.

Valentina Zaccolo
HR&Talent Acquisition

PLEASE NOTE: This position is based in our Swiss HQ in Mendrisio, Switzerland, just 7km over the border from Como, Italy. Mendrisio is easily commutable from Milan, Como, Varese or Lugano and Cloud Academy provides the train ticket for you and we‚Äôre happy to facilitate your relocation to this area if needed!

¬†

Cloud Academy is the leading digital skills development platform that enables every enterprise to become a tech company through guided¬†Learning Paths,¬†Hands-on Labs, and¬†Skill Assessment. Cloud Academy delivers role-specific training on leading clouds (AWS,¬†Azure,¬†Google Cloud Platform), essential methodologies needed to operate on and between clouds (DevOps,¬†security,¬†containers), and capabilities that are unlocked by the cloud (big data,¬†machine learning).

Companies like Turner, Cognizant, SAS, and ThermoFisher¬†customize Cloud Academy¬†to contextualize learning and leverage the platform to¬†assign, manage, and measure¬†cloud enablement at scale.

¬†

Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide!

We‚Äôre looking for a¬†Back-End Developer¬†to help us take our product to the next level. We move seamlessly from full-stack web development, to mobile, to deployment/scaling. This position will take ownership of how features are implemented, from user experience to backend, involving our web app, mobile app, APIs and backend infrastructure.

You‚Äôll have an opportunity to make a large impact on the culture of our development team. Our ideal candidate is a humble leader, equally capable of teaching and learning.

¬†

Responsibilities:

Able to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation; unit tests for every feature, bug fixing and code reviews.
Communicate with the rest of the company (e.g. sales, marketing, UX, etc) to ensure the functionality you're implementing is what was intended.
Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including mobile developers, designers and product managers in order to quickly deliver new features.
Work closely with the Operations Team to ensure smooth deployments, ensuring that errors are logged with enough info to debug effectively.




Requirements:

Passion for coding, web technologies, and shipping features that drive users adoption.
Strong understanding of server-side technologies such as: Python, Django, Flask, Celery and both Relational and NoSQL databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis
Advanced knowledge and experience on modern web patterns: AJAX, RESTful APIs, SOA, WebSocket, client-side rendering, etc.
Understanding of client-side technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Web Components,
Experience with distributed version control systems: mostly Git (Github and/or Bitbucket).
Familiar with cloud-oriented technologies: AWS, Google Cloud, Heroku, Docker
Familiar with cloud architecture patterns and best practices for designing highly available, scalable and secure systems.
Good level of English proficiency, both spoken and written.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a sense of urgency and integrity.

¬†

Benefits

Competitive compensation with an annual bonus potential. The salary range is determined by the level of engineer a candidate is assessed at, and we have a range for each level of engineer at the company.¬†The salary for this position (Software Engineer II) is a minimum of 50,000 CHF, plus an annual bonus of up to a 10% of the base salary.
Train ticket paid for by the company
Budget for professional development
4 weeks paid vacation per year and 17 paid holidays per year
Great company culture and work environment!
Highly-skilled teammates and lots of opportunities for growth and development!¬†

title: Engineering Student and Graduate Program
description:
Bending Spoons is a leading mobile app developer that prioritizes innovation, education, and long-term thinking. Through our software engineering graduate program, you'll enjoy a captivating and impactful formative experience. As well as receiving regular coaching from our most experienced professionals, you‚Äôll rotate across key areas to gain a comprehensive grounding in the intricacies of each one.




For example, you may work in the following areas:




Mobile development
Machine learning
Backend development
Cybersecurity and Infrastructure engineering




We‚Äôll design your program in tandem with you, in a way that resonates with your interests and skills. This will be a truly personalized engineering education.




What We Offer

A comprehensive education in engineering.¬†Learn a range of state-of-the-art technologies under the precise tutelage of our domain experts.
Relentless innovation.¬†Global challenges demand an innovative approach. You'll harness the latest tools to target impact at massive scale.
Solve big problems.¬†From the word go, you'll work on significant projects that demand the utmost care and attention. No danger of thumb-twiddling here.
A WOW team.¬†A typical Spooner is young, motivated, and energizing to be around. Our average age is 28 and we hang out together a lot‚Äîyou're going to make a ton of new friends!
A tailor-made experience.¬†We're ready to welcome you whenever you're ready to join us, on a schedule that works for you.
Work in the most innovative of industries.¬†It's no secret tech is where the action is. Do your bit to shape the industry at the center of global challenges.
Continuous education. We pay for your Italian/English language lessons and offer an unlimited book budget, but that's not where it ends. If you make a good case for some extra learning, we're delighted to foot the tab.¬†
Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose (even no time at all, if you‚Äôd prefer). Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. Every day, you‚Äôve got the freedom to decide where today‚Äôs office is.¬†
Flexible schedule. Our regular hours are 9-6 GMT+1, but this isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúclock in, clock out‚Äù company. Morning person? Start work while the world‚Äôs still sleeping. Night owl? Ramp things up while others are winding down. You‚Äôre fully trusted to create the right conditions for your own personal peak productivity. We only ask that you‚Äôre available to your teammates a good chunk of the day. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs generally best to be based somewhere with a similar time zone‚Äîbetween GMT-2 and GMT+3.
Lots. Of. Fun. Our incredible People Operations team organize awesome events, such as team games, drinks, yoga classes, parties.
Top-notch HQ.¬†Natural light, silent rooms, state-of-the-art hardware, fun-filled common spaces... the list never ends! You‚Äôll certainly be in the right environment to do your best work. And, when it‚Äôs time to switch off, you can do that in style and comfort.
Relocation package.¬†To ease your move to Milan, the first three months of rent are on us. Visa support is provided for those who need it.




What We Look For

Excellent logical-analytical abilities.¬†You‚Äôre a quick learner who can investigate and effectively pick up new concepts on your own. You can solve unforeseen challenges with creativity and structure, and do so independently.
Drive.¬†You‚Äôre energetic, hard-working, and you persevere through adversity until the job is done‚Äîand done impeccably. You‚Äôre results-oriented and always aim for excellence in what you do.
Passion for engineering.¬†You‚Äôre simply in love with writing software.
Rationality and self-control. You make decisions based on facts‚Äîeven in moments of stress or heightened emotion.
Humility.¬†You‚Äôre down to earth, eager to listen to people‚Äôs constructive criticism, and ready to get your hands dirty with whatever the team needs to succeed.
Communication.¬†Your communication, both written and oral, is structured and crystal clear.
Proficiency in English.¬†You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




Commitment & Contract

You're up for working with us in Milan for 12 months, full- or part-time. We might extend you a returning offer at the end of the program.




Location

Milan, Italy or remote. We offer substantial support for relocation, including finding an apartment in Milan and paying the rent for 12 weeks. You‚Äôre also welcome to work remotely, or part on-site, part-remote.




The recruiting process

If you successfully pass through our screening process, we'll invite you to take on a few tests aimed at assessing how you think and solve (possibly unfamiliar) problems. These tests don't require any prior knowledge, and they should take you a few hours to complete. If you're successful there, we'll invite you to some interviews‚Äînormally two or three‚Äîto get to know each other and figure out if it‚Äôs a good fit for both parties. There, we'll ask you some behavioral and problem-solving questions. The interviews are held remotely. To limit arbitrariness and human bias, Bending Spoons' hiring decisions are made by a hiring committee.




COVID-19 disclaimer

The current situation hasn‚Äôt stopped our hiring and onboarding. Our vacancies are for in-house employment, and we can‚Äôt wait to meet the new Spooners in person but, until the Coronavirus is over, we‚Äôll rely on remote onboarding for all new roles. Similarly, all interviews and assessments will take place online.




IMPORTANT NOTICE¬†

Please notice that¬†only applications submitted through our website will be considered. Apply here: https://bit.ly/34O8L9j

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
Description

We are looking for talents to be included in the Analytics team with the role of Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) Engineer, who have the desire to contribute as protagonists to the growth of Prima, with a strong passion for the world of machine learning and its life cycle.

Chi cerchiamo

You are our ideal candidate if you meet the following requirements:

Technical excellence Your passion always leads you to search for new technologies to solve the problems that arise in front of you. At Prima you will be encouraged to pursue common goals in an original and innovative way, carrying out your ideas and generating value in a proactive way. You have already managed the life cycle of Machine Learning models, preferably for at least 3 years, and your main skills include: - Python - Jupyter (Notebook, Lab, Hub) and data analysis libraries (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy...) - Machine Learning Libraries (such as XGBoost, TensorFlow and PyTorch) - Design Patterns per ML - CD4ML (such as DVC, CML, Bento, SageMaker, MLFlow, Comet, DataRobot and KubeFlow)
Structured and meticulous approach You focus on the goal and are strongly result-oriented, taking care of every aspect of your work in detail. Are you able to deal analytically very complex problems by structuring your work and studying each case limit. You make sure that what you produce is error proof.
Courage You can take the right risks and take on great responsibilities. In Prima, progress and technological development pass above all through initiative and the continuous desire to experiment and get involved, opening up to comparison with others, sometimes failing, but always supporting one's ideas.

Sarebbe fantastico se

In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics:

You have a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or related faculty with honors
You are familiar with: - Git - Agile Development - Cloud platforms, preferably Amazon Web Services - Containerization (such as Docker) - CI (such as Drone and Jenkins) - Relational databases (RedShift, MySql and PostgreSQL) - ELK Stack - OOP and FP programming paradigms - Software Architecture, Standard Design Patterns and Microservices - Other programming languages (such as Elixir, Go, Scala and Bash)

Come puoi aiutarci

The speed and dynamism of our sector requires to make continuous decisions in real time, such as defining the price of a specific insurance coverage or the need for anti-fraud control for a reported claim. Almost all these decisions are made automatically by dynamic systems and artificial intelligence engines that estimate the probability of future events and define the best possible action for Prima and its customers.

Within the Analytics team, you will collaborate with the Quant Analyst, specialized in data analysis, and the Python Dev, a software development and architecture professional. Your task will be to guide the team in its growth path in the Machine Learning field, personally addressing all the CD4ML (Continuous Delivery for Machine Learning) problems that are revolutionizing this field.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Define model development methodologies and best practices, following their entire life cycle and playing a central role in deciding the technologies used
Support the production and evolution of Oracles, entities that, through machine learning, control the behavior of the microservices used in Prima
Develop the tools (packages, microservices, pipelines...) that you consider essential for your work and that of the team
Grow, learn and experiment to keep up with emerging technologies and choose the "right tool for the job"

Tipologia contrattuale

Meal vouchers, training, team building events, latest generation hardware and devices: in Prima you will find everything you need to do your job at your best. Salary and contract type will be evaluated during the interview, in order to offer an adequate pay to the real expertise and competence of every candidate.

The employment is full-time. Our office is in Milan, in via Santa Maria Segreta 2-10 (near Piazza Cordusio).

Prima is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The company prohibits discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, sex, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by national laws.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Our Partner is committed to provide to the manufacturing market a highly innovative product, which supports humans in factories thanks to AI, Vision and Robotics.¬†

The product he has developed and commercialized is a 3D vision system that recognizes human manual actions and body occupancy, supports him to follow the correct operations, and controls a robot to support human operator.

¬†For our Partner, We are looking for a brilliant¬†Junior Software Engineer¬†who wants to join an innovative and dynamic environment, and will improve and implement vision and robotics algorithms.




Software Engineer

As Software Engineer you will be part of our software engineering team and you will actively participate to the design, development and deployment of advanced software products and platforms. The technologies you will use and apply will be machine vision, using different kinds of vision sensors, machine learning tools, and algorithms for robotic control.

Your work will be a mixed balance between design and development activities, working side by side with enthusiast people and in strict contact with a multidisciplinary team. We look for passionate and focused people with the desire to learn by doing, to build and deploy innovative products and solutions.




Activities:

Develop, test and release software features according with the project schedule, requirements and release processes
Interact with the clients and the project managers in the post-release change management and bug fixing processes
Support the maintenance of development, release and testing tools forming the software factory
Perform technology scouting activities to identify and characterize software ad ICT solutions to be used in the projects




Required background and technical skills:

Software engineer or Computer Science Master‚Äôs Degree
Practical experience in the development of software projects or products (pre-graduation or PhD experiences also count)
Experience in machine vision algorithms
Interest and/or experience in machine learning and robotics
Practical knowledge of the main concepts of software engineering and of at least two of the most widespread programming languages (C++, C, Java, Python, ‚Ä¶) and basic understanding of the others




Other skills and required characteristics:

Analytics capabilities and attitude to problem solving
Team working attitude and communicational skills
Flexibility, enthusiasm and positive attitude
Availability to travel in Italy and worldwide depending on business need
Fluency in Italian and English




We offer:

An exciting environment where you will work along 150+ engineer, designers and business developers.
Full time contract
Compensation in line with organizational role and individual competences and experience
Company canteen
Fast and meritocratic professional growing

title: Actuarial Analyst
description:
The role holder is accountable for

Supporting the Underwriting community of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial via development of tools and techniques to optimize the technical profitability of the GC&C portfolio, in full alignment and coordination with guidelines and insurance & technical standards put in place by the Generali Group. This includes Actuarial Pricing, Profitability assessment and Portfolio Management to support profitable growth of GC&C book of business.

Main Missions

Actuarial Pricing

Development, implementation and maintenance of GC&C pricing tools both in setting up the parameters and supporting the deployment among users.
Support the Underwriting in the pricing process, incl. case pricing as agreed with CUO.
Monitoring technical pricing strength as well as the usage of the pricing tools, addressing issues with the responsible UW units, if applicable.
Regular pricing tool trainings among underwriting community.


Technical Performance Evaluation

Assess the profitability of the GC&C business units by evaluating the normalized loss ratios (NLR) separately for each business unit and underwriting/accident year.
Assist in estimating ultimate loss amounts for specific catastrophic events or significant large losses / market events.
Regularly provide management information on the performance of the business units, including, but not limited to the historic business units performance, observed trends, range of uncertainty, forward looking profitability.


Innovation

Collaborate on the development of a new breeds of actuarial tools that also leverage Machine Learning algorithms.
Contribute to the definition of business requirements for continuous improvement of TechEx technology stack in collaboration with Operations.
Provide training on the TechEx tool suite to GC&C underwriting community.



Requirements

Preferably Degree in quantitative discipline such as Actuarial/statistics/Mathematics/Engineering
Insurance business knowledge, preferably in Non-Life (Property & Casualty)
Quantitative and analytical approach and knowledge
Must be fluent in English, additional languages are an advantage (Italian, French, Spanish)
Ability in communication and presentation
Ability to build relationships at central team and local level
Coding and scripting experience (e.g. Python, R, SQL) and knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Understanding of data structures and data modeling and software architecture

title: Senior Specialist, Operations Research
description:
CVs must be submitted in English to be considered for this role

What Makes Us a Great Place To Work

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor‚Äôs Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

Who You‚Äôll Work With

Bain‚Äôs Advanced Analytics Group is a team of high-impact quantitative technology specialists who solve statistical, machine learning, and data engineering challenges that we encounter in our client engagements. AAG team members hold advanced degrees in subjects ranging across statistics, mathematics, computer sciences and other quantitative disciplines, and have backgrounds in a variety of fields including data science, marketing analytics and academia.

The role will involve advising on the application of forecasting, planning, simulation, and optimization to solve clients‚Äô challenges; leading the implementation of Management Science / Operations Research techniques within the Advanced Analytics Group; and coaching client-facing consultants on implementation, interpretation, and communication of solutions.

Applications will be broad and global including supply chain and logistics, inventory and resource planning, manufacturing and retail, network and service operations, and marketing and sales.

What You‚Äôll Do

Apply best practice statistical, simulation, optimization, and prescriptive analytics to management and operations problems
Work with Bain consultants and Advanced Analytics experts to clarify and define business objectives and identify practical value-added analytics solutions
Translate business problems into practical solutions for statistical analysis, simulation and optimization. Develop data requirements and analytics plan to fit time, tool and budget considerations
Formulate statistical, mathematical and/or simulation models including: establish the appropriate framework, set constants and variables, evaluate and set assumptions, define stochastic processes, determine alternatives and decision factors, define objectives and constraints.
Implement, evaluate and validate algorithms, statistical processes, and optimization and simulation models
Identify and communicate insights; model processes and functions; limitations and risks. Assist client-facing consultants in developing recommendations
Advise or build visualization and decision support tools to facilitate use of algorithms by clients in day to day and strategic decisions after Bain projects end
Train and coach consultants on basic statistical, optimization, and simulation procedures. Assist in knowledge transfer and deployment with end-clients
Train and coach other AAG colleagues on skills, processes and tools required so support OR, Optimization, Simulation, and Forecasting related work
Stay abreast of developments in the field and continue to advance Bain capabilities to serve clients. Identify trends in Data Science and Digital that will impact Bain and AAG work and help bring those perspectives to the AAG team and Practice leaders
Communicate with and educate both senior and junior colleagues to further embed management science and operations analytics across the firm

a Bout You

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Fluent in English. Other European languages are a plus
Strong skills in scoping, problem definition and problem solving under time constraints
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a related discipline such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, quantitative Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
Familiarity with a variety of operations analytics applications including supply chain and logistics, inventory and resource planning, manufacturing and retail, network and service operations, and marketing and sales
Expertise in Optimization techniques, languages, and experience in formulating and implementing optimization solvers, linear, integer, non-linear. Able to reformulate complex problems into more tractable solutions, including use of heuristic algorithms. Familiar with advanced optimization modelling languages, e.g. Gurobi, CPLEX
Strong skills in data engineering (e.g. SQL, R, Python)
Familiarity with dynamic, discrete event, and stochastic simulation methods and languages
Must thrive in a fast paced environment and be able to work independently
Up to 50% travel required post-pandemic

Ideal Candidates Will Also Have Experience In

Expertise in statistical modelling, data science and machine learning applications.
Experience in risk modelling and building decision support tools
Strong skills in multi-dimensional modelling and enterprise, ERP/MRP databases, e.g. Hyperion, Oracle, SAP, EPC, etc.
Experience with advanced simulation modelling and tools. May include Excel-based modelling applications and simulation/solver add-in solutions, e.g. Oracle Crystal Ball and Optquest, Lindo What‚Äôs Best, or Frontline Solvers (optional). May include simulation tools and languages eg. SAS/OR, Lindo, AIMMS, AnyLogic. Optional experience with application specific software e.g. Llamasoft (supply chain) or Terralign (Sales Territory)

About Us

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world‚Äôs most ambitious change makers define the future. Across 59 offices in 37 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition and redefine industries. We complement our tailored, integrated expertise with a vibrant ecosystem of digital innovators to deliver better, faster and more enduring outcomes. Our 10-year commitment to invest more than $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise and insight to organizations tackling today‚Äôs urgent challenges in education, racial equity, social justice, economic development and the environment. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

title: Manager ‚ÄúBusiness Automation‚Äù
description:
All‚Äôinterno del Consulting, la persona ha l‚Äôobiettivo di contribuire allo sviluppo del Centro di Competenza ‚ÄúAutomation‚Äù con particolare focus sulla parte funzionale e business dell‚Äôautomazione.

La persona ha un'ottima esperienza maturata in progetti di automazione, siano essi RPA, Machine Learning o simili. Inoltre ha buona esperienza nella digitalizzazione dei processi e nell‚Äôidentificazione dell‚Äôimpatto economico, tecnologico ed organizzativo.




Ruolo e Responsabilit√†/attivit√†:




Contribuire allo sviluppo del Centro di Competenza ‚ÄúAutomation‚Äù su tutti i settori
Sviluppare e migliorare l‚Äôoffering di Automation (RPA, machine learning,..) con focus su temi ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù
Integrare le offering di automation (RPA, machine learning,..) della parte funzionale e business con l‚Äôoffering ‚Äútecnica‚Äù di sviluppo e di BPM attraverso la collaborazione con la business unit di riferimento
Animare e gestire la community di ‚ÄúAutomation‚Äù consulting italiana

title: Accelerator Program Manager
description:
GELLIFY¬†is the¬†first innovation platform¬†focused on B2B software to help startups and corporates grow:

¬†

We invest in¬†B2B digital software startups and connect them to traditional¬†¬†companies¬†with the purpose of innovating their processes, products and business models, through Open Innovation. We support startups during their growth path, reducing risks and minimizing the need of capital.
We¬†support corporates through innovation programmes¬†and projects by leveraging¬†¬†our ecosystem of partners and advanced technological capabilities

¬†

At GELLIFY we are¬†changing the rules of the game in the innovation market¬†by enabling a¬†new generation of entrepreneurs, helping companies that are already on the market to re-invest

their wealth and leverage technology to create sustainable value and generate new job¬†opportunities, locally and around the world. We cannot wait for these entrepreneurs to magically

appear: they are already around us but they need to join forces and collaborate.

¬†

Below¬†some of our results we have achieved¬†since we started:

¬†

33 investments in startups
3 exits
6 global SW products¬†supported by GELLIFY Digital Factory and¬†validated by Gartner¬†in¬†reports and Magic Quadrants
80M ‚Ç¨ to be invested through Azimut Digitech Fund¬†in co-investment with GELLIFY¬†Digital investment in B2B SaaS startups
75M ‚Ç¨ total revenue¬†from GELLIFY ecosystem (+50% CAGR)
10M ‚Ç¨ total revenue from Innovation advisory¬†and digital transformation services
100+ employees¬†in 3 geografical areas (Italy, Middle East and Spain)
500+ employees¬†in our¬†portfolio startups
35‚Å∞ in the top 1000 Financial Times ranking¬†among companies who have grown the¬†most in the last year in Europe (2‚Å∞ among Italian companies)




THE ROLE




We are building an accelerator in Industry 4.0 and Digital Manufacturing¬†that will aim to¬†support¬†the growth of early stage startups through investments, services and co-innovation activities with large companies and SMEs in the manufacturing field and we are looking for an¬†Accelerator Program Manager¬†joining the team.

¬†

The Accelerator Program Manager will be able to:

¬†

Contribute to the¬†dealflow process¬†of the startups that will be selected to join the program every year by interacting with partner companies and investors;
Develop the¬†content and mentorship¬†program for the selected startups by involving the network of partners and the innovation ecosystem around GELLIFY (eg. internal team members, corporates, investors, startups);
Support startups and manufacturing partner companies in the¬†development of a coinnovation project¬†in the form of a POC (proof-of-concept);
Support startups in the¬†search for potential customers and investors¬†by leveraging the ecosystem and the business community of GELLIFY;
Manage the¬†day-to-day tasks¬†in terms of scheduling deal flows between corporations and startups, planning events for networking, coordinating the executing of the communication and marketing activities, and other essential duties as needed.




Professional experience and required skills:




+3 years of professional experience at accelerators / incubators and / or as a consultant in the context of open innovation and digital manufacturing,¬†managing projects with startups and corporates related to technological clusters such as, for example, industrial IoT, advanced robotics, virtual and augmented reality, modelling and simulation, cybersecurity, AI and machine learning, blockchain.
Knowledge of the innovation and entrepreneurial ecosystem¬†both for the corporates and startups sectors, with its main international players and operating mechanisms.
Advanced knowledge of the¬†operating mechanisms relating to the main digital media¬†(primarily Linkedin and Youtube).
Italian mother tongue,¬†English C1




¬†

How to apply

¬†

Do some research on GELLIFY and our initiatives with startups and corporates
Keep it short and get across what matters to you. There is no benefit to applying early¬†writing a novel.




We look forward to hearing from you!

title: AI Developer | Artificial Intelligence, Chatbot, MS Bot Framework
description:
Job Description

In Avanade lavoriamo per fornire ai nostri partner le migliori soluzioni possibili, sfruttando al meglio le tecnologie pi√π all'avanguardia. In questa ottica, facciamo ampio uso di soluzioni AI ove queste diano un valore aggiunto per i nostri clienti, nell'automazione di processi che potrebbero altrimenti essere onerosi. Abbiamo un team specializzato in soluzioni di Artificial Intelligence e siamo alla ricerca di profili di livello che vadano ad arricchire il nostro set di competenze. Stiamo cercando degli/delle AI Developer che si occupino di sviluppo, testing e implementazione di progetti di Artificial Intelligence, con un particolare focus su chatbot e cognitive services.

Lavorerai in un team coeso, inserito in una realt√† multinazionale e multiculturale, con possibilit√† di crescita considerevoli e opportunit√† di apprendimento continue. Potrai confrontarti sia con i colleghi del team che con le diverse worldwide communities, accrescendo sia le tue competenze specifiche che le tue soft skills.

Se vuoi metterti alla prova con progetti ad alto valore tecnologico, sfidanti e variegati, allora sei la persona che fa per noi.

Cosa Cerchiamo In Te

consolidata esperienza in linguaggio C # e .NET Core;
esperienza di sviluppo di web API in contesto Microsoft, preferibilmente con l'uso di framework asp.Net MVC e su database relazionali, preferenziale MS SQL Server;
esperienza di sviluppo di applicazioni web su Cloud Azure; Azure Web App / Bot Services, Azure Storage


Rappresentano, inoltre, un requisito preferenziale

conoscenza di sviluppo FE con Javascript (Typescript) e almeno uno dei relativi framework (React, Angular 2+, Vue.JS);
conoscenza dei Microsoft Cognitive Services o del Bot Framework su soluzioni Chatbot o sistemi cognitivi;
conoscenza di uno o pi√π database NoSQL (Mongo, Dymano, Cassandra, ....)
interesse nell'ambito Intelligence Automation e conoscenza di base del Machine Learning;
predisposizione all'apprendimento e alla sperimentazione di nuove tecnologie (specialmente in ambito Microsoft)


In Avanade troverai un'azienda che investe sulla formazione. Per questo, oltre ad un programma completo di certificazioni Microsoft, offriamo un ampio pacchetto di benefit e un insieme di iniziative e servizi per rispondere alle esigenze professionali ed individuali di ciascuno. Farai parte di una community inclusiva e aperta, attiva in 20 paesi, e potrai confrontarti con professionisti provenienti da tutto il mondo. Avanade √® una Community Internazionale: la conoscenza dell'inglese, sia scritto che orale, √® un must.

Curiamo molto la crescita individuale delle nostre persone, per questo offriamo percorsi specifici, definiti col supporto di Career Advisor e supportati da una continua formazione, anche grazie alle partnership privilegiate con Microsoft.

Se pensi che questa possa essere l'opportunit√† giusta per te, come and join us! #weareAvanade #AvanadeProud #Avanadefamily #orangefamily

About Avanade

Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 29,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. We welcome all, and seek talented individuals who can bring their whole self to work, build inclusive teams and encourage diversity inside and outside the organization. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

description:
Direct message the job poster from AGS S.p.A - Advanced Global Solution

Bianca Danci
Human Resources | IT Recruiter presso AGS S.p.A - Advanced Global Solution

AGS S.p.A. √® una societ√† leader nel settore della tecnologia in Italia da pi√π di 20 anni.

Ogni giorno in AGS Spa raccogliamo le sfide delle Digital Transformation. Guidiamo il cambiamento progettando soluzioni innovative ed erogando servizi tailor-made ad alto valore aggiunto. Formazione e ricerca sono i pillar del nostro approccio al lavoro.

Opportunit√†

I corsi di AGS Academy vengono tenuti in due modalit√†: ‚Äúin aula‚Äù presso le nostre Sedi e ‚ÄúCorsi Smart‚Äù, che possono essere fruiti dove e quando si preferisce, in completa autonomia anche da Smartphone o Tablet.




ABOUT AGS

AGS S.p.A. oggi √® composta da Business Unit che lavorano in sinergia per offrire soluzioni all‚Äôavanguardia su varie aree di competenza:

- Consulting: da anni collaboriamo con i Big Player del mercato di varie industry (Banking, Telco, IT, Automotive, Pharmaceutics ), confermando e rinnovando la nostra partnership ormai pluriennale.

- Software Factory: all‚Äôinterno del nostro HQ realizziamo prodotti, soluzioni e servizi per grandi clienti. La nostra Factory √® composta da vari professionisti nel mondo dello sviluppo divisi per competenze verticali. Sempre all‚Äôavanguardia in ambito tecnologico, abbiamo integrato le aree di: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence e CP7.

- Produzione: dopo anni di Ricerca e Sviluppo, abbiamo creato nuovi materiali (Polimetilmetacrilato, Acrilico, Azanite) ottenuti attraverso cicli produttivi ad energia pulita, innovativi ed ecofriendly, adoperati nella riqualificazione energetica e nella realizzazione delle facciate termoventilate.




- Real Estate e Facility Management: nel 2020 abbiamo creato la divisione AGS Real Estate per andare incontro all‚Äôesigenze del mercato. Formata da pi√π di 50 architetti e ingegneri, uniamo le nostre varie anime per sviluppare soluzioni di efficientamento e riqualificazione di immobili.

- Robotics & Automation: l‚Äôesperienza consolidata da AGS in oltre 20 anni ci ha portato a creare macchine all‚Äôavanguardia diverse dalle altre presenti sul mercato. L‚Äôutilizzo di materiali innovativi e le migliori competenze IT, ci hanno permesso di affermarci in contesti Business e Medicali grazie alla realizzazione di IdeaHub e UVC-O3 Sterilizer.

La nostra Vision




Aumentare la leadership tecnologica, investendo nelle competenze nei settori pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia dell‚ÄôIT, anticipando l‚Äôevoluzione dei mercati e rispondendo alle richieste dei clienti.

La voglia di osare e l‚Äôabilit√† di plasmarsi a un mercato in continua evoluzione hanno portato AGS ad effettuare continui e importanti investimenti in Ricerca & Sviluppo in nuove aree, fra cui Artificial Intelligence, Machine e Deep Learning, IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things), Monomer & Polymer Synthetic Surfaces e Building & Lighting Automation.

I nostri Valori




Progettiamo innovazione. Creiamo prodotti originali, nati dalla ricerca e dalle tecnologie di ultima generazione, che si distinguono per funzionalit√†, usabilit√† e innovazione.

Soluzioni IT sempre un passo avanti. Offriamo Consulenza, Progetti, Servizi e Soluzioni IT mirati alla creazione di valore nei processi delle aziende.

Innovazione, Tecnologia, Ricerca & Sviluppo sono i nostri valori distintivi. Con spirito innovatore abbiamo diversificato le attivit√† aziendali, raggiungendo livelli di eccellenza nei settori dove operiamo.

Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Sviluppa il tuo percorso professionale nel nostro team Data&Analytics all‚Äôinterno del gruppo Deals di PwC.

Il team Deals - Data & Analytics aiuta i clienti a risolvere e affrontare le tematiche e problematiche che sorgono in vari aspetti nel contesto delle fusioni e acquisizioni aziendali facendo leva su avanzate tecniche di Analytics, tecnologie innovative e Big Data.¬†




Your Perspectives

Your unique strengths¬†

SELEZIONIAMO PER AZIENDA CLIENTE

PHD, DOTTORANDI, RICERCATORI

Come per ogni figura inserita, l‚Äôazienda offrir√† formazione costante su strumenti, tecnologie, concetti e ambito in cui opera.




Mansioni

Inserita all'interno del team di Software Developer che ha in carico lo sviluppo della piattaforma AI proprietaria su ambiti quali Machine Learning, Internet delle Cose, efficienza energetica e affidabilit√†, la figura si occuper√† dello sviluppo e del deploy delle funzionalit√† della piattaforma.

In particolare, per ogni nuova funzionalit√†, la persona sar√† coinvolta nelle seguenti attivit√†:

analisi dei requisiti;

Competenze richieste

IMPORTANTI¬†| 1-2 anni di esperienza sui temi di interesse; conoscenza di Python; conoscenza del web framework Django; conoscenza del framework Angular per lo sviluppo front-end; conoscenza di architetture cloud e tecnologia dei container; conoscenza metodologie Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment.

GRADITE¬†| Esperienza come post-doc, PhD, ricercatori, tirocinanti, nel settore di interesse.

description:

title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
We are looking for a Solutions Architect based in Northern Italy to work directly with supercomputing installations and end-users. Your playgrounds will be the world‚Äôs fastest AI supercomputers. Solutions Architects are the primary technical contacts for our customers and engage deeply with scientific researchers and application developers to drive the adoption of NVIDIA technology. We seek individuals who can develop positive relationships with customers, understand their requirements and work to bring solutions that enable their success.
What You Will Be Doing

Interact with end-users in academia and industry, develop a keen understanding of their goals and needs, define and deliver high-value solutions that meet these needs.
Architect and advise customers on HPC deployments to include computing, networking and storage, with particular emphasis on maximizing GPU resource utilization at scale.
Support developers and scientists on GPU-accelerated computing, develop efficient and scalable implementations, assist with the application of modern AI techniques.
Evangelize GPU-accelerated computing and Deep Learning, deliver trainings using NVIDIA GPUs and software for HPC and AI, g room power users to be NVIDIA champions.
Be an inspiring leader on integrating NVIDIA technology into IT architectures to support scientific and engineering applications.
Identify gaps and propose/develop prototypical solutions.
Communicate customer requirements to NVIDIA Engineering to foster product improvements.

What We Need To See

Passion for accelerated computing.
A graduate degree from a leading university in a STEM related discipline.
8+ years work experience in software development, Machine Learning or HPC.
Fluent in English both oral and written.
Action oriented with strong analytical skills.
Good organization skills to work in a heavily multi-tasked environment.
Self-motivated, independent, ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day direction.
Significant experience in High-Performance Computing or Deep Learning.
Strong collaboration and social skills, ability to communicate effectively with customers.
Experience with parallel programming, CUDA development, DL frameworks.
Experience crafting and deploying large scale HPC and enterprise computing systems.

Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd

Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, and an enthusiastic presentation style.
Skilled at profiling, analyzing and optimizing CUDA code.
Fortran and/or C++ scientific programming fluency, with s trong mathematical fundamentals.
Hands-on experience with the administration of HPC fabrics, storage solutions and file systems.
Parallel programming experience with OpenACC, OpenMP, MPI.
Experience using and managing large-scale computing resources, eg Slurm, Docker, Kubernetes.
Industry knowledge of the energy sector and oil-n-gas applications.
Published record of thought leadership in a technical area or industry segment.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world‚Äôs most desirable employers! We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

title: Back-End Developer to a start-up company. Fully remote!
description:
Our client is looking for Junior and Senior Back-End Developers to work fully remote!

About Our Client

They are a start-up company, founded in 2020. Their mission is to help sports fans get more out of what they love. Using real-life player data, they create new, fantasy sports experiences tapping into the endless curiosity, imagination, and passion of fans. Every experience is built to be social and shareable creating a destination for fans to go before, during, and after the games. They are looking for experienced, committed people to join their team.

The role

As a Back-End Developer you are responsible for building and maintaining their core business layer and microservice APIs, providing high-performing solutions that are highly scalable.

Experience

For the Senior role they are looking for someone who has practical experience of at least 3 years with:

Node.js development.
GraphQL-based APIs.
Data access/API integration.
Test-driven development.
Extensive unit and integration testing.
NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis).
AWS/Google Cloud solutions.
Performance monitoring and scalable architectures.

Solid Understanding Of

Architectural patterns relating to code reusability, maintainability and extensibility.
Core software engineering patterns and approaches.
Scaleable, resilient microservices architecture.
Analytics and performance monitoring practices.

Willingness To

Self-manage workload, progress reports, documentation and other important day-to-day activities.
Work in a decentralized team where trust and transparency are core practices, not values.
Work in an Agile environment, implementing and enforcing proper CI, feature branching and other best practices.

Bonus points

Extra Points For Experience With

FaunaDB (or other cloud-based database).
Google Cloud Services (Functions, Storage, Firebase).
Machine Learning.
Google Analytics 360 / Amplitude / AppsFlyer.
Real-time communications architecture

For Junior position they are looking for someone who has experience 1 year either with:

PHP
Python
Interest in Node.js

Do you see yourself working in a start-up company where you play important role for building up the core team and all that fully remote? If yes, then Apply now or send your CV directly to click apply
