title: Cloud Data Platform Solution Architect
description:
Role Purpose

The Vodafone Italy Business Intelligence and Big Data team is the owner of the Vodafone Italy data stack which includes Business Intelligence and Big Data system. It provides data and services to different stakeholders from predefined reports for business users, to self-service reporting for advanced BI users and analytics platform for data scientists. The platform we manage answers to multiple business needs leveraging on standard BI and ETL tools as well as on modern real time data streaming tools.

As an IT Business Intelligence Data Architect, you will be responsible in the definition and implementation of how data gets stored, consumed and managed by different entities in the company. You will understand the business requirement and enhance the systems to provide the necessary data in the best way according to the IT strategy and the business needs. Together with the team you will work on the enhancement the data model, create new analysis area and integrate them in the semantic layer.

You will provide value to the business improving the value of the data, the accessibility and the democratization on an enterprise grade BI that handles terabytes of data every day.

You will excel in this role if you have a broad knowledge of ETL, reporting systems, Big Data Platforms, Cloud Services, a passion for data and you will leverage them to design and adapt the existing tools and processes.

Main activities and responsibilities

Understand the data and transform them inside a multi speed environment
Analyze requirements and come up with technical solution to bring them to life
Design and develop extensions to the data platform working on the E2E data pipeline
Make data easily accessible to business users in Self-BI environment, define Machine Learning Pipelines and CI/CD pipelines
Manage the projects within team to achieve the business requirements within the agreed timelines and high quality
Be part of data governance team to build the new models that serves the business requests
Be compliant with company data governance, data standards and software development methodology in the delivery
Provide guidance to comply with mid-long term plans for Vodafone Data Architecture
Recommend approaches, lead design and create solid technical solutions for complex business scenarios
Drive PoCs, Software Selection and Solution Design for Batch and Real Time use cases

Core competencies, knowledge and experience

Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, engineering and/or other STEM degrees
Working experience in similar roles
Knowledge of SQL, NOSQL, Hadoop/Big Data and data modelling concepts
Knowledge of ETL/ELT tools and patterns.
Understanding of Ci/CD frameworks leveraging on tools as Jenkins + GitHub
Understanding of distributed compute frameworks such as spark.
Knowledge of data preparation and reporting tools
Attitude to plan and organize work to deliver project as agreed
Great communication skills and stakeholder management
Fluent English speaking and writing
(Preferred) Knowledge of Cloud Data Architecture on GCP or other Cloud Providers for storage, compute (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)
Great will to work and to learn new skills

description:
Why Accenture? To discover the energy and commitment we devote to our customers by transforming their working method with the most advanced technologies. At Accenture, you'll grow as a member of an international network. Each day, you‚Äôll make a difference using whatever makes you unique.

Financial Crime Professionals

Milan

Your challenges

You will help define project strategy and planning, work with experienced colleagues, to ensure that deadlines and budget are met


You will develop new data driven methodologies using Accenture‚Äôs technological expertise in risk management and prevention (Crypto-currency, international money laundering schemes, and terrorism financing)


You will cooperate in the creation of a detailed and complete report starting from the sector and new trends analysis, work progress up to the final result



Innovation starts with the foundations of systems. At Accenture you will be the one to redesign them. You'll transform the infrastructure and processes to drive big companies into the future. Express your value by focusing on our customer‚Äôs complex architectures as our consultants did for OnePayroll. https://www.accenture.com/us-en/success-onepayroll-microsoft-accenture

title: Android Software Engineer - Remote
description:
Direct message the job poster from Scandit

Jamie Harding
Talent Acquisition Manager - Product & Tech at Scandit

*Please note that we are required to add a location to job ads but this role can be based remotely in the European region.*




At Scandit, we develop real-time computer vision solutions for smartphones, wearables, and robots that combine modern machine learning approaches with computer vision. To expand our engineering team, we are looking for an Android Software Engineer.




What You Will Do

You will be in charge of our Play Store apps as well as our SDK which are both written in Kotlin. Our SDK helps other Android developers create engaging user experiences around barcode scanning and AR and is currently in use on more than 75 million mobile phones worldwide.

In the apps, you will help bring out the best of the SDK by implementing an engaging user experience, a beautiful UI, and flexible remote customization. In the SDK you will help increase our global developer community by exposing new data capture features as well as continually improving the developer experience.




You will be responsible for writing well-architected and performant Android code to provide the best possible user experience to our current and potential customers. In all this, you will work closely with the other mobile teams as well as our UX designers.




Who You Are

You know your way around Kotlin, Java and the Android universe
You love to collaborate in a small team and quickly iterate on feedback
You appreciate good software architecture and love to apply it to your code
You have a history of creating beautiful, engaging user experiences on Android
You have a good understanding of UI architectural patterns such as MVP and MVVM
You enjoy working in an international team and dream big
You are thorough and pay attention to detail
You are passionate about the latest technologies and learning them




What We Offer

Flexible working hours and a fun environment as part of our growing team
Opportunity to take ownership and collaborate in an English-speaking, international, and diverse team, where your passion for working with cutting-edge technologies and highly-skilled people will flourish
The opportunity to travel to Zurich HQ for hackathons, Christmas parties, company outings, and other regular events




Who We Are

Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.




Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.




Many of the world‚Äôs most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit‚Äôs enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.




Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in San Francisco, Boston, London, Warsaw and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, cloud computing and ‚ÄúInternet of Things‚Äù experts from around the globe.

title: NVMQRA Test Engineering Lead
description:
Direct message the job poster from Micron Technology

Kevin Daniel
Talent Acquisition Innovation Manager at Micron Technology


Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

The Non-Volatile Memory Quality and Reliability Assurance (NVMQRA) team under Global Quality organization is responsible to ensure quality and reliability targets of mNAND products are met. NVMQRA develops and implements robust qualification process flow and methodologies, aligning to recognized industrial standards as well as fostering zero-defect approach. In this multinational organization, NVMQRA collaborates regularly with various teams globally throughout the value chain to attain best-in-class quality.

The NVMQRA group works very closely with Development teams during the various facets of the qualification processes of mNAND systems (NAND storage products with Managed NAND technology). In particular, the NVMQRA Test Engineering team develops, applies and maintains test programs used during the product/system qualification. The team is responsible to analyze failures generated by these programs, and work with various engineering groups to evaluate and implement corrective actions to problem resolution. The team also participate in the design and qualification of the engineering tool interfacing the tester and the DUT.

We strive for a highly productive and enjoyable working environment! It is a priority for us to provide a rich and nurturing environment where everybody in the team can contribute and grow their skills and knowledge.

Key Responsibilities And Tasks

Lead and drive accountability of an engineering team
Manage staff, coordinate Q&R workflows and assign priorities
Develop, apply and support Quality & Reliability Test Solutions (software and hardware)
Perform empirical data collection, statistical analysis, as well as designing experiments
Coordinate with stakeholders to enable new techniques/tools

Key Requirements

Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer / Electronic Engineering, Physics or equivalent field
Minimum 3-5 years‚Äô experience in semiconductor related engineering field; managerial and mentorship experience is a plus
High competent in Programming and Scripting eg. C, C++, PERL and PYTHON
Advanced hands-on with lab/debugging tools: Logic Analyzers, oscilloscopes and protocol analyzers
Proactive in problem solving with customer focused mindset
A good team player to work in cross-cultural global team environment
Ability to respond to constantly changing needs and urgent requests
High proficiency in English, both written and spoken

Before uploading your CV to apply for this position, please review our Employment Privacy Notice. Micron recruiters use review tools to identify your unique skill set based on the information in your CV, to inform the recruiter of skills you may have that are not listed on your CV (based on your career history and work experience), to supplement the information provided in your CV with information obtained from publicly accessible professional-oriented sources (such as your publicly available LinkedIn profile) and to assess how closely your skill set matches the defined skill set for this position. While submitting your CV through this platform is not obligatory, we encourage you to do so.

If you do not want to benefit from the skill and qualification matching features, then you should not upload your CV through this platform. Instead, email your CV to EMEA_HR_TEAM@micron.com along with the Req Id number listed in the job description. Your CV will be forwarded to the appropriate recruiter for review.

About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands ‚Äì Micron¬Æ and Crucial¬Æ ‚Äì our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint‚Ñ¢ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron‚Äôs Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact Form

Develops, evaluates, revises, and applies technical quality assurance protocols/methods to inspect and test in-process raw materials, production equipment, and finished products. Ensures activities and items are in compliance with both company quality assurance standards and applicable government regulations. Performs analysis and identifies trends in the inspection of finished products, in-process materials and bulk raw materials, and recommends corrective actions when necessary. Ensures that established manufacturing inspection, sampling and statistical process control procedures are followed. May assure compliance to in-house and/or external specifications and standards, such as GMPs and ISO regulations. Evaluates and analyzes the efforts in organizing, documenting, and interpreting inspection support documents and records.

title: Sr Back-End Engineer
description:
Direct message the job poster from Cloud Academy, Inc.

Valentina Zaccolo
HR&Talent Acquisition

PLEASE NOTE: This position is based in our Swiss HQ in Mendrisio, Switzerland, just 7km over the border from Como, Italy. Mendrisio is easily commutable from Milan, Como, Varese or Lugano and Cloud Academy provides the train ticket for you and we‚Äôre happy to facilitate your relocation to this area if needed!

¬†

Cloud Academy is the leading digital skills development platform that enables every enterprise to become a tech company through guided¬†Learning Paths,¬†Hands-on Labs, and¬†Skill Assessment. Cloud Academy delivers role-specific training on leading clouds (AWS,¬†Azure,¬†Google Cloud Platform), essential methodologies needed to operate on and between clouds (DevOps,¬†security,¬†containers), and capabilities that are unlocked by the cloud (big data,¬†machine learning).

Companies like Turner, Cognizant, SAS, and ThermoFisher¬†customize Cloud Academy¬†to contextualize learning and leverage the platform to¬†assign, manage, and measure¬†cloud enablement at scale.

¬†

Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide!

We‚Äôre looking for a¬†Sr Back-End Developer¬†to help us take our product to the next level.¬†

We move seamlessly from full-stack web development, to mobile, to deployment/scaling. This position will take ownership of how features are implemented, from user experience to backend, involving our web app, mobile app, APIs and backend infrastructure.

You‚Äôll have an opportunity to make a large impact on the culture of our development team.




Our ideal candidate is a humble leader, equally capable of teaching and learning.

¬†

Responsibilities

Able to write well-structured, maintainable, idiomatic code with good documentation; unit tests for every feature, bug fixing and code reviews.

Familiar with cloud architecture patterns and best practices for designing highly available, scalable and secure systems.
Good level of English proficiency, both spoken and written.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a sense of urgency and integrity.




Benefits

Competitive compensation with an annual bonus potential.¬†The salary range is determined by the level of engineer a candidate is assessed at, and we have a range for each level of engineer at the company.¬†The salary for a Senior Software Engineer is a minimum of 60,000 CHF, plus an annual bonus of up to a 10% of the salary.
Train ticket paid for by the company
Budget for professional development
4 weeks paid vacation per year plus 17 paid holidays per year
Remote working policy including 1 month per year of remote working from anywhere!
Great company culture and work environment!
Highly-skilled teammates and lots of opportunities for growth and development!

title: Consultant/Senior Consultant - Finance&Performance - Banking/Insurance
description:
CONSULTING
CONSULTANT/SENIOR CONSULTANT ‚Äì FINANCE&PERFORMANCE ‚Äì FSI
What Impact will you make?

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

La finance transformation √® un elemento chiave per tenere il passo con il cambiamento e con le nuove strategie di business; √® d‚Äôaltra parte un processo estremamente complesso, che rischia di diventare molto oneroso, soprattutto senza un'adeguata pianificazione.
Deloitte Finance aiuta i CFO nell‚Äô affrontare le sfide pi√π critiche, sostenendo le funzioni finance nella generazione di valore per il business, sviluppando dei modelli operativi altamente funzionali, migliorando i processi chiave, gestendo la performance ordinaria e supportando la definizione di strategie.
La nostra ambizione √® quella di continuare a essere la scelta numero uno dei CFO, fornendo loro una prospettiva strategica che li guidi nelle criticit√† pi√π complesse che si trovano ad affrontare.

All‚Äôinterno del perimetro d‚Äôazione e dei main topic della divisione Finance & Performance, l‚Äôarea F&P ‚Äì FSI √® coinvolta principalmente in progettualit√† che impattano gli ambiti Finance Strategy, Business Finance e Operational Finance.
In particolare, gli ambiti elencati si sostanziano nelle seguenti principali progettualit√†:

Finance Strategy
Studi di fattibilit√† per l‚ÄôArea CFO;

Operational Finance

Accounting Reengineering and Transformation;

Your Responsabilities

Il tuo ruolo sar√† focalizzato sull‚Äôesecuzione proattiva e responsabile di complesse attivit√† progettuali, sul coordinamento di parte del team di progetto e sul supporto al Manager nella gestione del cliente. Agendo con autonomia ed autorevolezza all‚Äôinterno di team multifunzionali, sarai responsabile per la qualit√† del tuo lavoro e di quello del team nel quale sarai inserito, influenzando in modo positivo i clienti e i tuoi interlocutori attraverso uno stile di comunicazione chiaro, empatico e di impatto. Avrai la responsabilit√† di condividere la tua esperienza e le tue conoscenze con i colleghi pi√π giovani e di essere per loro un punto di riferimento nella realizzazione della nostra ambizione: ‚Äúmake an impact that matters‚Äù.
Per una piena copertura del tuo ruolo, dovrai in particolare essere in grado di:

Assumere responsabilit√† per i risultati del proprio workstream, garantendo pieno allineamento con gli obiettivi di progetto e gli standard di qualit√† di Deloitte
Guidare le raccolta e gestione dei dati necessari alla formulazione di ipotesi e proposte, utilizzando un approccio strutturato al problem solving.
Incorporare informazioni finanziarie nella formulazione e valutazione delle opzioni strategiche
Mostrate maturit√† professionale in situazioni complesse e delicate, fungendo da modello per i colleghi junior
Collaborare efficacemente attraverso il Network, al fine di poter fornire soluzioni globali.
Integrare le proposte ai clienti con soluzioni basate su utilizzo di analytics e nuove tecnologie, in collaborazione con i colleghi esperti in materia

Our Requirements

Il/la candidato/a ideali sono in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale, o altri indirizzi scientifici (Fisica, Matematica, ‚Ä¶),
Esperienza di minimo 2/4 anni in Societ√† di consulenza o Istituzioni Finanziarie,
Esperienza di minimo 2/4 anni sulle seguenti tematiche in ambito banking:
Asset and Liability Management,
Treasury,
Pianificazione e controllo di gestione
Performance Measurement
Esperienza sugli strumenti/ tool a supporto per analysis and reporting e data management.
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese,
Disponibilit√† a trasferte, in Italia e all‚Äôestero.

Completano il profilo ottime capacit√† analitiche e relazionali, precisione, autonomia organizzativa e uno spiccato orientamento al teamworking e al raggiungimento dei risultati.

About Consulting

La Practice Consulting √® suddivisa in tre macro aree:

Technology
Strategy & Operations
Human Capital

Risolviamo problemi complessi

I nostri consulenti sono noti per la capacit√† di risolvere alcune delle sfide pi√π complesse del business, in Italia e nel mondo. Con oltre 2.000 persone nel nostro team, siamo motivati da una vera passione nel cercare soluzioni a problemi apparentemente imperscrutabili. Questo richiede una vera attitudine a collaborare ed √® il motivo per cui ci impegniamo a intercettare i bisogni dei clienti, a comprendere e apprezzare il contesto in cui operano, i loro obiettivi e le loro aspirazioni. Non abbiamo paura di proporre e questo √® il modo con cui costruiamo rapporti duraturi basati sulla reciproca fiducia.

Lavoriamo a stretto contatto con i nostri clienti per aiutarli a trovare le migliori soluzioni e a metterle in atto. Vogliamo che diventino sostenitori attivi del processo di trasformazione che abbiamo iniziato. Per noi, questo vuol dire stimolare un cambiamento sostenibile e con le nostre analisi produrre un impatto che duri nel tempo

About Deloitte

Deloitte offre servizi integrati di Audit, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro approccio unisce conoscenze multidisciplinari, esperienza a livello globale, innovazione e servizi di alta qualit√†. Crediamo fermamente che il nostro lavoro possa influenzare positivamente la comunit√† in cui operiamo.

Il nostro purpose

Make an impact that matters. Questo √® il nostro obiettivo, e ci√≤ che ci definisce. Significa fare la differenza per i nostri clienti, per i nostri colleghi e nella societ√†, creando un impatto a lungo termine. Vogliamo essere la prima scelta dei clienti, la prima scelta dei talenti e i primi a lasciare un segno.

I nostri valori

Incoraggiamo la collaborazione, la diversit√† di pensiero e la capacit√† di pensare fuori dagli schemi. Con questo approccio aiutiamo i talenti a esprimere al meglio le proprie capacit√†. Per noi la diversity √® un valore e il rispetto √® al centro della nostra cultura inclusiva.

La nostra talent experience

Chi lavora in Deloitte, fin dal primo giorno, si sente parte di un network che supporta e incoraggia i colleghi. Il percorso di crescita e di carriera consente di sviluppare le competenze e le capacit√† per avere successo. In un ambiente di lavoro che incoraggia la collaborazione e la creativit√†, il benessere delle nostre persone e la flessibilit√† sono al centro di una talent experience distintiva.

Il nome Deloitte si riferisce a una o pi√π delle seguenti entit√†: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, una societ√† inglese a responsabilit√† limitata (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù), le member firm aderenti al suo network e le entit√† a esse correlate. DTTL e ciascuna delle sue member firm sono entit√† giuridicamente separate e indipendenti tra loro. DTTL (denominata anche ‚ÄúDeloitte Global‚Äù) non fornisce servizi ai clienti. Si invita a leggere l‚Äôinformativa completa relativa alla descrizione della struttura legale di Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited e delle sue member firm all‚Äôindirizzo www.deloitte.com/about

Deloitte Italy SpA ("Deloitte Italy") √® la member firm di DTTL in Italia, dove √® presente dal 1923. Tra le pi√π grandi realt√† nei servizi professionali alle imprese in Italia, Deloitte Italy vanta radici antiche, coniugando tradizione di qualit√† con metodologie e tecnologie innovative. I servizi di audit, tax, consulting e financial advisory sono offerti da diverse societ√† e studi specializzati in singole aree professionali e tra loro separati e indipendenti, ma tutti facenti parte del network Deloitte. Questo oggi conta circa 3.600 professionisti, i quali assistono i clienti nel raggiungimento di livelli d‚Äôeccellenza grazie alla fiducia nell'alta qualit√† del servizio, all‚Äôofferta multidisciplinare e alla presenza capillare sul territorio nazionale.

title: Software Engineer - Sysdig Secure (Milan)
description:
Sysdig is the secure DevOps company, and we‚Äôre at the forefront of the container, Kubernetes, and cloud revolution. We are passionate, technical problem-solvers, continually innovating and delivering powerful solutions to confidently run cloud-native applications. Our consistent contributions to open source software projects reflect our commitment to the open cloud movement.

We value diversity and open dialog to spur ideas, working closely together to achieve goals. And we're a great place to work too -- we were awarded the2021 Bay Area Best Places to Work Award from San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal. We are looking for team members who share our commitment to customers and are willing to dig deeper, understand problems and deliver innovative solutions. Does this sound like the right place for you?

Your Opportunity

As a Software Engineer, you will work end to end on our security side of the product, from architecting to delivery, creating new features and functionalities. You will work closely with our established engineering team located throughout the US and Europe, product team and customers. Sysdig is a high growth startup, and there will be significant expansion opportunities for this position. Our customer base is enlarging fast and so is the scale demanded of our backend. As a consequence, we are adding new features to our secure product line and enhancing existing capabilities.

Your Responsibilities

You'll lead projects as part of this effort that will allow us to build services to help customers manage their infrastructure in a secure manner.

Build distributed services which can consume and process billions of customer‚Äôs system events and network activity.
Put machine learning features into production
Handle security data on a daily basis across multiple platform tiers (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, GCP)

Your Background

Prior experience building distributed services
Systems software experience including good understanding of system calls
Strong computer science fundamentals in design, data structures, and algorithms
Experience in Go is highly preferred
Experience in Java is a plus
Prior experience with AWS/GCP and building security products is a plus
Experience with Kubernetes is a plus
Startup / entrepreneurial experience is a plus
A positive ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude with the ability to articulate thoughts and ideas and see them to fruition
An appetite for varied data

Key Technologies

Go
Java
ElasticSearch
Redis
Postgres
Kafka/NATS
Linux


When You Join Sysdig, You Can Expect

Competitive salary

title: Strategy Banking Consultant [Online / Phone Recruitment]
description:
Why Accenture? To discover the energy and commitment we devote to our customers by transforming their working method with the most advanced technologies. At Accenture, you'll grow as a member of an international network. Each day, you‚Äôll make a difference using whatever makes you unique.

Your challenges

Working with the Accenture Banking Practice, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to operate across several industry sectors: Corporate Banking, Wealth Management, Commercial Banking, Payments, Near Banking (Leasing, Factoring, Alternative Finance), Bancassurance, Assurbanking.

You‚Äôll get the best out of your team, learning from diverse cultural backgrounds, skillsets and mindsets.

Your main responsibilities will be to:



Develop innovative and disruptive business solutions, referring to the most innovative topics (Open Banking, Fintech, Blockchain, Advanced Analytics, AI, Machine Learning, Augmented and Virtual Reality)


Contribute to our client's business purpose, in terms of new trends and impacts, as ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) Strategy, Human + Machine approach, Data Driven transformation


Adapt distribution and service channels to seamlessly incorporate digital and mobile banking


Deploy cutting-edge banking automation, including robotic process automation (RPA), machine learning and the latest advances in artificial intelligence


Help in redesign product lines, to increase sales effectiveness. You will be involved in customer strategy, customer experience and customer loyalty


Project new operating models to deliver strategic change and improve organization agility and/or capture value from M&A


Support M&A and post-merger integration activities


Draw cohesive conclusions and present key findings to C-level clients


Be responsible for coaching and mentoring analysts and junior consultants of your team



Why we would choose you? The challenges you face reflect your ambitions; this is your chance. To stand out and face them in the best way:



You have 2-5 years‚Äô experience in consulting, a start-up or other business environment


You have robust analytical skill set


You are a solid team player who‚Äôs also an independent thinker


You are deadline-driven, organized and able to multitask


You have strong verbal, written and presentation skills


You have at least a Master‚Äôs Degree


You speak and write English fluently


You love to share and learn different things


Every day is a new challenge for you and an opportunity to learn something new



Are you determined to face and beat off the challenges this role brings even if you don't have all the required qualifications? Apply and tell us how you can make a difference.

Unleash your talent and build your career with us. Visit our website and discover the FAQ section to better plan your application: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/

For further information, visit our website: professioni.accenture.it

title: Senior account executive
description:
Direct message the job poster from SAS

Francesca Sciloretti Diana
Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist Emea

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker ‚Äì always asking, ‚ÄúWhat if?‚Äù¬†

¬†

If so, then you may be the new team member we‚Äôre looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters ‚Äì whether you‚Äôre developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.¬†

¬†

What we do¬†¬†

We‚Äôre the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.¬†

¬†

What you‚Äôll do

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Account Executive to manage our key and most strategic SAS customers in the Financial Sector .¬†

Working in Financial Sector Sales Team will present you with the opportunity to drive change, deliver strategic value and broaden your knowledge in the following domains:

Customer Intelligence & Analytical CRM
Data Integration & Data Management
Internet of Things
Supply Chain Intelligence
Demand-Driven Forecasting & Optimisation
Advanced Analytics¬†
Artificial Intelligence
Machine Learning

¬†

SAS is¬†recognised by industry analysts as a leader in analytics, data management, data science, real-time customer experience, risk management and many other domains. Working either directly with customers or with our strategic partners, you will deliver solutions that deliver transformational value.

¬†

You will be working with some of the brightest minds in the industry, in a company that encourages curiosity and innovation. We strive to achieve excellence as ethical sales professionals with our customers at the centre of everything we do.

¬†

What are we looking for?

¬†

You will be highly experienced in software sales and have an outstanding track record of consistently meeting/exceeding revenue and corporate objectives.

Demonstrated understanding of strategic sales techniques and principles specifically in the software industry.
Demonstrated knowledge of the Financial Sector.
Experience selling complex IT solutions to the Banking and Insurance.

Knowledge, skills, and abilities needed

Ability to analyse the customers strategy to map it with our offerings
Ability to understand and communicate technical and business concepts and relate them to SAS applications and user needs.
Experience leading & advancing discussions with influential decision makers..
Ability to create demand through insight by identifying the targeted account‚Äôs business challenges and needs and their probably causes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strategic selling skills, skills in analyzing and evaluating territory dynamics to develop and implement a sales plan.
Ability to initiate and lead projects.
Ability to work independently and manage virtual teams.
Ability to travel.
You‚Äôre curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.

Why SAS

We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.¬†
Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn‚Äôt about fitting into our culture, it‚Äôs about adding to it - and we can‚Äôt wait to see what you‚Äôll bring.
Last but not least: We are the inventor of Analytics and a proud partner of diverse companies around the globe - working in all industry segments - in terms of data-driven value creation for 45 years

¬†

#LI-NB1

¬†

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at¬†www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified ‚Äúsas.com‚Äù email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at¬†Recruitingsupport@sas.com¬†before taking any further action.‚Äô

title: Intern, Administrative Law
description:
Our platform, your impact.¬†




Join our team in Milan and you will be supporting the lawyers of the team in assisting Italian and international clients in administrative law matters related to the energy industry, public procurement, environmental, town planning, expropriation and pharmaceutical areas and tenders for public contracts, public services, public¬†concessions and PPP contracts with particular reference to the healthcare and public infrastructure sectors.




We thrive on complex clients' challenges and deliver exceptional results to clients. We're trusted advisors, innovators and game-changers, going above and beyond to accelerate growth and open new opportunities - the perfect place to develop and achieve your ambitions.




MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Advising clients on administrative law matters
Advising clients on contentious matters before the Regional Administrative Courts, Council of State, High Court of Public Waters, Supreme Court and Civil Courts
Advising clients operating in the real estate sector in relation to the development construction, acquisition and financing of large logistic and commercial centers
Engaging in the drafting, negotiating and reviewing of a wide variety of contracts memoranda and disputes related documents and conducting the relevant legal searches
Dealing with due diligence activities also supervising junior professional




ABOUT YOU




Final university dissertation in administrative law
Previous experience in an administrative law boutique or in a multipractice law firm will be considered as a plus
Excellent academic marks¬†
Excellent communication and drafting skills in English and Italian
Service minded, organized and able to meet deadlines
Positive mentality with a "can do" attitude
Demonstrate a desire to achieve excellence
Open to changing environment which requires daily learning




ABOUT YOU




A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or equivalent required
Experience of using Tableau to develop dashboards. Proficient in Tableau Desktop and have working knowledge of Tableau Prep
Expereince with using advanced tableau functionality such as filters, functions, table calculations, LODs, and dashboard actions
Knowledge of developing Tableau stories and deploying tableau dashboards in production¬†
Skilled at dashboard design with a consideration of UI/UX fundamentals including visualization theory and best practices
Strong SQL skills and ability to create data pipelines with data coming from on-premise and cloud data stores
Experience using statistical methods to create models and analyse large dataset using Python
Knowledge of core data science concepts and techniques (statistics, clustering, segmentation, classification, regression etc.)
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, its development on real-world datasets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to analyse complex datasets and translate it into meaningful visualisations
Proven data analysis skills including knowledge and experience with developing customer-facing solutions
Ability to pick up and learn new technologies quickly
A strong ability to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a concise and engaging manner
Understanding of converting user requirements into deliverable reports and analytical data sets




OUR VALUES




In everything we do connected with our People, our Clients and our Communities, we live by these values:




Be Supportive¬†- we care about others, value diversity and act thoughtfully
Be Collaborative¬†- we give, we share and we join in
Be Bold¬†- we stand tall and challenge ourselves to think big
Be Exceptional¬†- we exceed standards and expectations




DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION




At DLA Piper, diversity and inclusion underpins how we live our values and everything we do.¬†We believe that everyone has a voice, and that everyone‚Äôs voice counts. We know that the rich diversity across our firm makes us stronger, more innovative and creative, which helps us to better serve our clients and communities. We are committed to providing an inclusive working environment and culture across our global firm, where everyone can bring their authentic self to work.¬†




Diversity of perspective, thought, background and culture combine to make us the leading global law firm; that‚Äôs why we actively seek to build balanced teams. We welcome the unique contribution that you will bring to our firm and actively encourage applications from all talented people ‚Äì however your talent is packaged, whatever your background or circumstance and regardless of how you identify.




We support anyone with a disability or long term health condition to ensure they have the opportunity to perform at their best. If you have not done so already, please let us know if you require any support so we can make the right adjustments and considerations should they be required.




AGILE WORKING




We know that people have responsibilities and interests outside of their career and that as a business, we all benefit from working flexibly. That's why we are open to discussing with candidates the different ways in which we are able to support requests for agile working arrangements.




PRE-ENGAGEMENT SCREENING

Ôªø

In the event that we make an offer to you, and where local legislation permits, we will conduct pre-engagement screening checks that may include but are not limited to your professional and academic qualifications, your eligibility to work in the relevant jurisdiction, any criminal records, your financial stability and references from previous employers.

title: PARTNER SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT
description:
Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Partner Solution Architect, focused on supporting System Integrators and Partners to join our thriving technical community and growing business in Italy as part of the EMEA Public Sector team. You will join a friendly and supportive team, working together to bring the latest in disruptive cloud computing technologies to organisations serving our Public Sector customers, including: government agencies, state-owned companies, educational institutions, healthcare and non-profit organisations. Our Public Sector teams help customers build a deeper understanding of hyper-scale cloud technology and application architectures, and they have the consultative and leadership skills required to drive deliver successful outcomes.

As a Partner Solutions Architect you will help develop the technical capabilities of AWS Partners so they can be successful in the building and selling Cloud solutions to Public Sector customers. Working with Partners is a team effort that will require influence and coordination with many stakeholders., you will have ownership of the technical relationship with customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability, operational efficiency and best-practice architectures.

Internally, you will be an advocate acting on behalf of the Partner to help drive continual improvements to the AWS platform, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features and services. You will also help shape the future of the Solutions Architecture organisation by helping to hire, coach and mentor others.

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures with the worldwide AWS Solutions Architect community. You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelise and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).

If you can educate AWS partners and customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.


Basic Qualifications

Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps.
Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with business-fluent English {and/or any other language requirement for role}, to be able to drive discussions in a customer organisation, as well as the technical background that enables you to easily interact with and give guidance to customers working in operational roles.
A passion for technology and for learning.

Preferred Qualifications

The following qualifications are desired but not required:
Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud.
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures.
Working knowledge of multiple technology domains, such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
Experience working in a customer-facing role.
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification.

title: Channel Field Marketing Senior Analyst - Milan
description:
Channel Field Marketing Senior Analyst

Milan

Assessing market trends, quantifying opportunities and developing marketing programs, Field Marketing at Dell Technologies is at the forefront of customer engagement. Responsible for a specific location, department or product, our teams drive marcom strategy ‚Äì from making budget recommendations to defining roadmaps and informing content themes. Interacting directly with customers and utilizing third-party customer data, they provide Dell‚Äôs product marketing and messaging team with game-changing feedback. At the highest level, they develop and drive marketing policies and activities, from market research through brand management and product development to pricing.

Join us as a ChannelField Marketing Senior Analyst on our Marketing Team in Milan to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What You‚Äôll Achieve

As a Channel Marketing Snr Analyst you will make a significant contribution to achieving our Italian business goals through:

Understanding go-to-market and channel marketing & sales strategies for the country and then developing, implementing and executing specific marketing programs and projects that align with those strategies and broader business priorities.
Managing properly MDF budget process in order to maximize pipeline return.
Interacting, meeting and influencing with Channel Partners and Sales to enhance, create and implement marketing strategies, plans and activities that increase our pipeline and meet revenue goals
Managing outsourced agencies and delivering/executing key local channel events (face to face or virtual) and leveraging the WER and EMEA marketing resources and programs by providing proactive feedback to the EMEA central marketing team.


Take the first step towards your dream career

Essential Requirements

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here‚Äôs what we are looking for with this role:

Experience: 5+ years relevant channel marketing experience
Good presentation skills, Italian mother tongue and fluent in English.
Strong knowledge of business and marketing
Good analytical ability and financial understanding
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams/work groups.


Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We‚Äôre proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What‚Äôs most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life ‚Äî while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn‚Äôt stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what‚Äôs next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 30 June 2021

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. title: Android Engineer
description:
Join us today and make a difference in people's lives!

About Epsy Health

Epsy is a leading digital health platform empowering patients, caregivers and healthcare providers: we give the world a better way to live with seizures and epilepsy.

Come work with us and build something that matters ‚Äì we provide patients and physicians with tools and insights that help to accelerate the pathway towards better outcomes. We do this by bringing together the best people, the latest technologies, user-centric designs and state-of-the-art data analysis.

We are solving a large problem as epilepsy affects more than 65 million people and is one of the most common neurological diseases.

We operate as an independent startup within a large corporate, the LivaNova group. This gives us unique advantages: we move fast and drive growth, while we benefit from the corporate umbrella for excellent funding and resources. Epsy Health is headquartered in London (UK) and Houston (Texas, USA), and our team has fully embraced remote work for the long-term.

Come and join one of the 3 team that won the 2020 Google Material Design Award!

Your Role

Work as a member of the team at every stage of software development life cycle - being capable of designing solutions, writing and testing application code and finally manage the deployment (with automated pipeline)
Research and innovate during your day to day work ‚Äì gather and share knowledge
Provide input and influence discussions around best practices and new technologies, helping us to develop an effective basis for future developments

You Will Work On

Our Android application created with modern material design
Data pipeline for gathering and processing high volume of data collected from the users devices
Machine learning implementation on user devices

Required Skills

And Experience

Deep understanding of modern Android development in an agile environment
Familiarity with RESTful and GraphQL APIs
Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
Ability to translate business and product goals into technical implementations
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks

If you would like to see what we use to power our platform please visit: https://stackshare.io/epsy-health/epsy-health

Desirable

Skills And Experience

AWS Amplify framework (Cognito Authentication, AppSync)
Wear OS and smartwatches development
Experience with automated end-to-end, frontend testing

Why work at Epsy?

Working At Epsy You Can Expect Things Like

Join our award-winning team and give the world a better way to live with epilepsy. While we operate as an independent startup we are part of the LivaNova group, this allows us to benefit from economies of scale of a large corporate and offer a rich set of benefits.

10% Pension contribution
Private Medical Insurance (international or UK only)
Permanent Health Care Scheme (Income Protection)
Corporate program in LivaNova‚Äôs publicly listed shares
Flexible work from home arrangements
Supportive senior leadership with a real positive and enthusiastic atmosphere throughout the company
Cycle to work schema
32 days per year for holidays (including Bank Holidays)
Gym Membership
Eye care
Newest hardware and all software you need to work effectively

Our friendly team encompasses experienced designers, app developers, product managers, marketeers, customer success managers and data analysts. At Epsy we pride ourselves on our all-team collaborative approach and actively encourage learning, whether it be in your speciality or simply an area you might like to learn about (examples include talks about Hedge Fund management and wine!). If you are looking to develop your career, move fast, being constantly challenged in a supportive team who actively want to better the lives of millions of people, then Epsy is the place for you.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

LivaNova values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate‚Äôs sex, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, color, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Background Checks At LivaNova

Upon successful completion of the hiring process an offer may be extended. Please note, LivaNova reserves the right to conduct background investigations and/or reference checks on all its potential employees, where permitted by local legislation. This offer therefore, is contingent upon a clearance of such a background investigation and/or reference check, and can be rescinded, where permitted by local legislation, based upon data received in the background check and/or refusal to cooperate with or any attempt to affect the results of this check. This process is not currently valid in Germany.

Notice To Third Party Agencies

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

title: Senior Business Consultant
description:
Senior Business Consultant

BY Software offers the leading supply chain management (SCM) platform powered by artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). BY‚Äôs leading cloud solutions manage supply chains from end-to-end, spanning supply chain and retail planning, execution and delivery. Using BY‚Äôs comprehensive SCM platform and its broad partner ecosystem, customers can better predict and shape demand, transform product delivery, fulfil more intelligently, grow revenue and profits, and deliver superior customer experiences. BY‚Äôs proven solutions power an Autonomous Supply Chain for 4,000 of the world‚Äôs leading companies including 75 of the top 100 retailers, 77 of the top 100 consumer goods companies, and 8 of the top 10 global 3PLs.

What You‚Äôll Do

Assists project Managers in planning efforts.
Ability to prepare and deliver presentations for users, management, and executive-level audiences. Provides advice to customers regarding industry best practices and process methodology.
Participate in business process/analysis, design, construction, validation, and deployment phases of the project.
Understands how the Blue Yonder solutions within the area of focus can be configured and delivered to better enable customer business processes.
Develops functional specifications of sound design for modifications, interfaces, reports, and screens that achieve customers‚Äô business objectives.
Creates and modifies procedural and system documentation throughout the project.
Develops and executes test scripts to ensure Blue Yonder software consistently meets the customer‚Äôs business objectives.
Provides non-technical support during the ‚Äúgo-live‚Äù period.
Provides primary user support and verifies that the system supports the required business functions and maintains data integrity.
Recognizes and highlights incremental revenue opportunities with existing customers/projects.
Serves in a supporting functional role while attending and contributing to key meetings between Blue Yonder project stakeholders, customer stakeholders, and corresponding leadership teams.
Ensures knowledge transfer is conducted with the customer project team.
Communicates business cases to PMG and PD regarding customer specific needs related to product functionality and enhancements.


Required Skills

Fluent in Italian and English.
BS/BA degree required.
5+ years Supply chain management experience, ideally in wholesale/distribution or retail.
Working knowledge of Blue Yonder Advanced Warehouse Replenishment, Advanced Store Replenishment, Network Optimization, and Multi-Tier.
Implementation project knowledge and experience strongly preferred.
Knowledge of business processes in SCM.
Experience implementing planning and replenishment solutions from Blue Yonder.
Experienced in defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions.
Strong proactive communicator and presenter, able to influence and collaborate at all levels.
Ability to work independently and be effective/proactive in a relatively unstructured environment.
Ability to develop and maintain strong, productive relationships with customers, partners, and consultants.
Ability and willingness to travel up to 60%.

Our Values

If you want to know the heart of a company, take a look at their values. Ours unite us. They are what drive our success ‚Äì and the success of our customers. Does your heart beat like ours? Find out here: Core Values

Check out Blue Yonder's blog - Supply Chain Nation - the platform for supply chain trends and innovations.

title: Product (UX/UI) Designer
description:
PLEASE NOTE: This is either an onsite role based in our Swiss office in Mendrisio, Switzerland (it's just 7km and is easily commutable from Milan, Como, Varese or Lugano) or a 100% remote position for candidates based in Europe who speak fluent English and are willing and able to spend around a week per quarter in our Swiss Office once the pandemic situation has improved (travel expenses covered).

We are also happy to assist with your relocation to this beautiful part of Europe and we have a remote working policy.

Cloud Academy is the leading digital skills development platform that enables every enterprise to become a tech company through guided Learning Paths, Hands-on Labs, and Skill Assessment. Cloud Academy delivers role-specific training on the leading cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), essential methodologies needed to operate on and between clouds (DevOps, security, containers), and capabilities that are unlocked by the cloud (big data, machine learning).Companies like Turner, Cognizant, SAS, and ThermoFisher customize Cloud Academy to contextualize learning and leverage the platform to assign, manage, and measure cloud enablement at scale. Learn more at cloudacademy.com.

Now is your chance to join our talented team and help us build the future of IT learning!

We are looking for a passionate Product Designer to add to our growing team. As a Product Designer, you will work closely with engineering and product to design and iterate on simple, intuitive solutions for the consumer and enterprise market, with special attention to the e-learning and technology objectives of our platform.

We're looking for a designer with the ability to go from the "big picture" view of a user experience right down to the "close-up" level of pixels and micro-interactions.

You will be involved in key new projects with a 50/50 balance between creating new products and re-architecting existing ones.

What You Will Do

as the Product Designer at Cloud Academy:

Balance different learning content (video, quizzes, hands-on labs) in one seamless experience to keep learners engaged and excited.
Accelerate our customer acquisition by enabling growth projects- Help users learn together by re-thinking our platform with collaboration in mind
Integrate user experience design and visual design functions to produce simple, highly usable, scalable designs that create cohesive, positive user experiences across multiple product lines.
Build and define the design function within the product development organization, including user interface design and visual design.
Drive forward and boost the product and design vision working closely and proactively with PMs and engineering teams
Create prototypes and collaborate with engineers and stakeholders to make sure the product meets the highest standards of quality
Work within a defined design system and design new components as needed.
Help build a collaborative design culture, a cohesive user experience, and a powerful brand

Requirements

3+ years of experience as a product designer, user experience designer, or similar UX/UI-related role
Passion for product design and the desire to work in a product designer role
Experience developing successful and impactful products from concept through production and the ability to showcase your work
Exceptional ability to collaborate and facilitate the design process
Excellent communication skills and ease having discussions with users, engineers, and executives
Excellent spoken and written English is a must for this position

Benefits

Competitive salary including a bonus plan
Great company culture and work environment!
World class teammates and lots of opportunities for growth and development!
Budget for professional development
Relocation budget
Remote working policy including 1 month a year of remote working from anywhere
4 weeks paid vacation per year plus 17 paid holidays

title: Sr. Program Manager, Customer Packaging Experience
description:
Description

Senior Program Manager, Frustration-Free Packaging Europe ‚Äì
Amazon Customer Packaging Experience (CPEX) Team

As a customer-centric company that is committed to sustainability, we see it as part of our mission to optimize the overall customer experience. We do so by setting a high bar for the selection and use of our own outbound e-commerce packaging, We also collaborate with vendors and sellers worldwide to invent sustainable packaging that delights customers, eliminates waste, and ensures products arrive undamaged to our customers‚Äô doorsteps. Amazon drives outbound packaging waste reduction by using machine learning to select the least wasteful type of packaging for each product we ship. We have used this tool to reduce the weight of our outbound packaging by more than 33% over the past 5 years, eliminating over 1 million tons of packaging material. We share this knowledge with vendors and sellers through our Frustration-Free Packaging (FFP) Program, which encourages them to package their products in easy-to-open packaging that is 100% recyclable and, where safe to do so, ships without any additional Amazon packaging.

Responsibilities

The Senior Program Manager, Frustration-Free Packaging Europe, will be a key contributor of the Customer Packaging Experience Vendor Engagement Team. They will delight our customers by reducing packaging waste. They will support Vendors as they convert their products‚Äô packaging to FFP standards and support the FC network to support increased FFP shipments. This way, Amazon and our vendors will collectively optimize products‚Äô protection, minimize packaging weight and waste, reduce packaging production related emission, reduce virgin packaging material consumption through increased recycled content and reduced packaging weight, reduce packaging cube for less emissions in transportation, reduce costs for vendors, and make packaging 100% recyclable. We subsidize our vendors who convert to FFP packaging with a financial incentive that indemnifies the cost of designing and launching FFP packaging. They will help expedite the FFP conversion process until the new packaging becomes available on our marketplace, and manage a pipeline of vendor conversions projects carefully targeted in advance, ship in vendors‚Äô (manufacturers‚Äô) package only, and increase the proportion of FFP shipments that won‚Äôt require for Amazon to add packaging.

Location
This position may be based in an Amazon office in Italy, Luxemburg, the UK, or Germany, or remote in the previously mentioned countries plus France, Italy, or Spain.

Travel
60% travel, mostly in Europe

Key Interfaces

Vendors: Operations, Supply Chain, Packaging Design, Product Management,
Amazon Retail: EU Operations, Vendor Relationship Managers
Amazon CPEX: Lab Team, Field Team, Product Managers, Scientists, Business Intelligence, Vendor Engagement North America located in North America and Europe
Amazon Packaging Services and Suppliers (APASS) network members including packaging testing labs, structural packaging design engineering firms, and materials suppliers, located in EU


Basic Qualifications

Proven experience managing complex projects for the clients of packaging materials organizations where automation and equipment are a critical part of designing packaging materials, and packaging products
Experience in sustainability
Bachelor's degree completed (BA or BSc)
Fluent English and Italian

Preferred Qualifications

Master's Degree
Fluency in other European languages
Worked in partnership with structural packaging design engineers/firms, and/or packaging test laboratories
Worked in partnership with corrugated, paper board, or paper bags and mailers secondary packaging suppliers
Substantial experience identifying and influencing all decision makers and contributors across functions and levels (including senior Executives), building trust and relationships with them, understanding their pain points, objections and needs, so that Amazon can position a value proposition of FFP conversion in a way that it addresses each individual Vendor stakeholder‚Äôs needs or pain points, and overcomes their objections
Substantial experience analyzing data and summarizing insights in graphic representation to support a value-based and customized value proposition for a vendor, preparing customer story materials
Substantial experience writing position papers, status updates, program vision papers in a concise, data driven, articulated way, and finely adjusted to the audience the written content addresses.
Proven experience leading multiple projects where functions from at least two organizations need to work with each other; drove projects to exceptional outcomes, and exceeded objectives.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

description:

Verifica della conformit√† delle specifiche di progetto rispetto ai requisiti di qualit√† Aziendale di costo e ai criteri di monitoraggio post vendita (Service)

Conoscenza delle tecniche di Machine Learning
Conoscenze delle tecniche di base dell‚Äôanalisi statistica (ad es. Montecarlo, Design of Experiments, DOE)

title: Product (UX/UI) Designer
description:
Direct message the job poster from Cloud Academy, Inc.

Valentina Zaccolo
HR&Talent Acquisition

PLEASE NOTE: This is either an onsite role based in our Swiss office in Mendrisio, Switzerland (it's just 7km and is easily commutable from Milan, Como, Varese or Lugano) or a 100% remote position for candidates based in Europe who speak fluent English and are willing and able to spend around a week per quarter in our Swiss Office once the pandemic situation has improved (travel expenses covered).

We are also happy to assist with your relocation to this beautiful part of Europe and we have a remote working policy.




Cloud Academy is the leading digital skills development platform that enables every enterprise to become a tech company through guided¬†Learning Paths,¬†Hands-on Labs, and¬†Skill Assessment. Cloud Academy delivers role-specific training on the leading cloud platforms (AWS,¬†Azure,¬†Google Cloud Platform), essential methodologies needed to operate on and between clouds (DevOps,¬†security,¬†containers), and capabilities that are unlocked by the cloud (big data,¬†machine learning).Companies like Turner, Cognizant, SAS, and ThermoFisher¬†customize Cloud Academy¬†to contextualize learning and leverage the platform to¬†assign, manage, and measure¬†cloud enablement at scale. Learn more at¬†cloudacademy.com.




Now is your chance to join our talented team and help us build the future of IT learning!

We are looking for a passionate¬†Product Designer¬†to add to our growing team. As a Product Designer, you will¬†work closely with engineering and product to design and iterate on simple, intuitive solutions for the consumer and enterprise market,¬†with special attention to the e-learning and technology objectives of our platform.¬†

We're looking for a designer with the ability to go from the "big picture" view of a user experience right down to the "close-up" level of pixels and micro-interactions.

You will be involved in¬†key new projects with a 50/50 balance between creating new products and re-architecting existing ones.




What you will do as the Product Designer at Cloud Academy:

- Balance different learning content (video, quizzes, hands-on labs) in one seamless experience to keep learners engaged and excited.

- Accelerate our customer acquisition by enabling growth projects- Help users learn together by re-thinking our platform with collaboration in mind

- Integrate user experience design and visual design functions to produce simple, highly usable, scalable designs that create cohesive, positive user experiences across multiple product lines.

-¬†Build and define the design function within the product development organization, including user interface design and visual design.

- Drive forward and boost the product and design vision working closely and proactively with PMs and engineering teams

- Create prototypes and collaborate with engineers and stakeholders to make sure the product meets the highest standards of quality

- Work within a defined design system and design new components as needed.

- Help build a collaborative design culture, a cohesive user experience, and a powerful brand




Requirements:

- 3+ years of experience as a product designer, user experience designer, or similar UX/UI-related role

- Passion for product design and the desire to work in a product designer role

- Experience developing successful and impactful products from concept through production and the ability to showcase your work

- Exceptional ability to collaborate and facilitate the design process

- Excellent communication skills and ease having discussions with users, engineers, and executives

- Excellent spoken and written English is a must for this position




Benefits:

- Competitive salary including a bonus plan

- Great company culture and work environment!

- World class teammates and lots of opportunities for growth and development!

- Budget for professional development

- Relocation budget

- Remote working policy

- 4 weeks paid vacation per year plus 17 paid holidays

title: Cloud Data Platform Solution Architect
description:
Cloud Data Platform Solution Architect

Posting Country: Italy

Date Posted: 09-Jun-2021

Full Time / Part Time: Full Time

Contract Type: Permanent

At Vodafone, we're working hard to build a better future. A more connected, inclusive and sustainable world. As a dynamic global community, it's our human spirit, together with technology, that empowers us to achieve this.
We challenge and innovate in order to connect people, businesses, and communities across the world. Delighting our customers and earning their loyalty drive us, and we experiment, learn fast and get it done, together.
With us, you can be truly be yourself and belong, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive, and make a real difference.

Role Purpose
The Vodafone Italy Business Intelligence and Big Data team is the owner of the Vodafone Italy data stack which includes Business Intelligence and Big Data system. It provides data and services to different stakeholders from predefined reports for business users, to self-service reporting for advanced BI users and analytics platform for data scientists. The platform we manage answers to multiple business needs leveraging on standard BI and ETL tools as well as on modern real time data streaming tools.
As an IT Business Intelligence Data Architect, you will be responsible in the definition and implementation of how data gets stored, consumed and managed by different entities in the company. You will understand the business requirement and enhance the systems to provide the necessary data in the best way according to the IT strategy and the business needs. Together with the team you will work on the enhancement the data model, create new analysis area and integrate them in the semantic layer.
You will provide value to the business improving the value of the data, the accessibility and the democratization on an enterprise grade BI that handles terabytes of data every day.
You will excel in this role if you have a broad knowledge of ETL, reporting systems, Big Data Platforms, Cloud Services, a passion for data and you will leverage them to design and adapt the existing tools and processes.

Main Activities And Responsibilities

Understand the data and transform them inside a multi speed environment
Analyze requirements and come up with technical solution to bring them to life
Design and develop extensions to the data platform working on the E2E data pipeline
Make data easily accessible to business users in Self-BI environment, define Machine Learning Pipelines and CI/CD pipelines
Manage the projects within team to achieve the business requirements within the agreed timelines and high quality
Be part of data governance team to build the new models that serves the business requests
Be compliant with company data governance, data standards and software development methodology in the delivery
Provide guidance to comply with mid-long term plans for Vodafone Data Architecture
Recommend approaches, lead design and create solid technical solutions for complex business scenarios
Drive PoCs, Software Selection and Solution Design for Batch and Real Time use cases



Core Competencies, Knowledge And Experience

Master's degree in computer science, engineering and/or other STEM degrees
Working experience in similar roles
Knowledge of SQL, NOSQL, Hadoop/Big Data and data modelling concepts
Knowledge of ETL/ELT tools and patterns.
Understanding of Ci/CD frameworks leveraging on tools as Jenkins + GitHub
Understanding of distributed compute frameworks such as spark.
Knowledge of data preparation and reporting tools
Attitude to plan and organize work to deliver project as agreed
Great communication skills and stakeholder management
Fluent English speaking and writing
(Preferred) Knowledge of Cloud Data Architecture on GCP or other Cloud Providers for storage, compute (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)
Great will to work and to learn new skills



Vodafone is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the very best people by offering a motivating and inclusive workplace in which talent is truly recognised and rewarded. We are committed to promoting Inclusion for All with the belief that diversity plays an important role in the success of our business. We actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of our journey.

description:

Luca Giacomel
Co-Founder at Plexagon | We are hiring!

Flutter Mobile Software Engineer

Plexagon is looking for a world-class Flutter Software Engineer to join our international team.

Fully Remote (worldwide) or from our Milan office




Job Description

Plexagon is an app publisher focused on mobile photo and video üì∏ editing. Our apps use Computer Vision and Machine Learning tools ü§ñ to support the new generation of content creators üöÄ




We are building a comprehensive suite of apps that interoperate seamlessly to support content creators from all over the world. Our Flutter Development team works closely with the Product Design team to develop beautiful UIs that provide the best experience to the millions of users that download our apps.




Required Qualifications¬†

Experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Dart, Swift, C, C++, Objective C, JavaScript, or Java.
You have developed UIs using declarative frameworks, like React, Flutter, Swift UI or Jetpack Compose.
STEM degree or equivalent work experience.
Mastery of college-level Data Structures and Algorithms. For example, you feel comfortable explaining how Dijkstra's Algorithm and Merge Sort work.
Proficiency with Git. For example, you feel comfortable explaining the difference between a merge and a rebase.
Startup attitude‚Äîyou run or participated in entrepreneurial projects and understand how to balance theoretical research with creating value for customers.
Motivational Letter (which you can write in the "About You" section of our online application). This is your opportunity to show us that you that you read this job posting and care about the position. Bonus points if your letter includes one of the points in the next section.




One of these would make you a perfect fit

You have a solid experience with Flutter and at least one of the popular state management frameworks, like BLoC.
You can showcase a native mobile project‚Äîyou have already developed a native UI and dealt with problems like keychain and provisioning profiles.
You have worked on an app with thousands of daily active users.
You are the creator or maintainer of a popular and relevant open source project.




What you will get working with us

Competitive pay and equity.
The latest apple hardware (Mac, iPhone, Headphones, and anything else you might need).
1-month vacation per year + untracked time off if you need more.
Freedom to work from wherever you want.
A diverse and international work environment that operates in English‚Äîwe come from countries like Italy, Lebanon, Sweden, Brazil, Japan, Argentina, and we want to keep growing!
Feel the excitement of working on products downloaded by millions of users.

title: IT SOLUTION ARCHITECT
description:
All‚Äôinterno della nostra divisione Consulting siamo alla ricerca di un Solution Architect per clienti leader nel settore Telco e Finance

La Figura Si Occuper√†, Collaborer√† Con La Struttura Commerciale e Si Occuper√† Di Garantire Il Supporto Tecnico Durante L‚Äôintero Processo Di Vendita e Soluzioni Ad Elevato Contenuto Tecnologico Con Particolare Riferimento Alle Seguenti Aree

Soluzioni di Cloud Computing

Attivit√†

Indirizza, pianifica e coordina la progettazione di soluzioni e servizi ICT e l‚Äôingegnerizzazione delle offerte per i clienti;

Collabora con i diversi stakeholder nella preparazione delle risposte alle Gare, Request for Information, Request for Proposal

Assicura, nel rispetto degli obiettivi assegnati, la corretta gestione dei costi e della qualit√† dei servizi oggetto di proposta

Hard Skill

Architetture sviluppate su piattaforme Microsoft e LINUX/UNIX (Web&Application Services, Messaging&Collaboration, Condivisione di contenuti, Sistemi di autenticazione);

Cloud-platform Openstack e/o vmware e tematiche di Hybrid o Multi-Cloud
